trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Dynamic scheduling failure. [\S]*"].iregexp("Dynamic scheduling failure. [\S]*")}=1
trigger.name: Acropolis Dynamic Scheduler Status
trigger.description: Category Type: Performance Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Dynamic scheduling failure. Name:Acropolis Dynamic Scheduler Status Message:Dynamic scheduling failure. {reason} Description:One or more nodes have resource contention. This imbalance can cause performance bottlenecks on the node(s) affected. Description:One or more nodes have resource contention. This imbalance can cause performance bottlenecks on the node(s) affected. Causes:Cluster may have insufficient CPU or Controller VM resources. Cluster may have insufficient resources to satisfy VM group affinity policies or VM host affinity policies. Resolution:Shut down unneeded VMs to free cluster resources. Expand the cluster to add resources. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["[\S]* has [\S]* aged third-party backup snapshot(s) and they m"].iregexp("[\S]* has [\S]* aged third-party backup snapshot(s) and they m")}=1
trigger.name: Aged Third-party Backup Snapshot Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Aged third-party backup snapshots present Name:Aged Third-party Backup Snapshot Check Message:{pd_name} has {num_snapshot} aged third-party backup snapshot(s) and they may unnecessarily consume storage space in the cluster. Description:Check for aged third-party backup snapshots. Description:Check for aged third-party backup snapshots. Causes:Third-party backup snapshots are present in the cluster longer than the configured threshold. Resolution:Contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/4273

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to restore agent VM with UUID [\S]*."].iregexp("Failed to restore agent VM with UUID [\S]*.")}=1
trigger.name: Agent VM Restoration
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Node Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Hardware Scope:kNode Title:Agent VM Restoration Failure Name:Agent VM Restoration Message:Failed to restore agent VM with UUID {vm_uuid}. Description:Failure to Restore Agent VM Description:Failure to Restore Agent VM Causes:Not enough memory/CPU resources on this node. Resolution:Shut down unneeded VMs to free cluster resources or expand the cluster to add resources. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8010

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["On host [\S]*, [\S]*"].iregexp("On host [\S]*, [\S]*")}=1
trigger.name: AHV audit disk space check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Node Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Host-Disk Scope:kNode Title:Disk utilization for audit partition is more than 75%. Name:AHV audit disk space check Message:On host {host_ip}, {alert_msg} Description:Checks if the disk usage for audit partition is higher than 75%. Description:Checks if the disk usage for audit partition is higher than 75%. Causes:Disk utilization for audit partition is more than 75%. Resolution:Refer KB11680 to address the disk utilization over 75%. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/11680

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["File integrity tool has found modifications on host [\S]*."].iregexp("File integrity tool has found modifications on host [\S]*.")}=1
trigger.name: AHV file integrity check
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Node Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Host-Disk Scope:kNode Title:File integrity check found modifications. Name:AHV file integrity check Message:File integrity tool has found modifications on host {host_ip}. Description:Weekly file integrity check to detect any modifications in baseline configuration of host. Description:Weekly file integrity check to detect any modifications in baseline configuration of host. Causes:Detected unexpected modifications in baseline configuration of host. Resolution:Refer KB10414 to review the detected changes. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/10414

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Forwarding logs to remote server is failing on host [\S]*."].iregexp("Forwarding logs to remote server is failing on host [\S]*.")}=1
trigger.name: AHV remote log forwarding check
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Node Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Host-Disk Scope:kNode Title:Forwarding logs to remote server is failing. Name:AHV remote log forwarding check Message:Forwarding logs to remote server is failing on host {host_ip}. Description:Check log forwarding to remote server. Description:Check log forwarding to remote server. Causes:Forwarding logs to remote server is failing. Resolution:Check failure causes for forwarding the logs to remote server. Refer KB10811. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/10811

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Upgrade the version of AHV on the host to [\S]*."].iregexp("Upgrade the version of AHV on the host to [\S]*.")}=1
trigger.name: AHV Version Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Node Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Node-Services Scope:kNode Title:Detected incompatible AHV version Name:AHV Version Check Message:Upgrade the version of AHV on the host to {desired_ver}{or_later}. Description:Check if compatible AHV version is installed on host. Description:Check if compatible AHV version is installed on host. Causes:The installed AHV version is not compatible with the current AOS version. Resolution:Upgrade the version of AHV on the host to a version which is compatible with the current AOS version. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/5286

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Baseline configuration changes"].iregexp("Baseline configuration changes")}=1
trigger.name: AIDE baseline configuration changes check
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Node Cluster ControllerVM Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Cluster-Node Scope:kNode Title:Baseline configuration changes Name:AIDE baseline configuration changes check Message:{message} Description:Checks the log files of aide for changes to baseline configs if aide is enabled Description:Checks the log files of aide for changes to baseline configs if aide is enabled Causes:Baseline configurations changed Resolution:Check changed files and revert their changes if needed Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/10461

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Unable to send alert Email from the Controller VM [\S]* "].iregexp("Unable to send alert Email from the Controller VM [\S]* ")}=1
trigger.name: Alert E-mail Failure
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Alert E-mail Failure Name:Alert E-mail Failure Message:Unable to send alert Email from the Controller VM {service_vm_external_ip} due to {reason}. Description:Failed to send alert Emails Description:Failed to send alert Emails Causes:Issue with the Email client Resolution:Contact Nutanix Support. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/9937

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Cluster contains an unsupported mix of nodes with different storage combinations"].iregexp("Cluster contains an unsupported mix of nodes with different storage combinations")}=1
trigger.name: All-flash Node Intermixed Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Host-Disk Scope:kCluster Title:Cluster contains an unsupported mix of nodes with different storage combinations Name:All-flash Node Intermixed Check Message:{alert_msg} Description:Checks that all-flash nodes do not coexist with non-all-flash nodes in a cluster Description:Checks that all-flash nodes do not coexist with non-all-flash nodes in a cluster Causes:All-flash nodes and non-all-flash nodes are put into the same cluster Resolution:Remove either all-flash nodes or non-all-flash nodes from the cluster Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/3551

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["The IP corresponding to [\S]* could not be resolved with the following DNS "].iregexp("The IP corresponding to [\S]* could not be resolved with the following DNS ")}=1
trigger.name: An Advanced Networking Controller service's DNS name was not resolvable
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability Network Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Host-Network Scope:kCluster Title:Unable to resolve an Advanced Networking Controller service's DNS name Name:An Advanced Networking Controller service's DNS name was not resolvable Message:The IP corresponding to {url} could not be resolved with the following DNS servers: {dns_servers} Description:Atlas was unable to resolve an Advanced Networking Controller service's DNS name. Description:Atlas was unable to resolve an Advanced Networking Controller service's DNS name. Causes:PC nameserver configuration is incorrect. Resolution:Verify nameserver configuration on PC. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/9365

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["The service at [\S]* did not respond"].iregexp("The service at [\S]* did not respond")}=1
trigger.name: An Advanced Networking Controller service did not respond
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability Network Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Host-Network Scope:kCluster Title:Advanced Networking Controller is not Healthy Name:An Advanced Networking Controller service did not respond Message:The service at {url} did not respond Description:Atlas could not connect to an Advanced Networking Controller service. Description:Atlas could not connect to an Advanced Networking Controller service. Causes:The Advanced Networking Controller is not Healthy. Resolution:Verify the health of the Advanced Networking Controller. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/9366

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["File Analytics VM [\S]* has a high CPU usage of [\S]*%"].iregexp("File Analytics VM [\S]* has a high CPU usage of [\S]*%")}=1
trigger.name: Analytics VM high CPU usage.
trigger.description: Category Type: Performance Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:Analytics VM high CPU usage. Name:Analytics VM high CPU usage. Message:File Analytics VM {avm_ip} has a high CPU usage of {usage_percent}% Description:File Analytics VM {avm_ip} has a high CPU usage of {usage_percent}% Description:File Analytics VM {avm_ip} has a high CPU usage of {usage_percent}% Causes:File Analytics VM is performing too many CPU intensive operations. Resolution:Monitor which component has a high CPU usage and reduce the processing load. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["File Analytics VM [\S]* has a high disk usage of [\S]*%"].iregexp("File Analytics VM [\S]* has a high disk usage of [\S]*%")}=1
trigger.name: Analytics VM high disk usage.
trigger.description: Category Type: Capacity Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:Analytics VM high disk usage. Name:Analytics VM high disk usage. Message:File Analytics VM {avm_ip} has a high disk usage of {usage_percent}% Description:File Analytics VM {avm_ip} has a high disk usage of {usage_percent}% Description:File Analytics VM {avm_ip} has a high disk usage of {usage_percent}% Causes:Extensive disk usage on the File Analytics VM Resolution:Add more capacity to the File Analytics VM or delete some data. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["The percent memory available on File Analytics VM [\S]* is {memory_avail"].iregexp("The percent memory available on File Analytics VM [\S]* is {memory_avail")}=1
trigger.name: Analytics VM low memory available.
trigger.description: Category Type: Performance Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:Analytics VM low memory available. Name:Analytics VM low memory available. Message:The percent memory available on File Analytics VM {avm_ip} is {memory_available} which is low Description:The memory available on File Analytics VM {avm_ip} is {memory_available} bytes which is low. Description:The memory available on File Analytics VM {avm_ip} is {memory_available} bytes which is low. Causes:Excessive memory usage on the File Analytics VM Resolution:Add more RAM Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["One or more components of the File Analytics VM [\S]* are not functionin"].iregexp("One or more components of the File Analytics VM [\S]* are not functionin")}=1
trigger.name: Analytics VM one or more component failure.
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:Analytics VM one or more component failure. Name:Analytics VM one or more component failure. Message:One or more components of the File Analytics VM {avm_ip} are not functioning properly or have failed. Description:One or more components of the File Analytics VM {avm_ip} are not functioning properly or have failed. Description:One or more components of the File Analytics VM {avm_ip} are not functioning properly or have failed. Causes:One or more File Analytics VM components have failed. Resolution:Contact Nutanix Support. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8239

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Application logs from '[\S]*' to '[\S]*' are now available for "].iregexp("Application logs from '[\S]*' to '[\S]*' are now available for ")}=1
trigger.name: Applications Archive Ready
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Applications Archive ready for download. Name:Applications Archive Ready Message:Application logs from '{start_time}' to '{end_time}' are now available for download and archival. Please go to Calm > Settings to download them. Description:Archive ready for download. Description:Archive ready for download. Causes:Archival process archived the runlogs. Resolution:Make sure you download the archive. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to [\S]* for the protection domain '[\S]*' "].iregexp("Failed to [\S]* for the protection domain '[\S]*' ")}=1
trigger.name: Authentication Failed in Witness
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Witness Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Authentication failed in Witness Name:Authentication Failed in Witness Message:Failed to {operation} for the protection domain '{protection_domain_name}' to the remote site '{remote_name}'. Reason: Authentication failure in Witness Description:Authentication failed in Witness Description:Authentication failed in Witness Causes:Witness configured with incorrect credentials Resolution:Configure Witness with correct credentials Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/4376

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Metro availability for the protection domain '[\S]*' to "].iregexp("Metro availability for the protection domain '[\S]*' to ")}=1
trigger.name: Automatic Promote Metro Availability
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Remote Site Scope:kCluster Title:Metro Availability Is Promoted Name:Automatic Promote Metro Availability Message:Metro availability for the protection domain '{protection_domain_name}' to the remote site '{remote_name}' is promoted because of '{reason}'. Description:Metro availability is promoted. Description:Metro availability is promoted. Causes:Remote site unreachable. Resolution:(A) Check if cluster service is healthy at remote cluster. (B) Ensure VMs are running first at the promoted side. In the case of storage only outage in order to restore VM availability follow the procedure in the Prism Web Console Guide, section: <Recovering from a Storage-only Failure on the Primary Site>. After that verify the previously active cluster is healthy before re-enabling metro availability. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8279

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["The remote availability zone [\S]* is unreachable."].iregexp("The remote availability zone [\S]* is unreachable.")}=1
trigger.name: Availability Zone Connection Failure
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Availability Zone Connection Failure Name:Availability Zone Connection Failure Message:The remote availability zone {az_url} is unreachable. Description:The remote availability zone {az_url} is unreachable. Description:The remote availability zone {az_url} is unreachable. Causes:(A) Services on remote site might be down. (B) Connection might be missing on remote site. (C) Access tokens might have expired. Resolution:Unpair from the remote availability zone, if already paired. Pair with the remote availability zone again. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8252

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Protection Policy [\S]* has invalid Availability Zone conf"].iregexp("Protection Policy [\S]* has invalid Availability Zone conf")}=1
trigger.name: Availability Zone Validation Failed
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Internal Scope:kCluster Title:Invalid Availability Zone details configured in Protection Policy. Name:Availability Zone Validation Failed Message:Protection Policy {protection_rule_name} has invalid Availability Zone configured. Description:Availability Zone referenced in the Protection Policy is not Valid. Description:Availability Zone referenced in the Protection Policy is not Valid. Causes:Invalid Availability Zone configured in the Protection Policy. Resolution:Update the Availability Zone in Protection Policy. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["AWS cloud instance at remote [\S]* not configured properly."].iregexp("AWS cloud instance at remote [\S]* not configured properly.")}=1
trigger.name: AWS Instance Check
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Cluster Affected Entity Type:remote_site Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:AWS cloud instance not configured properly. Name:AWS Instance Check Message:AWS cloud instance at remote {remote_name} not configured properly. Description:Verify that the AWS cloud instances have recommended configuration. Description:Verify that the AWS cloud instances have recommended configuration. Causes:AWS instance does not have at least two 190GB+ disks. Resolution:Make sure that AWS instance has at least two 190GB+ disks. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/3814

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Encryption of container [\S]* is not progressing. Contact Nutanix "].iregexp("Encryption of container [\S]* is not progressing. Contact Nutanix ")}=1
trigger.name: Background Encryption Stuck
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:container Subcategory Type:CVM-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Background Encryption Stuck Name:Background Encryption Stuck Message:Encryption of container {container_id} is not progressing. Contact Nutanix support for further assistance. Description:Background Encryption Stuck Description:Background Encryption Stuck Causes:Oplog entries, extent groups, NFS entries or other components are not being encrypted. Resolution:Contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Beam service is unreachable. Calm showback calculations will be affected"].iregexp("Beam service is unreachable. Calm showback calculations will be affected")}=1
trigger.name: Beam is unreachable
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Calm showback is unable to reach beam service Name:Beam is unreachable Message:Beam service is unreachable. Calm showback calculations will be affected Description:Beam service is unreachable. Calm showback calculations will be affected Description:Beam service is unreachable. Calm showback calculations will be affected Causes:Prism central may not have internet connectivity or beam service is unavailable. Resolution:Review KB-6664 for further troubleshooting. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/6664

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Boot RAID volumes on CVM [\S]* are degraded."].iregexp("Boot RAID volumes on CVM [\S]* are degraded.")}=1
trigger.name: Boot RAID Health
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator ControllerVM Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Disk Scope:kNode Title:CVM Boot Raid Degraded Name:Boot RAID Health Message:Boot RAID volumes on CVM {service_vm_external_ip} are degraded. Description:Checks the health of boot RAID volumes. Description:Checks the health of boot RAID volumes. Causes:RAID volume may be in an abnormal state due to power loss or temporary or permanent drive failure. Resolution:Verify boot disk status from the web console Hardware page and replace the disk if required. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/2463

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Discovered that the Calm policy engine internal service running on {policy_"].iregexp("Discovered that the Calm policy engine internal service running on {policy_")}=1
trigger.name: Calm Policy Engine Service Down
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Calm Policy Engine Internal Service has Stopped Working Name:Calm Policy Engine Service Down Message:Discovered that the Calm policy engine internal service running on {policy_engine_ip} is not working: '{service_names}' Description:Calm Policy Engine internal service is down Description:Calm Policy Engine internal service is down Causes:Calm Policy Engine internal service may have stopped working Resolution:Please refer to KB-9456 Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/9456

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["All nodes are not running on same Calm version"].iregexp("All nodes are not running on same Calm version")}=1
trigger.name: Calm Version Mismatch
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Calm Version Mismatch Name:Calm Version Mismatch Message:All nodes are not running on same Calm version Description:Calm Version Mismatch Description:Calm Version Mismatch Causes:Failed LCM upgrade Resolution:Refer to KB 7528 for resolution Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/7528

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["[\S]* fault tolerance is reduced from desired fault tolerance({desired_f"].iregexp("[\S]* fault tolerance is reduced from desired fault tolerance({desired_f")}=1
trigger.name: Cassandra Domain Fault Tolerance Critical
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:CVM-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Domain Fault Tolerance is low for Metadata Name:Cassandra Domain Fault Tolerance Critical Message:{domain} fault tolerance is reduced from desired fault tolerance({desired_fault_tolerance}) to {current_fault_tolerance} for metadata. Description:Domain fault tolerance is low for metadata Description:Domain fault tolerance is low for metadata Causes:One or more partitions have lower domain fault tolerance than the desired fault tolerance. Resolution:Please add more nodes to reduce the skew in number of nodes in each domain. It is preferred to maintain almost equal number of nodes in all the domains to achieve best domain fault tolerance. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Nodes [\S]* have shorter tokens than recommended"].iregexp("Nodes [\S]* have shorter tokens than recommended")}=1
trigger.name: Cassandra Invalid Token check
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:One or more Cassandra nodes have invalid tokens Name:Cassandra Invalid Token check Message:Nodes {node_list} have shorter tokens than recommended Description:Check for short tokens in Cassandra Description:Check for short tokens in Cassandra Causes:One or more Cassandra nodes have short tokens Resolution:Refer to KB 6656. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/6656

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Cassandra service is running out of memory. Contact Nutanix support for ass"].iregexp("Cassandra service is running out of memory. Contact Nutanix support for ass")}=1
trigger.name: Cassandra memory usage
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Node-Services Scope:kNode Title:Cassandra service is running out of memory Name:Cassandra memory usage Message:Cassandra service is running out of memory. Contact Nutanix support for assistance. Description:Check if the Cassandra service is running out of memory. Description:Check if the Cassandra service is running out of memory. Causes:Cassandra has crossed memory threshold more than 5 times in the last 3 minutes. Resolution:Contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1576

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Metadata service on node [\S]* is restarting frequently due to long "].iregexp("Metadata service on node [\S]* is restarting frequently due to long ")}=1
trigger.name: Cassandra Restarting Due to Long GC Pauses
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Services Scope:kNode Title:Metadata service restarting frequently due to long GC pauses. Name:Cassandra Restarting Due to Long GC Pauses Message:Metadata service on node {ip_address} is restarting frequently due to long garbage collection pauses. Description:Metadata service restarting frequently due to long GC pauses. Description:Metadata service restarting frequently due to long GC pauses. Causes:Metadata Service is undergoing long garbage collection pauses. This could possibly be due to cluster overload. Resolution:Engage Nutanix Support to investigate why the Metadata service is significantly overloaded. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Cassandra service has recently crashed. Contact Nutanix support for assista"].iregexp("Cassandra service has recently crashed. Contact Nutanix support for assista")}=1
trigger.name: Cassandra service restarts check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Node-Services Scope:kNode Title:Cassandra service crashed Name:Cassandra service restarts check Message:Cassandra service has recently crashed. Contact Nutanix support for assistance. Description:Check if Cassandra service is crashing continuously. Description:Check if Cassandra service is crashing continuously. Causes:Cassandra service has restarted frequently in the last 30 minutes. Resolution:Contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1592

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Multiple Cassandra nodes have similar tokens"].iregexp("Multiple Cassandra nodes have similar tokens")}=1
trigger.name: Cassandra Similar Token check
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Multiple Cassandra nodes have similar tokens Name:Cassandra Similar Token check Message:Multiple Cassandra nodes have similar tokens Description:Check for similar tokens in Cassandra Description:Check for similar tokens in Cassandra Causes:Multiple Cassandra nodes have similar tokens Resolution:Refer to KB 4301. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/4301

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["SSD on node(s) [\S]* is not sized for the expected metadata growth. P"].iregexp("SSD on node(s) [\S]* is not sized for the expected metadata growth. P")}=1
trigger.name: Cassandra SSD Size check
trigger.description: Category Type: Performance Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Disk Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:SSD tier size is small on one or more nodes. Name:Cassandra SSD Size check Message:SSD on node(s) {node_list} is not sized for the expected metadata growth. Projected metadata growth is going beyond 50% of SSD capacity. Increase SSD disk capacity by at least {expected_ssd_size_list} on {node_list} respectively Description:Check if SSD disks are sized appropriately relative to HDD disk size. Description:Check if SSD disks are sized appropriately relative to HDD disk size. Causes:SSD tier size is small to hold the metadata when cluster reaches maximum capacity Resolution:SSD tier size of specified nodes has to be increased. For more information, see KB-8842 or engage Support Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8842

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Health warnings detected in metadata service"].iregexp("Health warnings detected in metadata service")}=1
trigger.name: Cassandra SSTable Health Warning check
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability Cluster Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Node-Services Scope:kNode Title:Health warnings detected in metadata service Name:Cassandra SSTable Health Warning check Message:Health warnings detected in metadata service Description:Check for cassandra SStables with health warnings Description:Check for cassandra SStables with health warnings Causes:Cassandra SSTable health warning Resolution:Refer to KB 7077. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/7077

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Disk [\S]* for node [\S]* not replaced. Node perform"].iregexp("Disk [\S]* for node [\S]* not replaced. Node perform")}=1
trigger.name: Cassandra Waiting For Disk Replacement
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Services Scope:kNode Title:Cassandra Waiting For Disk Replacement Name:Cassandra Waiting For Disk Replacement Message:Disk {disk_id} for node {service_vm_external_ip} not replaced. Node performing disk replace: {ip_address_doing_ring_change} Description:Metadata disk not replaced for Disk Replace Op Description:Metadata disk not replaced for Disk Replace Op Causes:Disk not replaced for Disk Replace Op. Resolution:Ensure that a replacement disk is present on the node undergoing disk replace. If it is and the alert persists, contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Cerebro stats collection has failed."].iregexp("Cerebro stats collection has failed.")}=1
trigger.name: Cerebro stats collector
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Internal Scope:kCluster Title:Cerebro Stats Collector Failed. Name:Cerebro stats collector Message:Cerebro stats collection has failed. Description:Collect Cerebro stats and publish to CFS. Description:Collect Cerebro stats and publish to CFS. Causes:(A) Snapshot chain length has exceeded the threshold limit. (B) Garbage collection is not able to keep up with the configured RPO. Resolution:Lower the frequency of the snapshot schedule. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/6200

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Multiple tasks are not making progress on PE:[\S]* because of long"].iregexp("Multiple tasks are not making progress on PE:[\S]* because of long")}=1
trigger.name: Cerebro tasks Stuck
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Data Protection tasks are not progressing. Name:Cerebro tasks Stuck Message:Multiple tasks are not making progress on PE:{cluster_name} because of long running replication tasks. Description:Replication tasks are not progressing. Description:Replication tasks are not progressing. Causes:Replication tasks are running for long. Resolution:Please reach out to Nutanix Support to help abort the long running tasks. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Two node cluster state changed: [\S]*"].iregexp("Two node cluster state changed: [\S]*")}=1
trigger.name: Change in state of two node cluster
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:CVM-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Two node cluster state changed Name:Change in state of two node cluster Message:Two node cluster state changed: {message} Description:Change in state of two node cluster Description:Change in state of two node cluster Causes:There is a change in availability of a node (or network between the nodes). Resolution:Two node cluster will auto-heal when node (or network between the nodes) is available again. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8284

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Cluster virtual IP address [\S]* is in a different subnet from the cluster "].iregexp("Cluster virtual IP address [\S]* is in a different subnet from the cluster ")}=1
trigger.name: Check that cluster virtual IP address is part of cluster external subnet
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Check that cluster virtual IP address is part of cluster external subnet Name:Check that cluster virtual IP address is part of cluster external subnet Message:Cluster virtual IP address {vip} is in a different subnet from the cluster external subnet {external_subnet} Description:Check that cluster virtual IP address is part of cluster external subnet Description:Check that cluster virtual IP address is part of cluster external subnet Causes:Cluster virtual IP address is in a different subnet from the cluster external subnet Resolution:Ensure that cluster virtual IP address is part of cluster external subnet Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/3817

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Found [\S]* clones related to protection domain [\S]* which are older"].iregexp("Found [\S]* clones related to protection domain [\S]* which are older")}=1
trigger.name: Clone Age Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Found old clones on cluster. Name:Clone Age Check Message:Found {count} clones related to protection domain {pd_name} which are older than the currently configured threshold of {clone_age_threshold} days. Description:Check for any clones restored from protection domain snapshots that are too old. Description:Check for any clones restored from protection domain snapshots that are too old. Causes:Clones were not removed automatically. Possible abrupt exit of backup operation. Resolution:Remove any clones restored from protection domain snapshots that are too old. Please contact backup application provider to remove the clone. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/4298

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Found [\S]* clones related to protection domain [\S]* which is more t"].iregexp("Found [\S]* clones related to protection domain [\S]* which is more t")}=1
trigger.name: Clone Count Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Too many clones on cluster. Name:Clone Count Check Message:Found {count} clones related to protection domain {pd_name} which is more than the currently configured threshold of {clone_count_threshold}. Description:Check if there are too many clones restored from protection domain snapshots. Description:Check if there are too many clones restored from protection domain snapshots. Causes:Clones were not removed automatically. Resolution:Remove any clones restored from protection domain snapshots that are too old. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/4298

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to configure cloud appliance for remote site [\S]*. {re"].iregexp("Failed to configure cloud appliance for remote site [\S]*. {re")}=1
trigger.name: Cloud Appliance Deployment Failed
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Cloud Appliance Deployment Failed Name:Cloud Appliance Deployment Failed Message:Failed to configure cloud appliance for remote site {remote_site_name}. {reason}. Description:Cloud Appliance Deployment Failed Description:Cloud Appliance Deployment Failed Causes:Resource quota for buckets/instances/storage accounts exhausted for cloud account. AWS credentials do not have permissions to perform S3/SG/EC2 related operations. Cloud CVM deployed was not able to reach the Internet. Resolution:Make sure that account has enough quota to create new buckets/instances. Make sure that AWS IAM user has permissions to perform S3/SG/EC2 operations. Make sure that the subnet in which cloud appliance is being deployed allows Internet connectivity. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Cloud cluster does not have all recommended gflags set."].iregexp("Cloud cluster does not have all recommended gflags set.")}=1
trigger.name: Cloud Gflags Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:remote_site Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Cloud cluster does not have all recommended gflags set. Name:Cloud Gflags Check Message:Cloud cluster does not have all recommended gflags set. Description:Check if cloud remote sites have recommended gflags set. Description:Check if cloud remote sites have recommended gflags set. Causes:Cluster may have been upgraded to a newer version. Resolution:Set recommended gflags. The cloud_connect_fix script can be run. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/4249

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Alert raised on cloud remote site [\S]*: [\S]*"].iregexp("Alert raised on cloud remote site [\S]*: [\S]*")}=1
trigger.name: Cloud Remote Alert
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:remote_site Subcategory Type:Cluster-Remote Site Scope:kCluster Title:Alert raised on cloud remote site {remote_name}: {alert_message} Name:Cloud Remote Alert Message:Alert raised on cloud remote site {remote_name}: {alert_message} Description:Alert generated on cloud remote site. Description:Alert generated on cloud remote site. Causes:Various Resolution:Resolve the issue stated in the alert. If you cannot resolve the issue, please contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Protection Rule: '[\S]*' is processed but following issue "].iregexp("Protection Rule: '[\S]*' is processed but following issue ")}=1
trigger.name: Cluster does not support Synchronous Replication
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Internal Scope:kCluster Title:Cluster does not support Synchronous Replication. Name:Cluster does not support Synchronous Replication Message:Protection Rule: '{protection_rule_name}' is processed but following issue is observed - '{reason}'. Description:Cluster does not support Synchronous Replication. Description:Cluster does not support Synchronous Replication. Causes:The cluster given in the Protection Rule does not support Synchronous Replication. Resolution:Please use a cluster that supports Synchronous Replication. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Single node cluster with CVM [\S]* is running in overrid"].iregexp("Single node cluster with CVM [\S]* is running in overrid")}=1
trigger.name: Cluster In Override Mode
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:CVM-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Cluster In Override Mode Name:Cluster In Override Mode Message:Single node cluster with CVM {service_vm_external_ip} is running in override mode due to {reason}. Description:Single-node cluster is in override mode. Description:Single-node cluster is in override mode. Causes:One of the metadata SSDs has failed. Resolution:Replace the failed SSD. Refer to the Nutanix documentation for instructions. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8132

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Single node cluster with CVM [\S]* is running in read-on"].iregexp("Single node cluster with CVM [\S]* is running in read-on")}=1
trigger.name: Cluster In Read-Only Mode
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:CVM-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Cluster In Read-Only Mode Name:Cluster In Read-Only Mode Message:Single node cluster with CVM {service_vm_external_ip} is running in read-only mode due to {reason}. Description:Single-node cluster is in read-only mode. Description:Single-node cluster is in read-only mode. Causes:One of the metadata SSDs has failed. Resolution:Replace the failed SSD. Refer to the Nutanix documentation for instructions. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8156

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to join AOS cluster to domain [\S]*: [\S]*"].iregexp("Failed to join AOS cluster to domain [\S]*: [\S]*")}=1
trigger.name: ClusterJoinToDomainFailure
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Cluster Scope:kCluster Title:Cluster Join to Domain Failure Name:ClusterJoinToDomainFailure Message:Failed to join AOS cluster to domain {domain_name}: {reason} Description:Failed to join AOS cluster to domain. Description:Failed to join AOS cluster to domain. Causes:Cluster could not be joined to domain because of incorrect login credentials or other causes. Resolution:Please ensure that the specified domain account credentials are valid and that the virtual computer object representing the AOS cluster does not already exist. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8080

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Cluster Service: [\S]* is down on the Controller VM [\S]*."].iregexp("Cluster Service: [\S]* is down on the Controller VM [\S]*.")}=1
trigger.name: Cluster Services Down Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Node-Services Scope:kNode Title:Cluster services are down Name:Cluster Services Down Check Message:Cluster Service: {service_name} is down on the Controller VM {ip_address}. Description:Check that no services are down in the cluster. Description:Check that no services are down in the cluster. Causes:One or more services in the cluster are down. Resolution:[If the reason for the service(s) being down is unknown, run "ncc health_checks run_all", perform log collection covering the period of this alert timestamp, and provide the results to Nutanix Support via case attachment for further investigation. If due to planned maintenance or triage, please ensure the service is started again using "cluster start" as soon as possible. Report any reoccurring issues.] Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1518

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["There have been multiple service restarts of [\S]* across all Controll"].iregexp("There have been multiple service restarts of [\S]* across all Controll")}=1
trigger.name: Cluster Services Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Cluster Service Restarting Frequently Name:Cluster Services Status Message:There have been multiple service restarts of {services} across all Controller VM(s). Latest crash of these services have occurred at {timestamps} respectively. Description:Check if services have restarted recently across the cluster. Description:Check if services have restarted recently across the cluster. Causes:This alert indicates that one or more services in the cluster were restarted. Resolution:If this alert occurs once or infrequently, no action is necessary. If it is frequent, contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/3378

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Host network uplink configuration update on Host(s):'[\S]*' failed du"].iregexp("Host network uplink configuration update on Host(s):'[\S]*' failed du")}=1
trigger.name: ClusterVswitch Configuration Update Failed
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Node Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Host-Network Scope:kCluster Title:Host Network Uplink Configuration Failed. Name:ClusterVswitch Configuration Update Failed Message:Host network uplink configuration update on Host(s):'{node_uuid}' failed due to the reason: {cause} Description:Failed to apply host uplink configuration on the host(s). Description:Failed to apply host uplink configuration on the host(s). Causes:Host uplink configuration failed to apply on the host(s). Resolution:Use manage_ovs to configure the host individually after correcting errors. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Network traffic hitting Flow security policies is not being logged."].iregexp("Network traffic hitting Flow security policies is not being logged.")}=1
trigger.name: Conntrack Mode Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Node Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Node-Services Scope:kNode Title:Flow policy-hit logging is not functional Name:Conntrack Mode Check Message:Network traffic hitting Flow security policies is not being logged. Description:Checks whether AHV is logging network traffic hitting Flow security policies. Description:Checks whether AHV is logging network traffic hitting Flow security policies. Causes:Prism Central, Prism Element & AHV versions may be incompatible. Memory requirements may not be met for policy-hit logging to be enabled. Resolution:Ensure AOS version is at least 5.11 on Prism Central and on Prism Element clusters managed by it. Increase memory available on AHV and upgrade to the latest AHV version. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/7098

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to create a snapshot of protection domain [\S]* a"].iregexp("Failed to create a snapshot of protection domain [\S]* a")}=1
trigger.name: Consistency Group Configuration
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Entity conflict in Consistency Groups Name:Consistency Group Configuration Message:Failed to create a snapshot of protection domain {protection_domain_name} as some files in consistency group {consistency_group_name} overlap other consistency groups. Description:Entity conflict in consistency group(s) Description:Entity conflict in consistency group(s) Causes:VMs with common files are not in the same Consistency Group. Resolution:Put VMs with common files in the same Consistency Group. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Consistency Group '[\S]*' contains stale members."].iregexp("Consistency Group '[\S]*' contains stale members.")}=1
trigger.name: Consistency Group Contains Stale Members
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Consistency Group Scope:kCluster Title:Consistency Group Contains Stale Members Name:Consistency Group Contains Stale Members Message:Consistency Group '{consistency_group_config_name}' contains stale members. Description:Consistency Group contains one or more members that have been deleted. Description:Consistency Group contains one or more members that have been deleted. Causes:One or more VMs or Volume Groups belonging to the Consistency Group may have been deleted. Resolution:Remove the deleted members from the Consistency Group configuration. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/11413

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to protect the Volume Group [\S]* belonging to "].iregexp("Failed to protect the Volume Group [\S]* belonging to ")}=1
trigger.name: Consistency Group VG Conflicts
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Disk Scope:kCluster Title:Consistency Group Conflict Occurred. Name:Consistency Group VG Conflicts Message:Failed to protect the Volume Group {volume_group_config_name} belonging to the Consistency Group {consistency_group_name}, because of {reason}. Description:Unable to protect Volume Group due to conflicting protection policy and Consistency Group configurations. Description:Unable to protect Volume Group due to conflicting protection policy and Consistency Group configurations. Causes:Multiple protection policies are applied on some of the members present in the Consistency Group. No protection policy is applied to protect some of the members present in the Consistency Group. Members in the same Consistency Group have different protection policies that can be applied. Resolution:Ensure that exactly one protection policy is applied to protect the defined members in a Consistency Group. Ensure that exactly one protection policy is applied to protect the defined members in a Consistency Group. Ensure that the members in a Consistency Group are protected by the same protection policy. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/10572

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to protect the VM [\S]* belonging to the Consistency Group {cons"].iregexp("Failed to protect the VM [\S]* belonging to the Consistency Group {cons")}=1
trigger.name: Consistency Group VM Conflicts
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:vm Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Virtual Machine Scope:kCluster Title:Consistency Group Conflict Occurred. Name:Consistency Group VM Conflicts Message:Failed to protect the VM {vm_name} belonging to the Consistency Group {consistency_group_name}, because of {reason}. Description:Unable to protect VM due to conflicting protection policy and Consistency Group configurations. Description:Unable to protect VM due to conflicting protection policy and Consistency Group configurations. Causes:Multiple protection policies are applied on some of the members present in the Consistency Group. No protection policy is applied to protect some of the members present in the Consistency Group. Members in the same Consistency Group have different protection policies that can be applied. Resolution:Ensure that exactly one protection policy is applied to protect the defined members in a Consistency Group. Ensure that exactly one protection policy is applied to protect the defined members in a Consistency Group. Ensure that the members in a Consistency Group are protected by the same protection policy. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/10571

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["CPS deployment of cluster with cluster id [\S]* is running in evalua"].iregexp("CPS deployment of cluster with cluster id [\S]* is running in evalua")}=1
trigger.name: CPS Deployment Evaluation Mode
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:CPS Deployment Evaluation Mode Name:CPS Deployment Evaluation Mode Message:CPS deployment of cluster with cluster id {cluster_id} is running in evaluation mode. Please apply a license by following the CPS deployment guide. Description:Checks if the CPS deployment is running in evaluation mode. Description:Checks if the CPS deployment is running in evaluation mode. Causes:CPS is running in evaluation mode. Resolution:Apply a license to the deployment. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Temperature of [\S]* exceeded threshold on Controller VM [\S]*. C"].iregexp("Temperature of [\S]* exceeded threshold on Controller VM [\S]*. C")}=1
trigger.name: CPU Temperature
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Hardware Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Host-Hardware Scope:kNode Title:CPU Temperature High Name:CPU Temperature Message:Temperature of {cpu_id} exceeded threshold on Controller VM {ip_address}. Current sensor value is {temperature}C. {fan_speed} Description:Check that cpu temperature is not too high. Description:Check that cpu temperature is not too high. Causes:The device is overheating to the point of imminent failure. Resolution:Ensure that the fans in the block are functioning properly and that the environment is cool enough. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1524

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to fetch temperature of [\S]* on Controller VM [\S]*"].iregexp("Failed to fetch temperature of [\S]* on Controller VM [\S]*")}=1
trigger.name: CPU Temperature Fetch
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Hardware Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Host-Hardware Scope:kNode Title:CPU Temperature Reading Error Name:CPU Temperature Fetch Message:Failed to fetch temperature of {cpu_id} on Controller VM {ip_address} Description:Check that CPU temperature can be fetched. Description:Check that CPU temperature can be fetched. Causes:CPU temperature sensor may be unstable or BMC firmware may be reporting temperature inaccurately. Resolution:Check BMC SEL log. If CPU temperature in SEL log is 0, check CPU temperature sensor. If CPU temperature in SEL is not 0, ensure that the BMC firmware version is correct. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1524

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Temperature of [\S]* is below threshold on Controller VM [\S]*. C"].iregexp("Temperature of [\S]* is below threshold on Controller VM [\S]*. C")}=1
trigger.name: CPU Temperature Low
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability Hardware Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Host-Hardware Scope:kNode Title:CPU Temperature Low Name:CPU Temperature Low Message:Temperature of {cpu_id} is below threshold on Controller VM {ip_address}. Current sensor value is {temperature}C Description:Check that cpu temperature is not too low. Description:Check that cpu temperature is not too low. Causes:BMC or the sensor on CPU may have problem Resolution:Do BMC factory default. If the problem still persists, replace the CPU. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1524

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Chassis [\S]* has CPU configuration problem: [\S]*. This probl"].iregexp("Chassis [\S]* has CPU configuration problem: [\S]*. This probl")}=1
trigger.name: CPU type on chassis check
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Hardware Node Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-CPU Scope:kCluster Title:CPUs of different types or models are in the same chassis. Name:CPU type on chassis check Message:Chassis {chassis_id} has CPU configuration problem: {alert_msg}. This problem may affect the performance and stability of the nodes in the chassis. Chassis cpu info: {chassis_cpu_info} Description:Checks whether CPUs within a chassis are of the same type. Description:Checks whether CPUs within a chassis are of the same type. Causes:A node of a different type was added to the chassis. Resolution:Remove the node that has a different CPU type from the chassis. Before moving a node to a chassis, make sure its CPU type is the same as that of other nodes in the chassis. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/3288

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Multiple cpu_unblock processes are running on [\S]*."].iregexp("Multiple cpu_unblock processes are running on [\S]*.")}=1
trigger.name: cpu_unblock Process Check
trigger.description: Category Type: Performance ControllerVM Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Node-CPU Scope:kNode Title:Multiple cpu_unblock processes running Name:cpu_unblock Process Check Message:Multiple cpu_unblock processes are running on {svm_ip}. Description:Check that there are no stale cpu_unblock processes running. Description:Check that there are no stale cpu_unblock processes running. Causes:Zookeeper restarting frequently on cluster node. Resolution:Kill all cpu_unblock processes and restart cluster services on node. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/5581

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Migration of VM disk '[\S]*' (VM '[\S]*') from source storage co"].iregexp("Migration of VM disk '[\S]*' (VM '[\S]*') from source storage co")}=1
trigger.name: Cross-container disk migration task is paused
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Cross-container disk migration task is paused Name:Cross-container disk migration task is paused Message:Migration of VM disk '{vdisk_name}' (VM '{vm_name}') from source storage container '{src_container_name}' to destination storage container '{dst_container_name}' is paused Description:Cross-container disk migration task is paused. Description:Cross-container disk migration task is paused. Causes:Cross-container disk migration task is paused due to lack of free space in the destination storage container. Resolution:Free up additional space in the destination storage container or abort the parent task. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/10248

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Some VMs [\S]* in cross-hypervisor protection domain [\S]* do not h"].iregexp("Some VMs [\S]* in cross-hypervisor protection domain [\S]* do not h")}=1
trigger.name: Cross Hypervisor NGT Installation Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:NGT installation required. Name:Cross Hypervisor NGT Installation Check Message:Some VMs {vm_list} in cross-hypervisor protection domain {pd_name} do not have NGT installed. Description:Some VMs in protection domain replicating to cross-hypervisor remote site do not have NGT installed. Description:Some VMs in protection domain replicating to cross-hypervisor remote site do not have NGT installed. Causes:Some VMs in protection domain replicating to cross-hypervisor remote site do not have NGT installed. Resolution:Verify that NGT is installed on all the VMs of the protection domain that you want to recover on the remote site. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/3567

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Curator [\S]* scans have repeatedly failed to complete."].iregexp("Curator [\S]* scans have repeatedly failed to complete.")}=1
trigger.name: Curator Scan Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:CVM-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Curator Scan Failure Name:Curator Scan Status Message:Curator {scan_type} scans have repeatedly failed to complete. Description:Curator scan failure. Description:Curator scan failure. Causes:Various Resolution:Contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/3786

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["CVM/PCVM time not synchronized with external servers."].iregexp("CVM/PCVM time not synchronized with external servers.")}=1
trigger.name: CVM/PCVM NTP Time Synchronized
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration ControllerVM Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Network Scope:kNode Title:CVM/PCVM time not synchronized with external servers. Name:CVM/PCVM NTP Time Synchronized Message:{alert_msg} Description:Checks that the {vm_type} is synchronizing time with an NTP server. Description:Checks that the {vm_type} is synchronizing time with an NTP server. Causes:External NTP servers are not configured or are not reachable Resolution:Please verify that the external NTP servers are configured and are reachable. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/4519

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["CVM is not uplinked to active 10Gbps link. Please check your Network config"].iregexp("CVM is not uplinked to active 10Gbps link. Please check your Network config")}=1
trigger.name: CVM 10GBe uplink check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Node-Network Scope:kNode Title:CVM Not Uplinked to Active 10Gbps Link Name:CVM 10GBe uplink check Message:CVM is not uplinked to active 10Gbps link. Please check your Network configurations Description:Check that CVM uplinked to active 10Gbps link Description:Check that CVM uplinked to active 10Gbps link Causes:CVM is not uplinked to active 10Gbps link. Resolution:Verify bonds do not contain a 1GbE link. Please refer to KB 1584. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1584

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["IP address of Controller VM [\S]* has been updated to {invalid_"].iregexp("IP address of Controller VM [\S]* has been updated to {invalid_")}=1
trigger.name: CVM IP Address Configuration
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Cluster Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Network Scope:kNode Title:CVM IP Address Mismatch Name:CVM IP Address Configuration Message:IP address of Controller VM {zeus_ip_address} has been updated to {invalid_ip_address}. The Controller VM will not be part of the cluster once the change comes into effect, unless zeus configuration is updated. Description:Checks that CVM IP address is in sync with zeus configuration Description:Checks that CVM IP address is in sync with zeus configuration Causes:A CVM has been assigned an IP address that does not match the cluster's configuration. Resolution:Follow the IP address change procedure in the Nutanix documentation. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/2465

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["CVM memory reservation is incorrectly configured on CVM with IP {service_vm"].iregexp("CVM memory reservation is incorrectly configured on CVM with IP {service_vm")}=1
trigger.name: CVM Memory Pinned Check
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Node Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Memory Scope:kNode Title:CVM memory reservation is incorrectly configured. Name:CVM Memory Pinned Check Message:CVM memory reservation is incorrectly configured on CVM with IP {service_vm_external_ip} Description:Verify CVM memory reservation and pinning. Description:Verify CVM memory reservation and pinning. Causes:CVM memory reservation is configured incorrectly. Resolution:Please contact Nutanix Support to verify memory resolution. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1735

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Main memory usage in [\S]* [\S]* is high, [\S]* "].iregexp("Main memory usage in [\S]* [\S]* is high, [\S]* ")}=1
trigger.name: CVM Memory Usage
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator ControllerVM Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Memory Scope:kNode Title:CVM or Prism Central VM RAM Usage High Name:CVM Memory Usage Message:Main memory usage in {vm_type} {ip_address} is high, {available_memory_kb} KB is free. Description:Check that CVM or Prism Central VM memory usage is not high. Description:Check that CVM or Prism Central VM memory usage is not high. Causes:The RAM usage on the Controller VM or Prism Central VM has been high. Resolution:Check the memory utilization of Prism Central VM or Controller VM. If abnormal behavior is seen, please collect logs and contact Nutanix Support. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/2473

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["CVM renamed incorrectly."].iregexp("CVM renamed incorrectly.")}=1
trigger.name: CVM name check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:CVM renamed incorrectly. Name:CVM name check Message:CVM renamed incorrectly. Description:Check that CVM has been named properly. Description:Check that CVM has been named properly. Causes:CVM was renamed after installation Resolution:Rename CVM back to its original name. CVM name is nonconfigurable by the end user. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/5226

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Link on NIC [\S]* of cvm [\S]* is down."].iregexp("Link on NIC [\S]* of cvm [\S]* is down.")}=1
trigger.name: CVM NIC Link Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Network Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Network Scope:kNode Title:CVM NIC Link Down Name:CVM NIC Link Status Message:Link on NIC {nic_name} of cvm {svm_ip} is down. Description:Checks whether any CVM NIC is down. Description:Checks whether any CVM NIC is down. Causes:The rdma0 NIC is disconnected from the switch, or the switch port is failing. Resolution:Ensure that the rdma0 NIC is connected to the switch and that the switch port is functioning properly. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/2480

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Controller VM [\S]* is not reachable from Controller VM [\S]* i"].iregexp("Controller VM [\S]* is not reachable from Controller VM [\S]* i")}=1
trigger.name: CVM Passwordless Connectivity
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator ControllerVM Network Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Network Scope:kCluster Title:CVM Connectivity Failure Name:CVM Passwordless Connectivity Message:Controller VM {target_ip} is not reachable from Controller VM {source_ip} in the last 3 attempts. Description:Check that CVM has passwordless connection to each other. Description:Check that CVM has passwordless connection to each other. Causes:Controller VM is not running or is in a hung state. Controller VM does not have the correct network configuration. Upstream TOR switch has configuration or status change on the port connected to the CVM. Virtual switch in the Hypervisor is not working correctly. SSH Keys are set up incorrectly. Resolution:Ensure the CVM is powered on and running. If the CVM is in a hung state, reference KB 1526 for further guidance. Correct the network configuration settings of the CVM. Ensure that the port connected to the CVM is up and in a forwarding state. Contact Nutanix Support. Contact Nutanix Support. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1526

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["[\S]* [\S]* has been rebooted on [\S]*."].iregexp("[\S]* [\S]* has been rebooted on [\S]*.")}=1
trigger.name: CVM Rebooted Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator ControllerVM Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Services Scope:kNode Title:CVM Rebooted Name:CVM Rebooted Check Message:{vm_type} {ip_address} has been rebooted on {reboot_timestamp_str}. Description:Checks if the CVM is not rebooted recently. Description:Checks if the CVM is not rebooted recently. Causes:CVM is rebooted. Resolution:Check CVM status. Ignore if intentional. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/2474

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["[\S]*s are not in the same timezone."].iregexp("[\S]*s are not in the same timezone.")}=1
trigger.name: CVM same timezone check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Same timezone check Name:CVM same timezone check Message:{vm_type}s are not in the same timezone. Description:Check that all CVMs are in the same timezone Description:Check that all CVMs are in the same timezone Causes:Some of the Controller VMs in the cluster are not in the same timezone. Resolution:Make sure all Controller VMs are in the same time zone. If they are not, then set the timezone using KB 1050 Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/2044

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["One or more cluster services have restarted within 15 minutes in the Contro"].iregexp("One or more cluster services have restarted within 15 minutes in the Contro")}=1
trigger.name: CVM Services Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator ControllerVM Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Services Scope:kNode Title:CVM Service(s) Restarting Frequently Name:CVM Services Status Message:One or more cluster services have restarted within 15 minutes in the Controller VM {ip_address}, the total restarts being >= 10.The following are the service(s) that have restarted : {failed_components}. Description:Check if services have restarted recently on the CVM. Description:Check if services have restarted recently on the CVM. Causes:Faulty behavior in one or more service(s), leading to frequent crashes,in a short period of time. Resolution:If this alert occurs more than once, please collect CVM logs and contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/2472

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Controller VM [\S]* with network address [\S]* is in a different "].iregexp("Controller VM [\S]* with network address [\S]* is in a different ")}=1
trigger.name: CVM Subnet
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration ControllerVM Network Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Network Scope:kNode Title:CVM Host Subnet Mismatch Name:CVM Subnet Message:Controller VM {svm_ip} with network address {svm_subnet} is in a different network than the Hypervisor {hypervisor_ip}, which is in the network {hypervisor_subnet}. Description:Checks that host and cvm share the same subnet. Description:Checks that host and cvm share the same subnet. Causes:The Controller VM and the hypervisor are not on the same subnet. Resolution:Reconfigure the cluster. Either move the Controller VMs to the same subnet as the hypervisor hosts or move the hypervisor hosts to the same subnet as the Controller VMs. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1515

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Data At Rest Encryption key backup warning: [\S]*"].iregexp("Data At Rest Encryption key backup warning: [\S]*")}=1
trigger.name: Data At Rest Encryption key backup warning.
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Data At Rest Encryption key backup warning Name:Data At Rest Encryption key backup warning. Message:Data At Rest Encryption key backup warning: {message} Description:New encryption keys not backed up. Description:New encryption keys not backed up. Causes:New encryption keys have been created since the last backup was downloaded. Resolution:Download the latest copy of the cluster key backup. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Disk space usage for [\S]* on [\S]* [\S]* has exceeded the"].iregexp("Disk space usage for [\S]* on [\S]* [\S]* has exceeded the")}=1
trigger.name: Data Disk Usage
trigger.description: Category Type: Capacity Storage Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Disk Scope:kNode Title:Data Disk Space Usage High Name:Data Disk Usage Message:Disk space usage for {mount_path} on {entity} {ip_address} has exceeded the threshold of {disk_usage_threshold}%. Disks list: {disk_usage_pct_list}. {action_str} Description:Checks if any individual disk (SSD or HDD) storage space utilization is sustained for long above a high threshold. Description:Checks if any individual disk (SSD or HDD) storage space utilization is sustained for long above a high threshold. Causes:There is more data than the underlying hardware can handle. Compression has been disabled. Aggressive DR policy settings. Sustained High intensity IO. Cassandra metadata ring imbalance. Vdisk_block_map metadata threshold reached and vdisk severing not happening. Individual disk storage is being highly utilized, possibly due to overall storage pool usage pressure. Issues with disk/node balancing. Resolution:Delete unnecessary data in the VM, or move VM out. Check if the Compression disabled alert was fired. Decrease data retention window for DR. Ensure Curator service is running and periodic scans are completing. Balance the Cassandra metadata ring. If height of snapshot_tree_printer chain is > 25, find the size of the vdisk block map across the cluster by running: allssh 'du -h ~/data/cassandra/data/medusa_vdiskblockmap/' (check for value of gflag --curator_max_vdisk_block_size_for_copy_blockmap_mb, it is default 40GB). Ensure storage pool usage is below critical threshold. In isolation a spike in individual disk usage is not an immediate cause for concern but if sustained or seen across multiple disks it can indicate an underlying issue with data balancing and may lead to significant cluster performance degradation or issues with storage maintenance. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1523

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["[\S]* data collector has reached [\S]*% of the sizing "].iregexp("[\S]* data collector has reached [\S]*% of the sizing ")}=1
trigger.name: Data provider collector has sizing violation
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:CVM-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Data provider collector has violated sizing limits Name:Data provider collector has sizing violation Message:{data_provider_name} data collector has reached {threshold}% of the sizing limits. Description:Data provider collector metrics usage has violated sizing limits Description:Data provider collector metrics usage has violated sizing limits Causes:Total no. of instances or Metric collection has reached the supported limit by Data Provider Collector Resolution:Delete some existing instance to configure new instances if situation persists, or any assistance is needed please contact Nutanix Support. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/9473

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["[\S]* data collector with uuid {metrics_data_provider_instan"].iregexp("[\S]* data collector with uuid {metrics_data_provider_instan")}=1
trigger.name: Data provider collector is in crashloop
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:CVM-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Data provider collector is in crashloop Name:Data provider collector is in crashloop Message:{data_provider_name} data collector with uuid {metrics_data_provider_instance_uuid} is in crashloop Description:Data provider collector is restarting frequently Description:Data provider collector is restarting frequently Causes:Collector heartbeat may not be reaching Prism Central Resolution:Manually attempt to start mercury service on all Prism Central VMs. if situation persists, or any assistance is needed please contact Nutanix Support. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/9258

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Unable to [\S]* Datastore '[\S]*."].iregexp("Unable to [\S]* Datastore '[\S]*.")}=1
trigger.name: Datastore Remount Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Storage Affected Entity Type:container Subcategory Type:Host-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Unable To Remount Datastore Name:Datastore Remount Status Message:Unable to {operation} Datastore '{datastore_name}'{host_info}. Description:Unable to remount a datastore. Description:Unable to remount a datastore. Causes:Datastore information unavailable Resolution:Check container exists on ESXi, rescan datastore and mount the container on the hosts from Prism Element. If issue persists contact Nutanix Support Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Default virtual switch cannot be created on the [\S]*. Reason: {error"].iregexp("Default virtual switch cannot be created on the [\S]*. Reason: {error")}=1
trigger.name: Default virtual switch error
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Network Scope:kCluster Title:Default Virtual Switch Error Name:Default virtual switch error Message:Default virtual switch cannot be created on the {host_info}. Reason: {error_message} Description:Default virtual switch has error in the cluster. Description:Default virtual switch has error in the cluster. Causes:Default virtual switch could not be created on a node in the cluster. Resolution:Check Acropolis service logs and refer to KB 9233 to identify the problem and steps to restore the default virtual switch in the cluster. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/9233

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Node [\S]* [\S]* has been marked as being in a degraded state {dnd_ts"].iregexp("Node [\S]* [\S]* has been marked as being in a degraded state {dnd_ts")}=1
trigger.name: Degraded Node check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Node-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Node is in degraded state Name:Degraded Node check Message:Node {svm_ip} {svm_id} has been marked as being in a degraded state {dnd_ts} Description:Check if any node is in degraded state Description:Check if any node is in degraded state Causes:Unstable environment such as partially bad disks, network bandwidth reduction, network packet drops, soft lockups, hardware issues(such as unreliable DIMM with ECC errors). Resolution:Refer to KB4206. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/4206

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Unplanned Failover for the Recovery Plan [\S]* has completed"].iregexp("Unplanned Failover for the Recovery Plan [\S]* has completed")}=1
trigger.name: Delete the failed over VMs from either the Primary or the Recovery Location
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability DR Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Recovery Plan Scope:kCluster Title:Planned Failover or Unplanned Failover operations will fail. Name:Delete the failed over VMs from either the Primary or the Recovery Location Message:Unplanned Failover for the Recovery Plan {recovery_plan_name} has completed successfully. Validate and clean up the VMs from the site where it is not required, for new unplanned or planned failover operations for this recovery plan to succeed. Description:Delete the failed over VMs on either the primary or the recovery location. Description:Delete the failed over VMs on either the primary or the recovery location. Causes:Unplanned failover for the Recovery Plan completed successfully. Resolution:Post unplanned failover VM is now active on the recovery Availability Zone. For synced VMs, delete the VM on the primary Availability Zone to avoid performance issues. For VMs protected by asynchronous replication, performance will not be affected and deletion can happen on either Availability Zone as required. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["[\S]* on host [\S]* has the following problem: [\S]*"].iregexp("[\S]* on host [\S]* has the following problem: [\S]*")}=1
trigger.name: DIMM Config Check
