trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Node-Services Scope:kNode Title:DIMM Configuration is Wrong Name:DIMM Config Check Message:{dimm_id} on host {ip_address} has the following problem: {alert_msg} Description:DIMM Configuration Check Description:DIMM Configuration Check Causes:The DIMM configuration is unsupported. Either number of CPUs or the number of DIMMs, or capacity of the DIMMS are not supported. Resolution:Ensure that DIMM configuration is correct. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/3651

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Memory channels on host [\S]* have DIMMs of multiple manufacturers: "].iregexp("Memory channels on host [\S]* have DIMMs of multiple manufacturers: ")}=1
trigger.name: DIMMs Interoperability Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Node-Services Scope:kNode Title:DIMMs of different manufacturers in one memory channel Name:DIMMs Interoperability Check Message:Memory channels on host {ip_address} have DIMMs of multiple manufacturers: {err_msg} Description:DIMMs Interoperability Check Description:DIMMs Interoperability Check Causes:DIMMs of different manufacturers are in the same memory channel. Resolution:Ensure that all DIMMs in a memory channel are of the same manufacturer. Verify capacity, model, and manufacturer of DIMMs. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/3651

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Reduction in total memory size detected"].iregexp("Reduction in total memory size detected")}=1
trigger.name: DIMM Size Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Hardware Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Host-Memory Scope:kNode Title:Reduction in total memory size detected Name:DIMM Size Check Message:{alert_msg} Description:Check if current available memory has gone below the installed size. Description:Check if current available memory has gone below the installed size. Causes:A DIMM has failed, or DIMMs have been removed from the node. Resolution:Determine if a failed DIMM needs to be replaced. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/9261

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Temperature of [\S]* exceeded threshold on Controller VM [\S]*. "].iregexp("Temperature of [\S]* exceeded threshold on Controller VM [\S]*. ")}=1
trigger.name: DIMM Temperature
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Hardware Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Host-Hardware Scope:kNode Title:RAM Temperature High Name:DIMM Temperature Message:Temperature of {dimm_id} exceeded threshold on Controller VM {ip_address}. Current sensor value is {temperature}C Description:Check that DIMM temperature is not high. Description:Check that DIMM temperature is not high. Causes:DIMM temperature is high. Resolution:Check RAM temperature. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1524

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Temperature of [\S]* is below threshold on Controller VM [\S]*. "].iregexp("Temperature of [\S]* is below threshold on Controller VM [\S]*. ")}=1
trigger.name: DIMM Temperature Low
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability Hardware Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Host-Hardware Scope:kNode Title:RAM Temperature Low Name:DIMM Temperature Low Message:Temperature of {dimm_id} is below threshold on Controller VM {ip_address}. Current sensor value is {temperature}C Description:Check that DIMM temperature is not low. Description:Check that DIMM temperature is not low. Causes:BMC or the sensor on DIMM may have problem Resolution:Do BMC factory default. If the problem still persists, replace the chassis. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1524

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Either the cluster had SED protection enabled and the disks did not have a "].iregexp("Either the cluster had SED protection enabled and the disks did not have a ")}=1
trigger.name: Disk configuration v/s intent consistency check
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Cluster ControllerVM Storage Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Disk Scope:kCluster Title:SED Disk Configuration Misconfigured Name:Disk configuration v/s intent consistency check Message:Either the cluster had SED protection enabled and the disks did not have a password set OR the cluster did not have SED protection enabled and disks had password set OR found tentative passwords. Description:Check if SED disk configuration is consistent with the intent Description:Check if SED disk configuration is consistent with the intent Causes:Inconsistency in disk's zeus configuration and the intent Resolution:This issue is usually seen when the KMS is switched off when the disks are still in protected state. Please check whether the KMS is on or off. If the issue persists, contact Nutanix Support. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/11322

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Drive [\S]* with serial [\S]* in drive bay [\S]* on C"].iregexp("Drive [\S]* with serial [\S]* in drive bay [\S]* on C")}=1
trigger.name: Disk Diagnostic Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator ControllerVM Storage Hardware Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Disk Scope:kNode Title:Disk Diagnostic Failure Name:Disk Diagnostic Status Message:Drive {disk_id} with serial {disk_serial} in drive bay {disk_location} on Controller VM {service_vm_external_ip} has failed diagnostic test. This drive is failing or has failed. Description:The drive diagnostic test has failed. Description:The drive diagnostic test has failed. Causes:The drive is failing or has failed. Resolution:Replace the failing drive. Refer to the Nutanix documentation for instructions. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Disk [\S]* with id [\S]* on node [\S]* of block {bl"].iregexp("Disk [\S]* with id [\S]* on node [\S]* of block {bl")}=1
trigger.name: Disk Offline Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Hardware Storage Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Disk Scope:kNode Title:Disk Failed/Marked offline Name:Disk Offline Status Message:Disk {disk_position} with id {disk_id} on node {node_position} of block {block_position} has been marked offline due to IO errors. Serial number of the disk is {disk_serial} in host {host_ip} of block {block_serial}. Description:Drive is marked offline. Description:Drive is marked offline. Causes:A drive on the node has failed and was marked offline. Resolution:Replace the failed drive. Refer to the Nutanix documentation for instructions. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8453

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Disk mounted at [\S]* on Controller VM [\S]* is marked offline."].iregexp("Disk mounted at [\S]* on Controller VM [\S]* is marked offline.")}=1
trigger.name: Disk online check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:disk Subcategory Type:Cluster-Disk Scope:kCluster Title:Offline disk in a cluster Name:Disk online check Message:Disk mounted at {mount_path} on Controller VM {cvm_ip} is marked offline. Description:Check for the offline disks Description:Check for the offline disks Causes:A disk may have failed or was manually removed. Resolution:Please refer to KB 1536 for more information. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1536

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Removal of drive [\S]* is stuck."].iregexp("Removal of drive [\S]* is stuck.")}=1
trigger.name: Drive Removal Stuck
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:CVM-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Drive Removal Stuck Name:Drive Removal Stuck Message:Removal of drive {disk_id} is stuck. Description:Drive Removal Stuck Description:Drive Removal Stuck Causes:Various Resolution:Contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Remote site is unreachable because [\S]*."].iregexp("Remote site is unreachable because [\S]*.")}=1
trigger.name: DR Service Reachability Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Data Protection-Remote Site Scope:kCluster Title:Remote site is Unreachable Name:DR Service Reachability Check Message:Remote site is unreachable because {message}. Description:Check if the DR services are reachable. Description:Check if the DR services are reachable. Causes:Connectivity issues between the two sites. Resolution:Resolve the connectivity with the remote site. If the issue persists, contact Nutanix Support. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/6642

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Duplicate CVM IP address detected. Associated IP address is [\S]*"].iregexp("Duplicate CVM IP address detected. Associated IP address is [\S]*")}=1
trigger.name: Duplicate CVM IP check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Network Scope:kCluster Title:Duplicate CVM IP address detected Name:Duplicate CVM IP check Message:Duplicate CVM IP address detected. Associated IP address is {cvm_ip} Description:Check for duplicate CVM IP address Description:Check for duplicate CVM IP address Causes:One (or more) Nutanix cluster Controller VM external(eth0) interfaces conflicts with other hosts on the same network. Resolution:Please refer to KB 3025. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/3025

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Duplicate Host IP address detected. Associated IP address is [\S]*"].iregexp("Duplicate Host IP address detected. Associated IP address is [\S]*")}=1
trigger.name: Duplicate Hypervisor IP check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Network Scope:kCluster Title:Duplicate Host IP address detected Name:Duplicate Hypervisor IP check Message:Duplicate Host IP address detected. Associated IP address is {host_ip} Description:Check for duplicate Hypervisor IP address Description:Check for duplicate Hypervisor IP address Causes:One or more of your Nutanix cluster hypervisor interfaces conflicts with other hosts on the same network. Resolution:Reconfigure the conflicting hypervisor interfaces to have different IP addresses or VLAN settings Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/5578

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Remote site already exists with the name '[\S]*'."].iregexp("Remote site already exists with the name '[\S]*'.")}=1
trigger.name: Duplicate Remote Cluster ID Check
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration DR Cluster Affected Entity Type:remote_site Subcategory Type:CVM-Network CVM-Remote Site Scope:kCluster Title:Duplicate Remote Cluster ID Name:Duplicate Remote Cluster ID Check Message:Remote site already exists with the name '{conflicting_remote_name}'. Description:Duplicate remote cluster ID. Description:Duplicate remote cluster ID. Causes:Two remote sites with different names or different IP addresses have same cluster ID. This can happen in two cases: (a) A remote cluster is added twice under two different names (through different IP addresses) or (b) Two clusters have the same cluster ID. Resolution:In case (a) remove the duplicate remote site. In case (b) verify that the both clusters have the same cluster ID and contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Some entities skipped during restore of [\S]*. Count: {n"].iregexp("Some entities skipped during restore of [\S]*. Count: {n")}=1
trigger.name: Entities Restored Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:CVM-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Entities Skipped During Restore Name:Entities Restored Check Message:Some entities skipped during restore of {protection_domain_name}. Count: {num_entities}. Entity names: {entity_names}. Reason: {reason}. Description:Entities were skipped during restore. Description:Entities were skipped during restore. Causes:Existing files conflict with the files to be recovered. Resolution:Resolve the stated reason for the failure. If you cannot resolve the error, contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8415

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Availability zone: [\S]* is in read-only state."].iregexp("Availability zone: [\S]* is in read-only state.")}=1
trigger.name: Entity Centric Remote Site Operation Mode ReadOnly
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Availability Zone Scope:kCluster Title:Recovery Location is in Read Only mode Name:Entity Centric Remote Site Operation Mode ReadOnly Message:Availability zone: {availability_zone_physical_name} is in read-only state. Replications to this site will fail. Description:Operation Mode of the Recovery Location changed to Read Only mode. Description:Operation Mode of the Recovery Location changed to Read Only mode. Causes:Single node or two-node clusters: Possible SSD failure on the Recovery Location. Resolution:Single node or two-node clusters: Replace the failed SSD on the recovery location. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8324

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Restoring VMs failed for the snapshot [\S]* protected by the {prote"].iregexp("Restoring VMs failed for the snapshot [\S]* protected by the {prote")}=1
trigger.name: EntityRestoreAbort
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Entity Restore Aborted Name:EntityRestoreAbort Message:Restoring VMs failed for the snapshot {snapshot_id} protected by the {protection_domain_name} because {reason}. Description:Entity restore aborted. Description:Entity restore aborted. Causes:Check the alert message for the reason of failure. Resolution:Restart the restore process. Snapshot expiry is removed to allow subsequent restore operations. Snapshot will need to be deleted manually to free up the space if required. If this error persists, contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Entity Sync Failure"].iregexp("Entity Sync Failure")}=1
trigger.name: Entity Sync failed
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Cluster Scope:kCluster Title:Entity Sync Failure Name:Entity Sync failed Message:{message} Description:Entity Sync failed Description:Entity Sync failed Causes:An update made to the entity locally might not have synced to the connected Availability Zone(s). One or more internal services might be down or not working as expected. Resolution:Perform Forced Entity Sync after ensuring that all the remote entities can be overwritten. If the issue persists, contact Nutanix support. Contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Entity Sync Failure for the Availability Zone"].iregexp("Entity Sync Failure for the Availability Zone")}=1
trigger.name: Entity Sync failed for Availability Zone
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Cluster Scope:kCluster Title:Entity Sync Failure for the Availability Zone Name:Entity Sync failed for Availability Zone Message:{message} Description:Entity Sync failed for the Availability Zone Description:Entity Sync failed for the Availability Zone Causes:Unable to send request to the Availability Zone. Request timed out. Resolution:Ensure Availability Zone is reachable and do a 'Forced Entity Sync' to ensure that all the entities are in sync. If the issue still persists, contact Nutanix support. Ensure there are no sync related tasks running under the 'Tasks' page on all the connected Availability Zone(s) and then invoke 'Forced Entity Sync' from the chosen site. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/10241

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Entity Sync Failure for the Protection Policy"].iregexp("Entity Sync Failure for the Protection Policy")}=1
trigger.name: Entity Sync failed for Protection Policy
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Cluster Scope:kCluster Title:Entity Sync Failure for the Protection Policy Name:Entity Sync failed for Protection Policy Message:{message} Description:Entity Sync failed for the Protection Policy Description:Entity Sync failed for the Protection Policy Causes:An update made to the Protection Policy locally might not have synced to the connected Availability Zone(s). One or more internal services might be down or not working as expected. Resolution:Perform Forced Entity Sync after ensuring that all the remote entities can be overwritten. If the issue persists, contact Nutanix support. Contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Entity Sync Failure for the Recovery Plan"].iregexp("Entity Sync Failure for the Recovery Plan")}=1
trigger.name: Entity Sync failed for Recovery Plan
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Cluster Scope:kCluster Title:Entity Sync Failure for the Recovery Plan Name:Entity Sync failed for Recovery Plan Message:{message} Description:Entity Sync failed for the Recovery Plan Description:Entity Sync failed for the Recovery Plan Causes:An update made to the Recovery Plan locally might not have synced to the connected Availability Zone(s). Protection Policy configuration for the entities specified in the Recovery Plan may be different across connected Availability Zones. One or more internal services might be down or not working as expected. Resolution:Perform Forced Entity Sync after ensuring that all the remote entities can be overwritten. If the issue persists, contact Nutanix support. Ensure that the Protection Policy configuration is same across connected Availability Zones for the entities specified in the Recovery Plan. Contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Entity [\S]* has degraded to [\S]* RPO. [\S]*."].iregexp("Entity [\S]* has degraded to [\S]* RPO. [\S]*.")}=1
trigger.name: Entity transitioning to lower frequency snapshot schedule
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:vm Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Virtual Machine Scope:kCluster Title:Entity is being transitioned to a lower frequency snapshot schedule. Name:Entity transitioning to lower frequency snapshot schedule Message:Entity {vm_name} has degraded to {rpo_string} RPO. {reason}. Description:Entity is being transitioned to a lower frequency snapshot schedule. Description:Entity is being transitioned to a lower frequency snapshot schedule. Causes:High RPO cannot be sustained due to system constraints. Resolution:Entity will automatically attempt to transition to a higher RPO after system constraints are resolved. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to unprotect the VM: '[\S]*', because of '[\S]*'."].iregexp("Failed to unprotect the VM: '[\S]*', because of '[\S]*'.")}=1
trigger.name: Entity Unprotection Failed
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:vm Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Virtual Machine Scope:kCluster Title:Entity Unprotection Failed Name:Entity Unprotection Failed Message:Failed to unprotect the VM: '{vm_name}', because of '{reason}'. Description:Unable to unprotect the VM because of some internal error. Description:Unable to unprotect the VM because of some internal error. Causes:Data Protection service may be down. Resolution:If this issue persists for a long time, contact Nutanix support for further assistance. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Discovered that the epsilon internal service is not working: '{service_name"].iregexp("Discovered that the epsilon internal service is not working: '{service_name")}=1
trigger.name: Epsilon Service Down
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Epsilon Internal Service has Stopped Working Name:Epsilon Service Down Message:Discovered that the epsilon internal service is not working: '{service_names}' Description:Epsilon internal service is down Description:Epsilon internal service is down Causes:Epsilon internal service may have stopped working Resolution:Please refer to KB-7080 Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/7080 http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8622

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["All nodes are not running on same Epsilon version"].iregexp("All nodes are not running on same Epsilon version")}=1
trigger.name: Epsilon Version Mismatch
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Epsilon Version Mismatch Name:Epsilon Version Mismatch Message:All nodes are not running on same Epsilon version Description:Epsilon Version Mismatch Description:Epsilon Version Mismatch Causes:Failed LCM upgrade Resolution:Refer to KB 7528 for resolution Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8694

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Garbage due to erasure coding on [\S]* is currently [\S]* whic"].iregexp("Garbage due to erasure coding on [\S]* is currently [\S]* whic")}=1
trigger.name: Erasure Code Garbage
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Storage Affected Entity Type:container Subcategory Type:Cluster-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:High Garbage due to erasure coding Name:Erasure Code Garbage Message:Garbage due to erasure coding on {container_name} is currently {usage} which is above the safety threshold. Description:Checks if erasure coding garbage is below a safe threshold. Description:Checks if erasure coding garbage is below a safe threshold. Causes:Suboptimal performance of erasure coding is generating garbage that is consuming additional storage space. Resolution:Review KB 3021 for corrective actions. Contact Nutanix support to discuss possible fixes before making changes to erasure coding config. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/3021

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Number of hybrid nodes found are below the recommended threshold of {thresh"].iregexp("Number of hybrid nodes found are below the recommended threshold of {thresh")}=1
trigger.name: Erasure coding all-flash node intermixed check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Storage Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:Invalid hybrid nodes configuration for erasure coding Name:Erasure coding all-flash node intermixed check Message:Number of hybrid nodes found are below the recommended threshold of {threshold}. Description:Checks for valid configuration of coexisting all-flash and hybrid nodes in cluster when EC is enabled. Description:Checks for valid configuration of coexisting all-flash and hybrid nodes in cluster when EC is enabled. Causes:Current hybrid nodes configuration does not satisfy EC storage container requirements. Resolution:(A) Add more storage heavy or hybrid nodes to the cluster. (B) Consult Nutanix documentation on Erasure Coding requirements and follow KB3021 recommendations for any required configuration changes. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/3021

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["EXT4 file system errors are detected on CVM: [\S]*: [\S]*"].iregexp("EXT4 file system errors are detected on CVM: [\S]*: [\S]*")}=1
trigger.name: EXT4-fs Error Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Services Scope:kNode Title:File system inconsistencies are detected. Name:EXT4-fs Error Check Message:EXT4 file system errors are detected on CVM: {svm_ip}: {alert_msg} Description:Captures EXT4-fs error messages Description:Captures EXT4-fs error messages Causes:File system inconsistencies are present on the node. Resolution:Look for any problems in the file system. Review KB 8514. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8514

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["[\S]*. Volume Group external iSCSI attachments cannot be snapshot"].iregexp("[\S]*. Volume Group external iSCSI attachments cannot be snapshot")}=1
trigger.name: External iSCSI Attachments Not Snapshotted
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:External iSCSI Attachments Not Snapshotted Name:External iSCSI Attachments Not Snapshotted Message:{error_message}. Volume Group external iSCSI attachments cannot be snapshotted for these VMs. Description:External iSCSI Attachments Not Snapshotted. Description:External iSCSI Attachments Not Snapshotted. Causes:VMs have duplicate IQNs. VMs have configured iSCSI target IP addresses that do not belong to the local Nutanix cluster. IQN could not be resolved to VM ID. Resolution:Make sure all VMs in the protection domain have different IQNs. Remove iSCSI target IP addresses that do not belong to the local Nutanix cluster from the VMs. Install Nutanix Guest Tools on all the VMs using volume group external iSCSI attachments. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Virtual IP [\S]* of the DR service network segmentation could not be"].iregexp("Virtual IP [\S]* of the DR service network segmentation could not be")}=1
trigger.name: Failed Hosting Network Segmented VIP
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Cluster Scope:kCluster Title:Hosting of Virtual IP of the Network Segmentation DR Service Failed. Name:Failed Hosting Network Segmented VIP Message:Virtual IP {virtual_ip} of the DR service network segmentation could not be hosted on the network interface {network_interface}. Description:Hosting of virtual IP of the DR service network segmentation failed. Description:Hosting of virtual IP of the DR service network segmentation failed. Causes:Network configuration might have been changed or has not been configured properly. Resolution:Reconfigure the DR service network configuration. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8258

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to configure host [\S]* for Atlas networking: {messag"].iregexp("Failed to configure host [\S]* for Atlas networking: {messag")}=1
trigger.name: Failed to configure host for Atlas networking
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Network Node Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Host-Network Scope:kNode Title:Failed to configure host for Atlas networking Name:Failed to configure host for Atlas networking Message:Failed to configure host {hypervisor_address} for Atlas networking: {message} Description:Failed to configure host for Atlas networking. Description:Failed to configure host for Atlas networking. Causes:Failed to configure host for Atlas networking. Resolution:Check the hypervisor version, and upgrade if necessary. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8526

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to reconfigure Nutanix Guest Tools for VM [\S]* in protection do"].iregexp("Failed to reconfigure Nutanix Guest Tools for VM [\S]* in protection do")}=1
trigger.name: Failed To Mount NGT ISO On Recovery of VM
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Failed to reconfigure Nutanix Guest Tools for a VM in protection domain Name:Failed To Mount NGT ISO On Recovery of VM Message:Failed to reconfigure Nutanix Guest Tools for VM {vm_name} in protection domain {protection_domain_name} due to ISO mount failure. Description:Failed to mount ISO image as part of Nutanix Guest Tools reconfiguration for a VM in protection domain Description:Failed to mount ISO image as part of Nutanix Guest Tools reconfiguration for a VM in protection domain Causes:Virtual IP address of the cluster might not have been configured. Guest VM information could not be retrieved. NGT ISO could not be mounted. Resolution:Configure the virtual IP address of the cluster (if not configured). Mount Nutanix Guest Tools ISO on the failed VM, and restart Nutanix Guest Agent service within the VM. Make sure there is at least one free CD-ROM slot on the Guest VM. If you cannot resolve the error, contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to reconfigure Nutanix Guest Tools for VMs in protection domain {pro"].iregexp("Failed to reconfigure Nutanix Guest Tools for VMs in protection domain {pro")}=1
trigger.name: Failed To Recover NGT Information
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Failed to reconfigure Nutanix Guest Tools during VMs recovery for protection domain Name:Failed To Recover NGT Information Message:Failed to reconfigure Nutanix Guest Tools for VMs in protection domain {protection_domain_name} due to {reason}. Description:Failed to enable Nutanix Guest Tools during VMs recovery for protection domain. Description:Failed to enable Nutanix Guest Tools during VMs recovery for protection domain. Causes:Nutanix Guest Tools service might be down. Resolution:Enable and mount Nutanix Guest Tools, and restart Nutanix Guest Agent service within the VM, for VMs in protection domain. If you cannot resolve the error, contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/10079

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to reserve host memory for Atlas networking"].iregexp("Failed to reserve host memory for Atlas networking")}=1
trigger.name: Failed to reserve host memory for Atlas networking
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Network Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Network Scope:kCluster Title:Failed to reserve host memory for Atlas networking Name:Failed to reserve host memory for Atlas networking Message:Failed to reserve host memory for Atlas networking Description:Failed to reserve host memory for Atlas networking. Description:Failed to reserve host memory for Atlas networking. Causes:Failed to reserve host memory for Atlas networking. Resolution:Power off VMs to reduce host memory consumption. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8525

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to run File Server [\S]* Metadata fixer task successful"].iregexp("Failed to run File Server [\S]* Metadata fixer task successful")}=1
trigger.name: Failed To Run File Server Metadata Fixer Successfully
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:Failed to correct File Server data and meta data inconsistencies Name:Failed To Run File Server Metadata Fixer Successfully Message:Failed to run File Server {file_server_name} Metadata fixer task successfully. {reason_and_resolution_msg} Description:Failed to Run File Server Metadata Fixer tool successfully Description:Failed to Run File Server Metadata Fixer tool successfully Causes:Metadata fixer task might have timed out Resolution:Run 'afs share.fix_tld_metadata' command form one of the FSVM shell to fix the metadata inconsistency. Contact Nutanix support if issue still persists or assistance needed. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to set VM-to-VM anti-affinity rule for [\S]*. {reason_a"].iregexp("Failed to set VM-to-VM anti-affinity rule for [\S]*. {reason_a")}=1
trigger.name: Failed To Set VM-to-VM Anti Affinity Rule
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:Failed to set VM-to-VM anti-affinity rule Name:Failed To Set VM-to-VM Anti Affinity Rule Message:Failed to set VM-to-VM anti-affinity rule for {file_server_name}. {reason_and_resolution_msg} Description:Failed to set VM-to-VM anti affinity rule Description:Failed to set VM-to-VM anti affinity rule Causes:More than one FSVM of a File Server entiry is may be deployed hosted on a single physical host. Resolution:Contact Nutanix support if issue still persists or assistance needed. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to snapshot the entities [\S]* in the protection domain {pr"].iregexp("Failed to snapshot the entities [\S]* in the protection domain {pr")}=1
trigger.name: Failed To Snapshot Entities
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Failed To Snapshot Entities Name:Failed To Snapshot Entities Message:Failed to snapshot the entities {entity_names} in the protection domain {protection_domain_name}, snapshot {snapshot_id}. Description:Failed to snapshot entities. Description:Failed to snapshot entities. Causes:Conflicting hypervisor tasks might be running on the entities. Resolution:Retry the operation after the hypervisor tasks are complete. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8485

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Unable to retrieve the endpoint information for the Availability Zone {avai"].iregexp("Unable to retrieve the endpoint information for the Availability Zone {avai")}=1
trigger.name: Failure to communicate with DCM
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Cluster Scope:kCluster Title:Unable to communicate with the Data Center Manager Name:Failure to communicate with DCM Message:Unable to retrieve the endpoint information for the Availability Zone {availability_zone_name} from the Data Center Manager Description:Unable to retrieve the endpoint information for the Availability Zone from the Data Center Manager Description:Unable to retrieve the endpoint information for the Availability Zone from the Data Center Manager Causes:Data Center Manager may be unreachable or has provided an invalid response Resolution:Check if Data Center Manager is reachable from the Xi - Availability Zone Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/6901

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Cluster ([\S]*) failed to be configured for Atlas Networking"].iregexp("Cluster ([\S]*) failed to be configured for Atlas Networking")}=1
trigger.name: Failure to configure a cluster for Advanced Networking
trigger.description: Category Type: Performance Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Host-Cluster Scope:kCluster Title:Cluster is not healthy Name:Failure to configure a cluster for Advanced Networking Message:Cluster ({cluster_uuid}) failed to be configured for Atlas Networking Description:Failure to configure a cluster for Advanced Networking. Description:Failure to configure a cluster for Advanced Networking. Causes:Cluster cannot accept Advanced Networking Configuration. Resolution:(A) Verify health of cluster. (B) Verify cluster is reachable from Prism Central. (C) Verify cluster AOS and AHV version are compatible with Advanced Networking. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Speed of [\S]* exceeded threshold on Controller VM [\S]*. Current"].iregexp("Speed of [\S]* exceeded threshold on Controller VM [\S]*. Current")}=1
trigger.name: Fan Speed High Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Hardware Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Host-Hardware Scope:kNode Title:Fan Speed High Name:Fan Speed High Check Message:Speed of {fan_id} exceeded threshold on Controller VM {ip_address}. Current sensor value is {fan_rpm} Description:Checks if the fan speed is not too high. Description:Checks if the fan speed is not too high. Causes:The device is overheating to the point of imminent failure. Resolution:Ensure that the fans in the block are functioning properly and that the environment is cool enough. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1524

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["[\S]* has stopped or its speed is low on Controller VM [\S]*."].iregexp("[\S]* has stopped or its speed is low on Controller VM [\S]*.")}=1
trigger.name: Fan Speed Low Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Hardware Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Host-Hardware Scope:kNode Title:Fan Speed Low Name:Fan Speed Low Check Message:{fan_id} has stopped or its speed is low on Controller VM {ip_address}. Description:Checks if the fan speed is not low. Description:Checks if the fan speed is not low. Causes:A fan has failed. Resolution:Replace the fan as soon as possible. Refer to the Nutanix documentation for instructions. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1524

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Cannot find the replication target on the Recovery Location '{availability_"].iregexp("Cannot find the replication target on the Recovery Location '{availability_")}=1
trigger.name: Fetch Replication Target Failure
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Availability Zone Scope:kCluster Title:Failed to find the Target cluster for Replication Name:Fetch Replication Target Failure Message:Cannot find the replication target on the Recovery Location '{availability_zone_physical_name}'. Description:Cannot find a target cluster for replication on the Remote Availability Zone. Description:Cannot find a target cluster for replication on the Remote Availability Zone. Causes:None of the attached clusters support recovery. Virtual IP is not set on the remote cluster. Target cluster could not be found for replication due to some internal error. Resolution:Ensure that at least one of the clusters, attached to the Remote Availability Zone, supports recovery. Configure the virtual IP address on the remote cluster. Retry the operation. Contact Nutanix support if the issue persists. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["File server [\S]* activation failed due to [\S]*"].iregexp("File server [\S]* activation failed due to [\S]*")}=1
trigger.name: File Server Activation Failed
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:File Server activation failed Name:File Server Activation Failed Message:File server {file_server_name} activation failed due to {reason} Description:File Server Activation Failed Description:File Server Activation Failed Causes:Check alert message for details Resolution:Try to activate file server again, and if the failure persists, then contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["File server [\S]* Disaster Recovery operation failed to update"].iregexp("File server [\S]* Disaster Recovery operation failed to update")}=1
trigger.name: File Server Active Directory operation failed during Disaster Recovery
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:File Server Active Directory operation failed during Disaster Recovery Name:File Server Active Directory operation failed during Disaster Recovery Message:File server {file_server_name} Disaster Recovery operation failed to update Active Directory. {message} Description:Active Directory operations during failover or failback operation as part of Disaster Recovery failed. Description:Active Directory operations during failover or failback operation as part of Disaster Recovery failed. Causes:Various. See message for details. Resolution:Various. See message for details. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/9805

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["File server [\S]* cannot connect with AD server"].iregexp("File server [\S]* cannot connect with AD server")}=1
trigger.name: File Server AD Connectivity Failure
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:File server cannot connect with AD server Name:File Server AD Connectivity Failure Message:File server {file_server_name} cannot connect with AD server Description:File server cannot connect with AD server with configured information Description:File server cannot connect with AD server with configured information Causes:The machine account credentials may have been changed. There is a network connectivity issue for the AD server. Resolution:Check that the AD server is reachable. Refer to KB article 8122 for more details. Contact Nutanix support if issue still persists or assistance needed. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8122

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Detected changes to baseline configs on a File Server. [\S]*"].iregexp("Detected changes to baseline configs on a File Server. [\S]*")}=1
trigger.name: File Server AIDE Baseline Configuration Changes Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Services Scope:kCluster Title:AIDE Baselines configuration changes on File Server. Name:File Server AIDE Baseline Configuration Changes Check Message:Detected changes to baseline configs on a File Server. {message} Description:Checks the log files of aide for changes to baseline configs if aide is enabled Description:Checks the log files of aide for changes to baseline configs if aide is enabled Causes:Baseline configurations changed on a File Server. Resolution:Check changed files and revert their changes if needed Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/10461

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["All configured ICAP servers are not responding from file server {file_serve"].iregexp("All configured ICAP servers are not responding from file server {file_serve")}=1
trigger.name: File Server AntiVirus - All ICAP Servers Down
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Services Scope:kCluster Title:File Server AntiVirus - All ICAP Servers Down Name:File Server AntiVirus - All ICAP Servers Down Message:All configured ICAP servers are not responding from file server {file_server_name}. Description:All configured ICAP servers are not responding to scan requests. Description:All configured ICAP servers are not responding to scan requests. Causes:Failed to reach all configured ICAP server from FSVM. Resolution:Check ICAP server and connectivity between FSVMs to ICAP server. Refer to KB article 8414 for more details. Contact Nutanix support if issue still persists or assistance needed. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8414

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["File Server [\S]* has a lot of quarantined / unquarantined fil"].iregexp("File Server [\S]* has a lot of quarantined / unquarantined fil")}=1
trigger.name: File Server AntiVirus - Excessive Quarantined / Unquarantined Files
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Services Scope:kCluster Title:File Server AntiVirus - Excessive Quarantined / Unquarantined Files Name:File Server AntiVirus - Excessive Quarantined / Unquarantined Files Message:File Server {file_server_name} has a lot of quarantined / unquarantined files. Description:Excessive Quarantined / Unquarantined Files on File Server. Description:Excessive Quarantined / Unquarantined Files on File Server. Causes:Number of quarantined / unquarantined files on file server is approaching limit. Resolution:Delete unwanted quarantined / unquarantined files, check ICAP server for false positives or check system for virus activity. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["ICAP server [\S]* is not responding from file server {file_ser"].iregexp("ICAP server [\S]* is not responding from file server {file_ser")}=1
trigger.name: File Server AntiVirus - ICAP Server Down
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Services Scope:kCluster Title:File Server AntiVirus - ICAP Server Down Name:File Server AntiVirus - ICAP Server Down Message:ICAP server {scan_server_host} is not responding from file server {file_server_name}. Description:ICAP server is not responding to scan requests. Description:ICAP server is not responding to scan requests. Causes:Failed to reach ICAP server from FSVM. Resolution:Check ICAP server and connectivity between FSVMs to ICAP server. Refer to KB article 8414 for more details. Contact Nutanix support if issue still persists or assistance needed. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8414

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["File Server [\S]* has reached quarantined / unquarantined file"].iregexp("File Server [\S]* has reached quarantined / unquarantined file")}=1
trigger.name: File Server AntiVirus - Quarantined / Unquarantined Files Limit Reached
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Services Scope:kCluster Title:File Server AntiVirus - Quarantined / Unquarantined Files Limit Reached Name:File Server AntiVirus - Quarantined / Unquarantined Files Limit Reached Message:File Server {file_server_name} has reached quarantined / unquarantined files limit. Description:Quarantined / Unquarantined Files Limit is Reached on File Server. Description:Quarantined / Unquarantined Files Limit is Reached on File Server. Causes:Number of quarantined / unquarantined files on file server reached limit. Resolution:Delete unwanted quarantined / unquarantined files, check ICAP server for false positives or check system for virus activity. Refer to KB article 8416 for more details. Contact Nutanix support if issue still persists or assistance needed. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8416

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Antivirus Scan Queue is Full on FSVM [\S]* of file server {file_server"].iregexp("Antivirus Scan Queue is Full on FSVM [\S]* of file server {file_server")}=1
trigger.name: File Server AntiVirus - Scan Queue Full on FSVM
trigger.description: Category Type: Performance NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Services Scope:kCluster Title:File Server AntiVirus - Scan Queue Full on FSVM Name:File Server AntiVirus - Scan Queue Full on FSVM Message:Antivirus Scan Queue is Full on FSVM {nvm_name} of file server {file_server_name}. Description:Antivirus Scan Queue is Full on FSVM. Description:Antivirus Scan Queue is Full on FSVM. Causes:ICAP Daemon is not able to keep up with in coming requests. Resolution:Check ICAP server status. Check number of ICAP servers configured. Check workload on FSVM. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Antivirus Scan Queue is Piling Up on FSVM [\S]* of file server {file_s"].iregexp("Antivirus Scan Queue is Piling Up on FSVM [\S]* of file server {file_s")}=1
trigger.name: File Server AntiVirus - Scan Queue Piling Up on FSVM
trigger.description: Category Type: Performance NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Services Scope:kCluster Title:File Server AntiVirus - Scan Queue Piling Up on FSVM Name:File Server AntiVirus - Scan Queue Piling Up on FSVM Message:Antivirus Scan Queue is Piling Up on FSVM {nvm_name} of file server {file_server_name}. Description:Antivirus Scan Queue is Piling Up on FSVM. Description:Antivirus Scan Queue is Piling Up on FSVM. Causes:Incoming scan request rate is higher than the scan processing rate. Resolution:Check ICAP server status. Check number of ICAP servers configured. Check workload on FSVM. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Auto Snapshot Failed"].iregexp("Auto Snapshot Failed")}=1
trigger.name: File Server Auto Snapshot Failure
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Auto Snapshot Failed Name:File Server Auto Snapshot Failure Message:{message} Description:File server auto snapshot failed. Description:File server auto snapshot failed. Causes:Auto snapshot was running for a long time. System is overloaded. Resolution:Contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Backup diff found inodes whose path translation failed [\S]*, "].iregexp("Backup diff found inodes whose path translation failed [\S]*, ")}=1
trigger.name: File Server Backup Diff Path Translation Warning
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Services Scope:kCluster Title:File Server Share Backup diff path translation failed Name:File Server Backup Diff Path Translation Warning Message:Backup diff found inodes whose path translation failed {file_server_name}, error information: {failure_msg} Description:Backup diff found inodes whose path translation failed Description:Backup diff found inodes whose path translation failed Causes:File server share may have hardlinks. Resolution:Refer to KB article 8874 for more details. Contact Nutanix support if issue still persists or assistance needed. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8874

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Cassandra status is not normal on few nodes of file server"].iregexp("Cassandra status is not normal on few nodes of file server")}=1
trigger.name: File Server Cassandra Status Failure
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Cassandra status is not normal on few nodes of file server Name:File Server Cassandra Status Failure Message:{message} Description:Cassandra status is not normal on few nodes of file server Description:Cassandra status is not normal on few nodes of file server Causes:See details in the alert message. Resolution:Contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["File server [\S]* clone failed due to [\S]*"].iregexp("File server [\S]* clone failed due to [\S]*")}=1
trigger.name: File Server Clone Failed
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Services Scope:kCluster Title:File Server Clone failed Name:File Server Clone Failed Message:File server {file_server_name} clone failed due to {reason} Description:File Server Clone Failed Description:File Server Clone Failed Causes:Check alert message for details Resolution:Check alert message, Retry clone operation after rectifying, and if the failure persists, then contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["File server [\S]* connected share [\S]* path {sub"].iregexp("File server [\S]* connected share [\S]* path {sub")}=1
trigger.name: File Server Connected Share Path not found
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:File Server connected share path was not found Name:File Server Connected Share Path not found Message:File server {file_server_name} connected share {child_share_name} path {submount_path} was not found. Description:Path for connected share is not available. Description:Path for connected share is not available. Causes:The submount path doesn't exist. Resolution:Remove submount path and reconfigure the share with new or recreated submount path Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["File server container(s) with unexpected files present: {unexpected_files_m"].iregexp("File server container(s) with unexpected files present: {unexpected_files_m")}=1
trigger.name: File Server Container Unexpected Files
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:File Server Container has Unexpected Files Name:File Server Container Unexpected Files Message:File server container(s) with unexpected files present: {unexpected_files_msg} Description:Nutanix Files container has unexpected files which is not recommended. Description:Nutanix Files container has unexpected files which is not recommended. Causes:Unexpected files are present on Nutanix Files container. Resolution:Move any non fileserver VMs out of Nutanix Files container. Refer to KB article 6944. Contact Nutanix support if issue still persists or assistance needed. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/6944

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Some files are possibly corrupted"].iregexp("Some files are possibly corrupted")}=1
trigger.name: File Server Corrupted Files
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Some files are possibly corrupted Name:File Server Corrupted Files Message:{message} Description:Some files are possibly corrupted. Description:Some files are possibly corrupted. Causes:Some files are possibly corrupted for file server. Resolution:Contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["The file server [\S]* could not get updated CVM IP address."].iregexp("The file server [\S]* could not get updated CVM IP address.")}=1
trigger.name: File Server CVM IP update failed
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:File Server failed to get updated CVM IP address. Name:File Server CVM IP update failed Message:The file server {file_server_name} could not get updated CVM IP address. Description:File server Controller VM IP update failed. Description:File server Controller VM IP update failed. Causes:AOS cluster is not able to contact file server. Resolution:Ensure correct Cluster IP Address Configuration procedure is followed. Refer to KB article 2290 for more details. Contact Nutanix support if issue still persists or assistance needed. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/2290

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["File server(s) not reachable on ports are: [\S]*."].iregexp("File server(s) not reachable on ports are: [\S]*.")}=1
trigger.name: File Server Cvm Port Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Host Scope:kCluster Title:File Server is not reachable at required ports from the platform. Name:File Server Cvm Port Check Message:File server(s) not reachable on ports are: {fs_port_msg}. Description:File Server is not reachable at required ports from the platform. Description:File Server is not reachable at required ports from the platform. Causes:Either File server is not reachable from the platform OR File Server ports are blocked by firewall. Resolution:Check file server status. Ensure the File Server Port Requirements are met entirely, Please refer to the Nutanix Files User Guide Files Deployment section for port requirements. Refer to KB article 9845. Contact Nutanix support if issue still persists or assistance needed. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/9845

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Platform is not reachable at required ports from the fileserver VM."].iregexp("Platform is not reachable at required ports from the fileserver VM.")}=1
trigger.name: File Server Cvm Port Unreachable
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Platform is not reachable at required ports from the fileserver VM. Name:File Server Cvm Port Unreachable Message:{message} Description:Platform is not reachable at required ports from the fileserver VM. Description:Platform is not reachable at required ports from the fileserver VM. Causes:Either Platform services are down OR Platform ports are blocked by firewall. Resolution:Check Platform status. Ensure the File Server Port Requirements are met entirely, Refer Nutanix Files User Guide. Refer to KB article 11022. Contact Nutanix support if issue still persists or assistance needed. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/11022

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["File Server [\S]* internal network [\S]* is not on the "].iregexp("File Server [\S]* internal network [\S]* is not on the ")}=1
trigger.name: File Server Cvm Subnet Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Host Scope:kCluster Title:File Server internal network is not on the same subnet as Controller VM Name:File Server Cvm Subnet Check Message:File Server {file_server_name} internal network {nvm_subnet} is not on the same subnet as Controller VM {cvm_ip} subnet {cvm_subnet} Description:File Server internal network and Controller VM are in different Subnet Description:File Server internal network and Controller VM are in different Subnet Causes:File Server internal network and the Controller VM are in different subnets. This may cause performance issues. Resolution:Re-ip the file server's internal network with IP as the same subnet as the Controller VM. Refer to KB article 9845. Contact Nutanix support if issue still persists or assistance needed. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/9845

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["File server [\S]* Disaster Recovery feature has both source an"].iregexp("File server [\S]* Disaster Recovery feature has both source an")}=1
trigger.name: File Server Disaster Recovery - both source and target are active file servers
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:File Server Disaster Recovery - both source and target are active file servers Name:File Server Disaster Recovery - both source and target are active file servers Message:File server {file_server_name} Disaster Recovery feature has both source and target file servers set as active with read-write shares. {message} Description:File server Disaster Recovery feature has both source and target file servers set as active with read-write shares. Description:File server Disaster Recovery feature has both source and target file servers set as active with read-write shares. Causes:Configuration error during Disaster Recovery setup on source and/or target file servers. Resolution:Please make the target file server as standby with read-only shares. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/9873

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to take over current file server resources during Disaster Recovery "].iregexp("Failed to take over current file server resources during Disaster Recovery ")}=1
trigger.name: File Server Disaster Recovery - failback operation failed
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:File Server Disaster Recovery - failback operation failed Name:File Server Disaster Recovery - failback operation failed Message:Failed to take over current file server resources during Disaster Recovery Failback operation on {file_server_name}. {message} Description:File server - failed to take over current file server resource during Disaster Recovery Failback operation. Description:File server - failed to take over current file server resource during Disaster Recovery Failback operation. Causes:Various. Please see alert message for more details. Resolution:Correct the error and retry the operation. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to take over primary file server during Disaster Recovery Failover o"].iregexp("Failed to take over primary file server during Disaster Recovery Failover o")}=1
trigger.name: File Server Disaster Recovery - failover operation failed
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:File Server Disaster Recovery - failover operation failed Name:File Server Disaster Recovery - failover operation failed Message:Failed to take over primary file server during Disaster Recovery Failover operation on {file_server_name}. {message} Description:File server - failed to take over primary file server during Disaster Recovery Failover operation. Description:File server - failed to take over primary file server during Disaster Recovery Failover operation. Causes:Various. Please see alert message for more details. Resolution:Correct the error and retry the operation. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["File server [\S]* Disaster Recovery feature is not able meet c"].iregexp("File server [\S]* Disaster Recovery feature is not able meet c")}=1
trigger.name: File Server Disaster Recovery - not able to meet RPO
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:File Server Disaster Recovery - not able to meet RPO Name:File Server Disaster Recovery - not able to meet RPO Message:File server {file_server_name} Disaster Recovery feature is not able meet current RPO standard. {message} Description:File server Disaster Recovery feature is not able meet current RPO standard. Description:File server Disaster Recovery feature is not able meet current RPO standard. Causes:An error on source or target file server can cause replication to proceed slowly. Resolution:Please check the alert message for details. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/9872

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["One or more shares are not protected for [\S]*. [\S]*"].iregexp("One or more shares are not protected for [\S]*. [\S]*")}=1
trigger.name: File Server Disaster Recovery - Source and Target Have Mismatched Protocols Configured
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:File Server Disaster Recovery - Source and Target Have Mismatched Protocols Configured Name:File Server Disaster Recovery - Source and Target Have Mismatched Protocols Configured Message:One or more shares are not protected for {file_server_name}. {message} Description:File server - failed to establish source and target relationship for shares due to mismatched protocol configuration. Description:File server - failed to establish source and target relationship for shares due to mismatched protocol configuration. Causes:Source and target file servers are not configured to support the same protocols. Resolution:Configure source and target file servers with the same protocols. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["File server [\S]* Disaster Recovery - Target site expansion re"].iregexp("File server [\S]* Disaster Recovery - Target site expansion re")}=1
trigger.name: File Server Disaster Recovery - source file server has more nodes than target file server
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:File Server Disaster Recovery - source file server has more nodes than target file server Name:File Server Disaster Recovery - source file server has more nodes than target file server Message:File server {file_server_name} Disaster Recovery - Target site expansion required. {message} Description:File server Disaster Recovery - number of nodes on source and target file servers must be the same. Description:File server Disaster Recovery - number of nodes on source and target file servers must be the same. Causes:Number of file server nodes on source and target has changed due to scale-out operation. Resolution:Expand or reduce the node count on source and target file servers to make the node count identical on both file servers. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/9858

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["File server [\S]* Disaster Recovery - Source site expansion re"].iregexp("File server [\S]* Disaster Recovery - Source site expansion re")}=1
trigger.name: File Server Disaster Recovery - target file server has more nodes than source file server
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:File Server Disaster Recovery - target file server has more nodes than source file server Name:File Server Disaster Recovery - target file server has more nodes than source file server Message:File server {file_server_name} Disaster Recovery - Source site expansion required. {message} Description:File server Disaster Recovery - number of nodes on source and target file servers must be the same. Description:File server Disaster Recovery - number of nodes on source and target file servers must be the same. Causes:Number of file server nodes on source and target has changed due to scale-out operation. Resolution:Expand or reduce the node count on source and target file servers to make the node count identical on both file servers. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/9858

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["File server [\S]* Disaster Recovery - Target site is not reach"].iregexp("File server [\S]* Disaster Recovery - Target site is not reach")}=1
trigger.name: File Server Disaster Recovery - target site not reachable
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:File Server Disaster Recovery - target site not reachable Name:File Server Disaster Recovery - target site not reachable Message:File server {file_server_name} Disaster Recovery - Target site is not reachable. {message} Description:File server target site is not reachable for Disaster Recovery Description:File server target site is not reachable for Disaster Recovery Causes:Network connectivity issue between the source and the target. Resolution:Please check the network connectivity between the source and the target. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/9857

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["/home partition usage on File server VM [\S]* on file server {file_se"].iregexp("/home partition usage on File server VM [\S]* on file server {file_se")}=1
trigger.name: File Server Disk Usage Warning
trigger.description: Category Type: Capacity NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Services Scope:kCluster Title:/home partition usage on a file server VM higher than threshold Name:File Server Disk Usage Warning Message:/home partition usage on File server VM {fsvm_name} on file server {file_server_name} at {usage_pct} (greater than threshold {threshold_pct}). Description:Space consumption under /home partition on file server VM is higher than the set threshold Description:Space consumption under /home partition on file server VM is higher than the set threshold Causes:File server has one or more nodes under extensive load. Resolution:Remove unwanted data or files from under /home for the specified file server. Refer to KB article 8478 for more details. Contact Nutanix support if issue still persists or assistance needed. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8478

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["File server [\S]* DNS records cannot be updated"].iregexp("File server [\S]* DNS records cannot be updated")}=1
trigger.name: File Server DNS - Unable to refresh DNS records
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:File server DNS records cannot be refreshed Name:File Server DNS - Unable to refresh DNS records Message:File server {file_server_name} DNS records cannot be updated Description:File server DNS records periodic refresh failed Description:File server DNS records periodic refresh failed Causes:DNS entries may not be created with Nutanix Files computer account due to insufficient permissions. Resolution:Create static DNS entries for the fileserver manually using 'DNS' button. Update required permissions for the Nutanix Files computer account. Refer to KB article 8405 for more details. Contact Nutanix support if issue still persists or assistance needed. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8405

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Duplicate IP address detected for a file server VMs for [\S]*."].iregexp("Duplicate IP address detected for a file server VMs for [\S]*.")}=1
trigger.name: File Server Duplicate IP Address Detected
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Duplicate IP address detected for a File Server VM. Name:File Server Duplicate IP Address Detected Message:Duplicate IP address detected for a file server VMs for {file_server_name}. Error Message: {message} Description:File server VMs have IP address conflict. Description:File server VMs have IP address conflict. Causes:Another host has started using a file server VM IP address. Resolution:Update IP address on host which has an IP address conflict with file server VM. Refer to KB article 8951 for more details. Contact Nutanix support if issue still persists or assistance needed. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8951

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Some of File server [\S]* entities are not protected"].iregexp("Some of File server [\S]* entities are not protected")}=1
trigger.name: File Server Entities Not Protected
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Services Scope:kCluster Title:File server entities not protected Name:File Server Entities Not Protected Message:Some of File server {file_server_name} entities are not protected Description:Checks all File server entities are protected Description:Checks all File server entities are protected Causes:Some of the File Server entities are not protected Resolution:Refer to KB article 4312. Contact Nutanix support if issue still persists or assistance needed. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/4312

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["File server external network not functional."].iregexp("File server external network not functional.")}=1
trigger.name: File Server External IP Failure
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Services Scope:kCluster Title:File server external network not functional. Name:File Server External IP Failure Message:{message} Description:One or more of the external IP(s) may not be operational or reachable. Description:One or more of the external IP(s) may not be operational or reachable. Causes:Most probable cause is either network unreachability on the external interface or core Nutanix files cluster services are down/unstable. See details in the alert message. Resolution:Ensure that external network is reachable, please refer to KB10434 for more details. Contact Nutanix support if the issue still persists. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/10434

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Files cluster [\S]* HA takeover has failed multiple times on F"].iregexp("Files cluster [\S]* HA takeover has failed multiple times on F")}=1
trigger.name: File server HA Takeover Failure
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Files cluster HA takeover failure Name:File server HA Takeover Failure Message:Files cluster {file_server_name} HA takeover has failed multiple times on FSVM {fsvm_internal_ip} due to {message}. Description:Files cluster HA takeover failed Description:Files cluster HA takeover failed Causes:Files cluster HA takeover process failed for multiple attempts Resolution:Refer to KB article 8419 for more details. Contact Nutanix support if issue still persists or assistance needed. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8419

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["File server [\S]* is in heterogeneous state, as File Server VM"].iregexp("File server [\S]* is in heterogeneous state, as File Server VM")}=1
trigger.name: File Server In Heterogeneous State
trigger.description: Category Type: Performance NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:File Server in heterogeneous state. Name:File Server In Heterogeneous State Message:File server {file_server_name} is in heterogeneous state, as File Server VM configuration update operation failed due to {reason} Description:File server in heterogeneous state. Nodes do not match in their CPU or memory configuration. Description:File server in heterogeneous state. Nodes do not match in their CPU or memory configuration. Causes:Check alert message for details. Resolution:Get the largest configured CPU and memory values among VMs of reported File Server in VM page. Free up resources on hypervisor hosts and retry File Server VM configuration update with these values in File Server page. Contact Nutanix support if issue still persists or assistance needed. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["File server Inode usage is high"].iregexp("File server Inode usage is high")}=1
trigger.name: File Server Inode Usage High
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Services Scope:kCluster Title:File server Inode usage is high Name:File Server Inode Usage High Message:{message} Description:The number of free Inodes in the cluster is getting low. Inode contains information about data files attributes. Description:The number of free Inodes in the cluster is getting low. Inode contains information about data files attributes. Causes:There can be multiple causes including overall high storage utilization. See details in the alert message. Resolution:Execute Cluster Health check to ensure there are no underlying storage high utilization issues, please refer to KB10436 for more details. Contact Nutanix support if the issue still persists. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/10436

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["One or more inconsistent entities have been found. This may cause upgrades "].iregexp("One or more inconsistent entities have been found. This may cause upgrades ")}=1
trigger.name: File Server Invalid IDF State
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Inconsistent state found in File Server Name:File Server Invalid IDF State Message:One or more inconsistent entities have been found. This may cause upgrades to fail. Description:One or more inconsistent entities have been found. This may cause upgrades to fail. Description:One or more inconsistent entities have been found. This may cause upgrades to fail. Causes:IDF is in an inconsistent state. Resolution:Contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["File server [\S]* is not healthy and leads to invalid snapshot"].iregexp("File server [\S]* is not healthy and leads to invalid snapshot")}=1
trigger.name: File Server Invalid Snapshot Warning
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Services Scope:kCluster Title:File server invalid snapshot Name:File Server Invalid Snapshot Warning Message:File server {file_server_name} is not healthy and leads to invalid snapshot Description:Checks that File server is in healthy state to take snapshot Description:Checks that File server is in healthy state to take snapshot Causes:File Server NVMs might deleted Resolution:Refer to KB article 4312. Contact Nutanix support if issue still persists or assistance needed. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/3691

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Discovery of iSCSI targets failed for file server [\S]*"].iregexp("Discovery of iSCSI targets failed for file server [\S]*")}=1
trigger.name: File Server iSCSI Discovery Failure
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:Discovery of iSCSI targets failed. Name:File Server iSCSI Discovery Failure Message:Discovery of iSCSI targets failed for file server {file_server_name} Description:Failed to discover iSCSI targets on the CVM during the discovery process. Description:Failed to discover iSCSI targets on the CVM during the discovery process. Causes:The 'external_data_services_ip' or the CVM IP addresses are not reachable from the FSVM. Resolution:Please refer article 8216 for more details on Changing Data Services IP Address. Contact Nutanix support if issue still persists or assistance needed. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8216

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["File server iSCSI service is not healthy"].iregexp("File server iSCSI service is not healthy")}=1
trigger.name: File Server iSCSI Service Unavailable
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Services Scope:kCluster Title:File server iSCSI service is not healthy Name:File Server iSCSI Service Unavailable Message:{message} Description:iSCSI service is not in an healthy state on the cluster and can lead to storage unavailability. Description:iSCSI service is not in an healthy state on the cluster and can lead to storage unavailability. Causes:iSCSI service is in a hung state or not in a functional state. Resolution:Execute Cluster Health check to ensure there are no underlying cluster issues, please refer to KB10437 for more details. Contact Nutanix support if the issue still persists. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/10437

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["File Server [\S]* could not join the Domain because [\S]*."].iregexp("File Server [\S]* could not join the Domain because [\S]*.")}=1
