Error could be due to one of the following reasons: Domain credentials are invalid. Correct Port for connecting to AD is not being used. File Server AD Object already exists in the domain. Resolution:The resolution is to identify the reason from one of the possible causes in the cause list. Please refer Nutanix Files Guide 'Pre-requisite' section for more details. If you are unable to resolve the issues, contact Nutanix Support for assistance. Nutanix KB:

trigger.name: File server Tiering Service failed to mark the bucket for cleanup
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Services Scope:kCluster Title:File server Tiering Service failed to mark the bucket for cleanup Name:File server Tiering Service failed to mark the bucket for cleanup Message:{message} Description:Tiering service failed to mark the bucket for garbage collection. Description:Tiering service failed to mark the bucket for garbage collection. Causes:The following causes are possible:File Server not in healthy stateProblems with Object Store Connectivity Resolution:Please cleanup the Object Store. Refer to KB11074 for more details. Contact Nutanix support for assistance. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/11074

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["File Server Tiering Service is not healthy"].iregexp("File Server Tiering Service is not healthy")}=1
trigger.name: File Server Tiering Service is not healthy
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Services Scope:kCluster Title:File Server Tiering Service is not healthy Name:File Server Tiering Service is not healthy Message:{message} Description:Tiering service is not in a healthy state and can lead to temporary unavailability of tiered files. Description:Tiering service is not in a healthy state and can lead to temporary unavailability of tiered files. Causes:Tiering service might be overloaded or is unavailable. Resolution:Check file server cluster health and refer to KB11073 for more details. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/11073

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Time drift between the file server VMs and the Active Directory is at {time"].iregexp("Time drift between the file server VMs and the Active Directory is at {time")}=1
trigger.name: File Server time is out of sync with the Active Directory
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:File Server time is out of sync with the Active Directory Name:File Server time is out of sync with the Active Directory Message:Time drift between the file server VMs and the Active Directory is at {time_drift_secs} seconds on file server {file_server_name}. If the drift becomes more than 300 seconds, the clients may get disconnected from the fileserver. Description:File server time is out of sync with the Active Directory domain controllers. Description:File server time is out of sync with the Active Directory domain controllers. Causes:NTP is not configured correctly or the NTP service is not functioning. Resolution:Check that the NTP service is running and the NTP servers are reachable from the file server VMs. Refer to KB article 8404 for more details. Contact Nutanix support if issue still persists or assistance needed. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8404

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Found unique fsid failure [\S]*, error information: {failure_m"].iregexp("Found unique fsid failure [\S]*, error information: {failure_m")}=1
trigger.name: File Server Unique Fsid Failure
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Services Scope:kCluster Title:File Server Unique Fsid failure Name:File Server Unique Fsid Failure Message:Found unique fsid failure {file_server_name}, error information: {failure_msg} Description:Assigning Unique Fsid failed Description:Assigning Unique Fsid failed Causes:Duplicate Unique Fsid present Resolution:Contact Nutanix support if issue still persists or assistance needed. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Upgrade of file server [\S]* failed due to [\S]*."].iregexp("Upgrade of file server [\S]* failed due to [\S]*.")}=1
trigger.name: File Server Upgrade Failed
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:File Server upgrade failed Name:File Server Upgrade Failed Message:Upgrade of file server {file_server_name} failed due to {reason}. Description:File Server Upgrade Failed. Description:File Server Upgrade Failed. Causes:Check alert message for details Resolution:From Controller VM run 'ncc health_checks fileserver_checks run_all' and resolve the reported issues. If you are unable to resolve the issue reported by NCC, contact Nutanix Support for assistance. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Upgrade of file server [\S]* is stuck due to [\S]*."].iregexp("Upgrade of file server [\S]* is stuck due to [\S]*.")}=1
trigger.name: File Server Upgrade Task Stuck
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:File Server upgrade task stuck Name:File Server Upgrade Task Stuck Message:Upgrade of file server {file_server_name} is stuck due to {reason}. Description:File Server Upgrade Task Stuck. Description:File Server Upgrade Task Stuck. Causes:Check alert message for details Resolution:Refer to KB article 8438 for more details. Contact Nutanix support if issue still persists or assistance needed. Once the issue is resolved, execute 'afs infra.resume_fs_upgrade' on cvm to resume Nutanix Files upgrade. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8438

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["File server [\S]* upgrade task hung for too long"].iregexp("File server [\S]* upgrade task hung for too long")}=1
trigger.name: File Server Upgrade Task Stuck Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Host Scope:kCluster Title:File server upgrade task hung for too long Name:File Server Upgrade Task Stuck Check Message:File server {file_server_name} upgrade task hung for too long Description:Check File server task is hung for a long time. Description:Check File server task is hung for a long time. Causes:Various. Check alert message for details. Resolution:Refer to KB article 4314. Contact Nutanix support if issue still persists or assistance needed. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/4314

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["The values provided for File server [\S]*'s user management op"].iregexp("The values provided for File server [\S]*'s user management op")}=1
trigger.name: File Server User Management Configuration Failed
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:File Server User Management Configuration Failed Name:File Server User Management Configuration Failed Message:The values provided for File server {file_server_name}'s user management options are incorrect. Description:Given user management options could not be configured for the file server. Description:Given user management options could not be configured for the file server. Causes:Failed to configure user management with given options Resolution:Update correct entries against fields in the User Management tab. Refer to KB article 9123 for more details. Contact Nutanix support if issue still persists or assistance needed. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/9123

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["File server [\S]* : File server VM [\S]* boot ISO are"].iregexp("File server [\S]* : File server VM [\S]* boot ISO are")}=1
trigger.name: File Server VM Boot ISO Disconnected
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Anomaly Scope:kCluster Title:File Server VM Boot ISO Disconnected Name:File Server VM Boot ISO Disconnected Message:File server {file_server_name} : File server VM {vm_name_list} boot ISO are disconnected. Description:Checks if the File Server VM boot ISO is connected or not Description:Checks if the File Server VM boot ISO is connected or not Causes:File Server VM boot ISO is disconnected Resolution:Refer to KB article 7887. Contact Nutanix support if issue still persists or assistance needed. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/3691

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["File server [\S]* : File server VM [\S]* hardware clo"].iregexp("File server [\S]* : File server VM [\S]* hardware clo")}=1
trigger.name: File server VM Hardware Clock Timezone not Supported
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Anomaly Scope:kCluster Title:File server VM Hardware Clock Timezone not Supported Name:File server VM Hardware Clock Timezone not Supported Message:File server {file_server_name} : File server VM {vm_name_list} hardware clock timezone are not UTC. Description:Checks that file server VM hardware clock timezone is UTC Description:Checks that file server VM hardware clock timezone is UTC Causes:File server VM hardware clock timezone is set to unsupported value Resolution:Refer to KB article 6559. Contact Nutanix support if issue still persists or assistance needed. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/3691

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["File server [\S]*'s VMs ([\S]*) are down"].iregexp("File server [\S]*'s VMs ([\S]*) are down")}=1
trigger.name: File Server VM Reachable
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-VM Scope:kCluster Title:File server VM down check Name:File Server VM Reachable Message:File server {file_server_name}'s VMs ({svm_names}) are down Description:Checks if all the file server VMs are reachable. Description:Checks if all the file server VMs are reachable. Causes:One or more VMs are down on file server. Resolution:Refer to KB article 3691. Contact Nutanix support if issue still persists or assistance needed. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/3691

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["File server [\S]* has multiple VMs on a single node."].iregexp("File server [\S]* has multiple VMs on a single node.")}=1
trigger.name: File Server VM Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Host Scope:kCluster Title:File server multiple VMs on single node check Name:File Server VM Status Message:File server {file_server_name} has multiple VMs on a single node. Description:Checks if multiple file server VMs are running on a single node. Description:Checks if multiple file server VMs are running on a single node. Causes:File server VMs are running on a single node. Resolution:Refer to KB article 3027. Contact Nutanix support if issue still persists or assistance needed. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/3027

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Disabling fingerprinting (deduplication) for future writes. Calculated meta"].iregexp("Disabling fingerprinting (deduplication) for future writes. Calculated meta")}=1
trigger.name: Fingerprinting On Write
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Storage Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:CVM-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:Fingerprinting Disabled Name:Fingerprinting On Write Message:Disabling fingerprinting (deduplication) for future writes. Calculated metadata usage of {metadata_usage} bytes exceeds safety limit of {metadata_limit} bytes on Controller VM {service_vm_id}. The metadata disk size is {metadata_disk_size}. Description:Fingerprinting Disabled Description:Fingerprinting Disabled Causes:The metadata disk is used for metadata and data. Once the metadata portion on the disk exceeds the safety threshold AOS disables fingerprinting (deduplication) of future writes. Metadata sizes can increase due to a variety of reasons such as having too many snapshots, or simply because too much data is fingerprinted. Resolution:Once the metadata size is brought under the safety limit (for example, by removing unneeded snapshots, or by expanding the cluster size), the fingerprinting will be auto-enabled. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["One or more Powered Off flash-mode-enabled VMs detected."].iregexp("One or more Powered Off flash-mode-enabled VMs detected.")}=1
trigger.name: Flash Mode Enabled VM Power Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Storage Affected Entity Type:storage_pool Subcategory Type:Cluster-Disk Scope:kCluster Title:Flash-mode-enabled VM Power Status Name:Flash Mode Enabled VM Power Status Message:One or more Powered Off flash-mode-enabled VMs detected. Description:Check if any flash-mode-enabled VMs are Powered Off. Description:Check if any flash-mode-enabled VMs are Powered Off. Causes:One or more flash-mode-enabled VMs are Powered Off. Resolution:Disable Flash Mode on the Powered Off VMs, or power them on. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/3671

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Flash Mode usage has exceeded the threshold limit."].iregexp("Flash Mode usage has exceeded the threshold limit.")}=1
trigger.name: Flash Mode Usage
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Storage Affected Entity Type:storage_pool Subcategory Type:Cluster-Disk Scope:kCluster Title:Flash Mode Usage Limit Exceeded Name:Flash Mode Usage Message:Flash Mode usage has exceeded the threshold limit. Description:Check the amount of usage by flash-mode-enabled vDisks with respect to the threshold limit. Description:Check the amount of usage by flash-mode-enabled vDisks with respect to the threshold limit. Causes:Flash-mode-enabled vDisks are using more flash tier space than the allotted limit. Resolution:Reduce the number of flash-mode-enabled vDisks or increase the capacity of the flash tier. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/3671

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to allocate [\S]* floating IPs, required for the"].iregexp("Failed to allocate [\S]* floating IPs, required for the")}=1
trigger.name: Floating IPs Allocation Failure.
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Recovery Plan Scope:kCluster Title:Floating IPs Allocation Failed Name:Floating IPs Allocation Failure. Message:Failed to allocate {num_failed_floating_ips} floating IPs, required for the dynamic allocation, for {operation_type} on the Recovery Plan {recovery_plan_name}. Description:Floating IPs allocation failed. Description:Floating IPs allocation failed. Causes:The system may not have enough floating IP addresses. Resolution:Try to manually assign pre-allocated floating IPs for the vNICs. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to deallocate [\S]* floating IPs, which were all"].iregexp("Failed to deallocate [\S]* floating IPs, which were all")}=1
trigger.name: Floating IPs Deallocation Failure.
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Recovery Plan Scope:kCluster Title:Floating IPs Deallocation Failed Name:Floating IPs Deallocation Failure. Message:Failed to deallocate {num_failed_floating_ips} floating IPs, which were allocated dynamically but are not associated with any vNIC, for {operation_type} on the Recovery Plan {recovery_plan_name}. Description:Floating IPs deallocation failed. Description:Floating IPs deallocation failed. Causes:The floating IPs might be in use. Resolution:If you are not using the floating IPs, deallocate them manually. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Flow operation failed on [\S]*. [\S]*"].iregexp("Flow operation failed on [\S]*. [\S]*")}=1
trigger.name: Flow control plane failed
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration ControllerVM Network Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:CVM-Network Scope:kCluster Title:Flow Control Plane Failed. Name:Flow control plane failed Message:Flow operation failed on {remote_uuid}. {reason} Description:Flow failure event. Description:Flow failure event. Causes:Microsegmentation service is unreachable or the PE cluster is unavailable or Remote Connection from PC to PE failed or AHV host is unavailable or connection from PE to host failed. Check description. Resolution:Check PC microsegmentation service, Check PE acropolis service, AHV microsegmentation module. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Flow mode change failed on [\S]*. [\S]*"].iregexp("Flow mode change failed on [\S]*. [\S]*")}=1
trigger.name: Flow policy hit mode change failed
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration ControllerVM Network Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:CVM-Network Scope:kCluster Title:Flow Mode Change Failed Name:Flow policy hit mode change failed Message:Flow mode change failed on {remote_uuid}. {reason} Description:Flow control plane failure event Description:Flow control plane failure event Causes:Flow mode configuration could not be programmed from PC to PE or PE to AHV. In Default mode network traffic hitting security policies won't be logged on AHV. Resolution:Ensure AHV host is reachable from Prism Central. Ensure all the services in Prism Central and Prism Element are in a healthy state and AHV host has more than 4 GB memory available. If the issue is still not resolved, collect cvm_logs and contact Nutanix Support Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Flow policy operation failed for [\S]*. [\S]*"].iregexp("Flow policy operation failed for [\S]*. [\S]*")}=1
trigger.name: Flow rule failed
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration ControllerVM Network Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:CVM-Network Scope:kCluster Title:Flow Rule Failed. Name:Flow rule failed Message:Flow policy operation failed for {rule_name}. {reason} Description:Programming a Flow rule failed. Description:Programming a Flow rule failed. Causes:Microsegmentation service is unreachable or the PC is unavailable or the PE cluster is unavailable or Remote Connection from PC to PE failed or AHV host is unavailable or connection from PE to host failed. Check description. Resolution:Check PC microsegmentation service, PE acropolis service, PC to PE connection, PE to AHV connection. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Flow visualization statistics collector service was restarted {max_restart_"].iregexp("Flow visualization statistics collector service was restarted {max_restart_")}=1
trigger.name: Flow visualization statistics collector service monitor
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Network Scope:kCluster Title:Flow visualization statistics collector service restart detected Name:Flow visualization statistics collector service monitor Message:Flow visualization statistics collector service was restarted {max_restart_count} times in last {time_interval_min} minutes on host {host_ip}. Description:Check if flow visualization statistics collector service was restarted. Description:Check if flow visualization statistics collector service was restarted. Causes:Flow visualization statistics collector service was restarted 10 times in the last 15 minutes. Resolution:Review KB 8911. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8911

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["For [\S]*, time drift between the FSVMs ([\S]* and {"].iregexp("For [\S]*, time drift between the FSVMs ([\S]* and {")}=1
trigger.name: FSVM Time Drift Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:File Server Time Difference High Name:FSVM Time Drift Status Message:For {file_server_name}, time drift between the FSVMs ({lower_time_ip} and {higher_time_ip}) is more than the acceptable value of {time_difference_limit_secs} Description:The time drift between the FSVMs is beyond the acceptable range Description:The time drift between the FSVMs is beyond the acceptable range Causes:NTP is not configured correctly or the NTP service is not functioning. Resolution:Check that the NTP service is running and is reachable from the FSVMs Refer KB article 8135 for more details. Contact Nutanix support if issue still persists or assistance needed. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8135

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Controller VM [\S]* with IP address [\S]* has "].iregexp("Controller VM [\S]* with IP address [\S]* has ")}=1
trigger.name: FT2 Configuration
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration ControllerVM Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Hardware Scope:kNode Title:Unsupported Configuration For Redundancy Factor 3 Name:FT2 Configuration Message:Controller VM {service_vm_id} with IP address {service_vm_external_ip} has {actual_ram_size_gb}GB RAM which does not meet the configuration requirement of {min_ram_required_gb}GB RAM to support 'Redundancy Factor 3' feature. Description:Unsupported Configuration For Redundancy Factor 3. Description:Unsupported Configuration For Redundancy Factor 3. Causes:To support 'Redundancy Factor 3' feature all controller VMs in the cluster must meet the minimum requirements for RAM. Resolution:Increase RAM on the Controller VM to meet the minimum requirement. Contact Nutanix support for assistance. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Orphaned egroups are high"].iregexp("Orphaned egroups are high")}=1
trigger.name: Garbage egroups check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Node-Services Scope:kNode Title:Number of orphaned egroups is over the recommended threshold. Name:Garbage egroups check Message:Orphaned egroups are high Description:Check that the number of orphaned egroups are below the recommended threshold. Description:Check that the number of orphaned egroups are below the recommended threshold. Causes:Number of orphaned groups is over the recommended threshold. Resolution:Review KB 1574. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1574

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Mismatch detected in count of GPUs"].iregexp("Mismatch detected in count of GPUs")}=1
trigger.name: GPU Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Hardware Hardware Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Host-Hardware Scope:kNode Title:Mismatch detected in count of GPUs Name:GPU Status Message:{alert_msg} Description:Check that GPU have not faulted. Description:Check that GPU have not faulted. Causes:The device is failing. Resolution:Replace the device. Refer to the Nutanix documentation for instructions. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1524

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["GPU Temperature is not within threshold"].iregexp("GPU Temperature is not within threshold")}=1
trigger.name: GPU Temperature
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Hardware Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Host-Hardware Scope:kNode Title:GPU Temperature is not within threshold Name:GPU Temperature Message:{alert_msg} Description:Checks if GPU temperature is beyond threshold Description:Checks if GPU temperature is beyond threshold Causes:The device is overheating to the point of imminent failure. Resolution:Ensure that the fans in the block are functioning properly and that the environment is cool enough. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1524

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Hardware clock in host [\S]* has failed."].iregexp("Hardware clock in host [\S]* has failed.")}=1
trigger.name: Hardware Clock Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Hardware Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Host-Hardware Scope:kNode Title:Hardware Clock Failure Name:Hardware Clock Status Message:Hardware clock in host {host_ip} has failed. Description:Check if the hardware clock has failed. Description:Check if the hardware clock has failed. Causes:The RTC clock on the host has failed or the RTC battery has died. Resolution:Replace the node. Follow the instructions mentioned in KB 2462. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/2462

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["For a cluster with compute-only nodes the total amount of hyperconverged ho"].iregexp("For a cluster with compute-only nodes the total amount of hyperconverged ho")}=1
trigger.name: HC network bandwidth is not enough to handle CO node(s)
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Insufficient host bandwidth Name:HC network bandwidth is not enough to handle CO node(s) Message:For a cluster with compute-only nodes the total amount of hyperconverged host bandwidth must be double the amount of compute-only host bandwidth. Description:Checks whether the total hyperconverged network bandwidth is twice the compute-only bandwidth. Description:Checks whether the total hyperconverged network bandwidth is twice the compute-only bandwidth. Causes:Cluster is configured with too many compute-only nodes. Cluster is configured with less number of hyperconverged nodes. Hyperconverged/compute-only host NIC is misconfigured. Resolution:Remove compute-only nodes from the cluster. Add hyperconverged nodes to the cluster. Reconfigure hyperconverged host NICs to increase the amount of bandwidth. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/7012

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Cluster cannot tolerate [\S]* node failure. Current usag"].iregexp("Cluster cannot tolerate [\S]* node failure. Current usag")}=1
trigger.name: High disk space usage
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:storage_pool Subcategory Type:Cluster-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:Cluster does not have enough free space to tolerate a node failure Name:High disk space usage Message:Cluster cannot tolerate {num_node_failure_limit} node failure. Current usage of {used_bytes} bytes exceeds max limit of {usable_bytes} bytes. Description:Check if the storage pool has sufficient free space to maintain the desired replication factor in the event of a node failure, based on highest replication factor container requirements Description:Check if the storage pool has sufficient free space to maintain the desired replication factor in the event of a node failure, based on highest replication factor container requirements Causes:Inadequate free space on the cluster Resolution:Clean out unused data from guest VMs, unneeded reservation at container level, or VMs from the container to be below the threshold. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1863

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["CPU [\S]* on host [\S]* has extremely low /high frequency: {alert_ms"].iregexp("CPU [\S]* on host [\S]* has extremely low /high frequency: {alert_ms")}=1
trigger.name: Host CPU Frequency Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Node-Services Scope:kNode Title:The frequency of CPU {cpu_id} on host {host_ip} is extremely low Name:Host CPU Frequency Check Message:CPU {cpu_id} on host {host_ip} has extremely low /high frequency: {alert_msg} Description:Checks the frequencies of CPUs on a node. Description:Checks the frequencies of CPUs on a node. Causes:Either a power supply or a fan has failed. A failed power supply reduces the power available to the CPU, and a failed fan leads to overheating of the CPU. Each condition causes the frequency of the CPU to drop below the frequency that is required for node operations. Resolution:Replace the failed power supply or fans. Refer to the Nutanix documentation for instructions. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/5542

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Disk '[\S]*' space usage ([\S]*%) on host [\S]* has exceeded "].iregexp("Disk '[\S]*' space usage ([\S]*%) on host [\S]* has exceeded ")}=1
trigger.name: Host Disk Usage
trigger.description: Category Type: Capacity Storage Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Host-Disk Scope:kNode Title:Hypervisor Disk usage is above the recommended threshold. Name:Host Disk Usage Message:Disk '{dev_name}' space usage ({usage}%) on host {ip_address} has exceeded {threshold}%. Description:Checks that host disk usage is not above the recommended threshold%. Description:Checks that host disk usage is not above the recommended threshold%. Causes:Too much data is stored on the host disk. Resolution:Delete unneeded data from the host disk. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/2490

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to evacuate some VMs from host [\S]* while [\S]*."].iregexp("Failed to evacuate some VMs from host [\S]* while [\S]*.")}=1
trigger.name: Host Evacuation Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator GuestVM Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:CVM-Hardware Scope:kCluster Title:HA Host Evacuation Failure Name:Host Evacuation Status Message:Failed to evacuate some VMs from host {hypervisor_address} while {reason}. Description:Failure to evacuate host while entering maintenance mode or reserving host for HA. Description:Failure to evacuate host while entering maintenance mode or reserving host for HA. Causes:Not enough memory/CPU resources within the cluster. Resolution:Shut down unneeded VMs to free cluster resources or expand the cluster to add resources. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Hypervisor [\S]* is not reachable from Controller VM [\S]* in t"].iregexp("Hypervisor [\S]* is not reachable from Controller VM [\S]* in t")}=1
trigger.name: Host IP Pingable
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability Cluster Network Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Network Scope:kNode Title:Host IP Not Reachable Name:Host IP Pingable Message:Hypervisor {target_ip} is not reachable from Controller VM {source_ip} in the last 6 attempts. Description:Checks if the local CVM can ping all host IP addresses. Description:Checks if the local CVM can ping all host IP addresses. Causes:The hypervisor host is down or there is a network connectivity issue. Resolution:Ensure that the hypervisor host is running and that physical networking, VLANs, and virtual switches are configured correctly. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/2484

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["CVM [\S]* is not able to passwordless SSH to its local hypervisor"].iregexp("CVM [\S]* is not able to passwordless SSH to its local hypervisor")}=1
trigger.name: Host passwordless SSH
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Node-Services Scope:kNode Title:CVM passwordless SSH to host Name:Host passwordless SSH Message:CVM {svm_ip} is not able to passwordless SSH to its local hypervisor Description:Check passwordless SSH into local hypervisor Description:Check passwordless SSH into local hypervisor Causes:SSH disabled on hypervisor Resolution:Enable SSH on hypervisor. Please refer to KB 1501 for more information. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1501

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Host time not synchronized with any external servers."].iregexp("Host time not synchronized with any external servers.")}=1
trigger.name: Host time synchronized
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration ControllerVM Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:host-Network Scope:kNode Title:Host time not synchronized with any external servers. Name:Host time synchronized Message:{alert_msg} Description:Checks to ensure that the host is configured and synchronizing time with an NTP server. Description:Checks to ensure that the host is configured and synchronizing time with an NTP server. Causes:External NTP servers are not configured or are not reachable. Resolution:Please verify that the NTP servers are configured and are reachable from the host. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/4519

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Hypervisor IP address on Controller VM [\S]* was updated from {z"].iregexp("Hypervisor IP address on Controller VM [\S]* was updated from {z")}=1
trigger.name: Hypervisor IP Address Configuration
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Cluster Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Host-Network Scope:kNode Title:Zeus Config Mismatch Name:Hypervisor IP Address Configuration Message:Hypervisor IP address on Controller VM {svm_ip_address} was updated from {zeus_ip_address} to {invalid_ip_address} without following the Nutanix IP Reconfiguration procedure. Description:Checks if the hypervisor IP address is in sync with zeus configuration. Description:Checks if the hypervisor IP address is in sync with zeus configuration. Causes:The IP address configured in the cluster does not match the actual setting of the hypervisor. Resolution:Follow the IP address change procedure in the Nutanix documentation. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/2465

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["IDF data on this cluster is not in sync with the IDF data on cluster:{clust"].iregexp("IDF data on this cluster is not in sync with the IDF data on cluster:{clust")}=1
trigger.name: IDF DB to DB sync heartbeat check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:IDF Source to Remote Sync Status Name:IDF DB to DB sync heartbeat check Message:IDF data on this cluster is not in sync with the IDF data on cluster:{cluster_name} Description:Checks if IDF replica is receiving requests from IDF master. Description:Checks if IDF replica is receiving requests from IDF master. Causes:Cluster network connectivity or cluster services such as insights server, insights uploader, insights receiver, Aplos, or Prism gateway could be down. Resolution:Ensure that cluster network connectivity is up and all cluster services are up. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/5582

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Domain controller [\S]* on domain [\S]* is not reachable a"].iregexp("Domain controller [\S]* on domain [\S]* is not reachable a")}=1
trigger.name: ID Firewall is unable to connect to one or more domain controllers
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability Cluster Network Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:CVM-Network Scope:kCluster Title:ID Firewall lost connectivity to domain controller Name:ID Firewall is unable to connect to one or more domain controllers Message:Domain controller {domain_controller} on domain {domain} is not reachable and accepting LDAP or WMI connections. Details: {details}. Description:ID Firewall is unable to connect to one or more domain controllers used for scraping identities. Description:ID Firewall is unable to connect to one or more domain controllers used for scraping identities. Causes:The domain controller may not be reachable via the network. The domain controller may not be accepting LDAP/WMI connections due to permissions issues. The domain controller may not be running or fully booted up. Resolution:Check network connectivity from Prism Central to the domain controller. Please refer article KB-10219 for more details. Check that the domain controller is fully up and accepting WMI and LDAP connections. Please refer article KB-10219 for more details. Check that the service account registered for ID Firewall is active and has permissions for both WMI and LDAP access, and that the correct password is entered in Prism Central. Please refer article KB-10219 for more details. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/10219

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["ID Firewall was unable to recover state from domain controller {domain_cont"].iregexp("ID Firewall was unable to recover state from domain controller {domain_cont")}=1
trigger.name: ID Firewall state recovery failed
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability Cluster Network Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:CVM-Network Scope:kCluster Title:ID Firewall did not recover state after reconnecting to a temporarily unreachable domain controller Name:ID Firewall state recovery failed Message:ID Firewall was unable to recover state from domain controller {domain_controller} on domain {domain}. Details: {details}. Description:ID Firewall was unable to recover state after reconnecting to a temporarily unreachable domain controller. Description:ID Firewall was unable to recover state after reconnecting to a temporarily unreachable domain controller. Causes:Recovery failed because either too much time has passed since the domain controller was last reachable, or the event log on the domain controller has rolled over and the events necessary to recover are no longer present. Resolution:In order to ensure security policies are properly enforced, all active Nutanix VDI VM users should log out and log back into their VMs. Please refer KB-10220 for further details. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/10220

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["IGMP Snooping was found to be configured on bridge [\S]*, when it w"].iregexp("IGMP Snooping was found to be configured on bridge [\S]*, when it w")}=1
trigger.name: IGMP Snooping needs to be re-configured on newly migrated virtual switch
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Network Scope:kCluster Title:IGMP Snooping needs to be re-configured on newly migrated virtual switch. Name:IGMP Snooping needs to be re-configured on newly migrated virtual switch Message:IGMP Snooping was found to be configured on bridge {bridge_name}, when it was migrated to virtual switch {vs_name} with UUID {vs_uuid}. This configuration won't be carried over to the virtual switch {vs_name}, please re-configure it. Description:Notifies when IGMP Snooping has been configured on an OVS bridge that's migrated to a virtual switch Description:Notifies when IGMP Snooping has been configured on an OVS bridge that's migrated to a virtual switch Causes:IGMP Snooping was previously enabled on the bridge before its migration to a virtual switch. Resolution:Please re-configure IGMP Snooping on the bridge using the migrated virtual switch. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Incompatible File server [\S]* is activated"].iregexp("Incompatible File server [\S]* is activated")}=1
trigger.name: Incompatible File Server Activation
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:Incompatible File Server activated Name:Incompatible File Server Activation Message:Incompatible File server {file_server_name} is activated Description:Activating an incompatible File Server Description:Activating an incompatible File Server Causes:File server is activated which is incompatible with current AOS version Resolution:Upgrade file server to the latest. Please refer Software Product Interoperability page on portal for reference. Contact Nutanix support if issue still persists or assistance needed. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["SPAN session [\S]* is in an inconsistent state for the [\S]*"].iregexp("SPAN session [\S]* is in an inconsistent state for the [\S]*")}=1
trigger.name: Inconsistent SPAN session state was detected
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Network Scope:kCluster Title:Inconsistent SPAN Session State Detected Name:Inconsistent SPAN session state was detected Message:SPAN session {session_name} is in an inconsistent state for the {host_info}. Reason: {message} Description:SPAN session state is inconsistent on one of the nodes in the cluster. Description:SPAN session state is inconsistent on one of the nodes in the cluster. Causes:A SPAN session is in an inconsistent state on one of the nodes in the cluster. Resolution:Ensure that the source ports and/or destination ports for the SPAN session are connected and in active state. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/10440

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Virtual switch [\S]* is in an inconsistent state for the [\S]*. R"].iregexp("Virtual switch [\S]* is in an inconsistent state for the [\S]*. R")}=1
trigger.name: Inconsistent virtual switch state was detected
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Network Scope:kCluster Title:Inconsistent Virtual Switch State Detected Name:Inconsistent virtual switch state was detected Message:Virtual switch {vs_name} is in an inconsistent state for the {host_info}. Reason: {error_message} Description:Virtual switch state is inconsistent across nodes in the cluster. Description:Virtual switch state is inconsistent across nodes in the cluster. Causes:A virtual switch is not present on at least one node in the cluster. Resolution:(A) Review virtual switch configuration and ensure every host (storage-only hosts are optional) in the cluster is included. (B) Ensure all the hosts and their physical NICs used in the virtual switch configuration are present. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Inode usage for one or more disks on Controller VM [\S]* has exc"].iregexp("Inode usage for one or more disks on Controller VM [\S]* has exc")}=1
trigger.name: Inode Usage
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Storage Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Disk Scope:kNode Title:Disk Inode Usage High Name:Inode Usage Message:Inode usage for one or more disks on Controller VM {svm_ip_address} has exceeded {inode_usage_threshold}%. Description:Checks if current inode usage is high. Description:Checks if current inode usage is high. Causes:Inode usage is high. Resolution:Reduce disk usage or replace disk. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1532

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Intel SSD S3610 on host [\S]* has configuration problems: {alert_msg"].iregexp("Intel SSD S3610 on host [\S]* has configuration problems: {alert_msg")}=1
trigger.name: Intel SSD Configuration
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Node-Disk Scope:kNode Title:Intel SSD S3610 on {ip_address} has configuration problems. Name:Intel SSD Configuration Message:Intel SSD S3610 on host {ip_address} has configuration problems: {alert_msg}. Description:Check if node has supported configuration for Intel SSD S3610. Description:Check if node has supported configuration for Intel SSD S3610. Causes:Intel SSD S3610 is installed on an NX-1020 or NX-9040 node. Intel SSD S3610 is installed on a cluster whose AOS version is before 4.1.1.4. Intel SSD S3610 is not properly down-formatted. Resolution:Remove Intel SSD S3610 from the NX-1020 or NX-9040 nodes. Upgrade AOS to at least version 4.1.1.4. Contact Nutanix support to replace with a new drive. Refer to the Nutanix documentation for instructions. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/2309

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Latency between [\S]*s is higher than [\S]* ms."].iregexp("Latency between [\S]*s is higher than [\S]* ms.")}=1
trigger.name: Inter-CVM Latency
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability Node Network Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Node-Network Scope:kNode Title:Latency between CVMs is high Name:Inter-CVM Latency Message:Latency between {vm_type}s is higher than {ping_threshold} ms. Description:Checks whether latency among CVMs is high. Description:Checks whether latency among CVMs is high. Causes:Malfunctioning or misconfigured network infrastructure Resolution:Check network connectivity/configuration. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/3690

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Detected iSCSI [\S]* through cluster external IP address"].iregexp("Detected iSCSI [\S]* through cluster external IP address")}=1
trigger.name: Invalid iSCSI portal
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:CVM-Network Scope:kCluster Title:Detected iSCSI discovery or login through cluster external IP address Name:Invalid iSCSI portal Message:Detected iSCSI {access_type} through cluster external IP address Description:Detected iSCSI discovery or login through cluster external IP address Description:Detected iSCSI discovery or login through cluster external IP address Causes:The iSCSI discovery or login portal is incorrectly configured Resolution:Use the cluster external data services IP address for iSCSI discovery Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Detected IP address conflict for cluster virtual IP address [\S]*."].iregexp("Detected IP address conflict for cluster virtual IP address [\S]*.")}=1
trigger.name: IP Configuration
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:CVM-Network Scope:kCluster Title:Duplicate IP Address Detected Name:IP Configuration Message:Detected IP address conflict for cluster virtual IP address {duplicate_ip}. IP found on NIC with MAC address {mac_address}. Description:Duplicate IP address is detected. Description:Duplicate IP address is detected. Causes:The cluster virtual IP address may be configured on another host. Resolution:Either configure a different cluster virtual IP address or unconfigure the IP address from the other host. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["IPFIX exporter [\S]* cannot be enabled on cluster with UUID {clus"].iregexp("IPFIX exporter [\S]* cannot be enabled on cluster with UUID {clus")}=1
trigger.name: IPFIX exporter cannot be enabled on the cluster
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Network Scope:kCluster Title:IPFIX exporter cannot be enabled on the cluster Name:IPFIX exporter cannot be enabled on the cluster Message:IPFIX exporter {exporter_name} cannot be enabled on cluster with UUID {cluster_uuid}. Reason: {cause} Description:Cannot enable IPFIX exporter on the cluster Description:Cannot enable IPFIX exporter on the cluster Causes:IPFIX exporter could not be enabled on the cluster. Resolution:Check the software version(s) of Prism Element and AHV and upgrade them to the minimum required version(s). Make sure the connection between Prism Central and Prism Element is healthy. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["IPFIX exporter update failed on host [\S]* because of error:"].iregexp("IPFIX exporter update failed on host [\S]* because of error:")}=1
trigger.name: IPFIX exporter host update failed
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Network Node Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Host-Network Scope:kCluster Title:IPFIX exporter host update failed Name:IPFIX exporter host update failed Message:IPFIX exporter update failed on host {hypervisor_address} because of error: {cause} Description:IPFIX exporter update failed on the host in the cluster. Description:IPFIX exporter update failed on the host in the cluster. Causes:IPFIX exporter update failed on the host in the cluster. Resolution:Check the error message and follow the appropriate steps to fix the IPFIX exporter state on the host. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["IPMI IP address on Controller VM [\S]* was updated from {zeus_ip"].iregexp("IPMI IP address on Controller VM [\S]* was updated from {zeus_ip")}=1
trigger.name: IPMI IP Address Configuration
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Cluster Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Host-Network Scope:kNode Title:IPMI IP Address Mismatch Name:IPMI IP Address Configuration Message:IPMI IP address on Controller VM {svm_ip_address} was updated from {zeus_ip_address} to {invalid_ip_address} without following the Nutanix IP Reconfiguration procedure. Description:Checks if the IPMI IP address is in sync with Zeus configuration. Description:Checks if the IPMI IP address is in sync with Zeus configuration. Causes:The IP address configured in the cluster does not match the actual setting of the IPMI interface. Resolution:Follow the IP address change procedure in the Nutanix documentation. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/2465

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Controller VM [\S]* is unable to fetch IPMI SDR repository."].iregexp("Controller VM [\S]* is unable to fetch IPMI SDR repository.")}=1
trigger.name: IPMI SDR Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Hardware Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Host-Hardware Scope:kNode Title:IPMI Error Name:IPMI SDR Status Message:Controller VM {ip_address} is unable to fetch IPMI SDR repository. Description:Checks whether IPMI SDR has failures. Description:Checks whether IPMI SDR has failures. Causes:If the Hypervisor is ESXi or AHV, there is a possibility of process memory being exhausted on the host due to serviceability scripts running on the CVM. The cluster did not correctly fail back after a Controller VM was temporarily down. The IPMI interface is down. There is a network connectivity issue. Resolution:Connect to the Hypervisor host of the CVM mentioned in the alert. Contact Nutanix Support. Ensure that the hypervisor password configured in the cluster matches the actual hypervisor password. Ensure that the IPMI interface is functioning. Ensure that physical networking, VLANs, and virtual switches are configured correctly. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1524

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Kerberos authentication failure occurred on the Controller VM [\S]* "].iregexp("Kerberos authentication failure occurred on the Controller VM [\S]* ")}=1
trigger.name: Kerberos Clock Skew Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator ControllerVM Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Services Scope:kNode Title:Kerberos Clock Skew Failure Name:Kerberos Clock Skew Status Message:Kerberos authentication failure occurred on the Controller VM {ip_address} due to clock skew between the Controller VM and the Domain Controller (reason: {reason}). Description:Kerberos clock skew failure. Description:Kerberos clock skew failure. Causes:There is considerable clock skew between the Controller VM and the Domain Controller. Resolution:Ensure that the time on the Controller VM is synchronized with the time of the host. It can be accomplished by configuring the NTP server properly. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8036

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Kernel mitigation configuration doesn't match current state."].iregexp("Kernel mitigation configuration doesn't match current state.")}=1
trigger.name: Kernel mitigations check
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Node Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Node-Node Scope:kNode Title:Kernel mitigation configuration doesn't match current state. Name:Kernel mitigations check Message:{alert_msg} Description:Check if spectre/meltdown mitigation is synced up with mitigations value in /proc/cmdline. Description:Check if spectre/meltdown mitigation is synced up with mitigations value in /proc/cmdline. Causes:Spectre/meltdown configuration doesn't match current state. Resolution:Reboot CVM. Please refer to KB 10938 for more information. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/10938

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Cannot connect to key management server [\S]* from C"].iregexp("Cannot connect to key management server [\S]* from C")}=1
trigger.name: Key Management Server Availability
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Network Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Host-Disk Scope:kNode Title:Key Management Server Unavailable Name:Key Management Server Availability Message:Cannot connect to key management server {key_management_server_name} from Controller VM {service_vm_external_ip}. Description:Check Key Management Server is available. Description:Check Key Management Server is available. Causes:The node cannot connect to a key management server either because of hardware failures, certificate validation failure, or network issues. Resolution:Ensure the key management server and nodes in a cluster have network connectivity to each other and all certificates are valid. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/3656

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Network latency to the remote Availability Zone '{availability_zone_physica"].iregexp("Network latency to the remote Availability Zone '{availability_zone_physica")}=1
trigger.name: Latency to Remote Availability Zone is High
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Availability Zone Scope:kCluster Title:Remote Availability Zone Latency is High Name:Latency to Remote Availability Zone is High Message:Network latency to the remote Availability Zone '{availability_zone_physical_name}' exceeds the threshold limit. Description:Network latency to the remote Availability Zone is high. Description:Network latency to the remote Availability Zone is high. Causes:Network latency to the remote Availability Zone exceeds the threshold limit. Resolution:Check if the remote Availability Zone is reachable over the network. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Latest snapshot of protection domain [\S]* is missing entities {missing"].iregexp("Latest snapshot of protection domain [\S]* is missing entities {missing")}=1
trigger.name: Latest snapshot missing entities check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Cluster-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Latest snapshot of protection domain is missing entities Name:Latest snapshot missing entities check Message:Latest snapshot of protection domain {pd_name} is missing entities {missing_entities} Description:Check that all the VMs/VGs/Files in the protection domain at the time of snapshot creation are protected by the snapshot. Description:Check that all the VMs/VGs/Files in the protection domain at the time of snapshot creation are protected by the snapshot. Causes:Snapshot doesn't include all the VMs/VGs/Files protected by that protection domain at the time of snapshot creation. Resolution:If missing entities do not exist on the cluster, remove them from the protection domain else if entities are valid, create a out of band snapshot of the protection domain. If the issue still persists, contact Nutanix Support Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/6258

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Local key manager master key rotation warning. Last failure reason: {failur"].iregexp("Local key manager master key rotation warning. Last failure reason: {failur")}=1
trigger.name: Local key manager master key rotation warning.
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Local key manager master key rotation warning. Name:Local key manager master key rotation warning. Message:Local key manager master key rotation warning. Last failure reason: {failure_message} Description:Unable to rotate local key manager's master key. Description:Unable to rotate local key manager's master key. Causes:One or more nodes in the cluster are unavailable. Resolution:Ensure Mantle service is UP on all nodes. If the warning persists, contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to allocate snapshot reserve on the remote site '[\S]*' in {"].iregexp("Failed to allocate snapshot reserve on the remote site '[\S]*' in {")}=1
trigger.name: LWS store allocation in remote too long
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability DR Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Remote Site Scope:kCluster Title:Failed to allocate snapshot reserve on the remote site Name:LWS store allocation in remote too long Message:Failed to allocate snapshot reserve on the remote site '{remote_name}' in {duration_mins} minutes. Description:Failed to allocate snapshot reserve on the remote site. Description:Failed to allocate snapshot reserve on the remote site. Causes:Snapshot reserve allocation on the remote site timed out. Resolution:Contact Nutanix support Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["File server VM [\S]* on file server [\S]* has reached {c"].iregexp("File server VM [\S]* on file server [\S]* has reached {c")}=1
trigger.name: Maximum connections limit reached on a file server VM
trigger.description: Category Type: Performance NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Maximum connections limit about to reach on a file server VM Name:Maximum connections limit reached on a file server VM Message:File server VM {fsvm_name} on file server {file_server_name} has reached {conn_percentage}connections limit. Description:Maximum connections limit is about to reach on a file server VM Description:Maximum connections limit is about to reach on a file server VM Causes:File server has one or more nodes under extensive load. Resolution:Run 'Performance optimization' for the specified file server. Refer to KB article 7371 for more details. Contact Nutanix support if issue still persists or assistance needed. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/7371 http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/7371

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Metadata disk(s) on Controller VM [\S]* are not mounted: {unmoun"].iregexp("Metadata disk(s) on Controller VM [\S]* are not mounted: {unmoun")}=1
trigger.name: Metadata Disk Mounted Check
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability Node Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Disk Scope:kNode Title:Metadata disk(s) not mounted on CVM Name:Metadata Disk Mounted Check Message:Metadata disk(s) on Controller VM {svm_ip_address} are not mounted: {unmounted_disks} Description:Check that all metadata disks are mounted. Description:Check that all metadata disks are mounted. Causes:Metadata disk(s) not mounted on CVM. Resolution:Contact Nutanix Support to mount the metadata disk. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/4494

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["[\S]* for node [\S]* is progressing slowly. Total elapsed time"].iregexp("[\S]* for node [\S]* is progressing slowly. Total elapsed time")}=1
trigger.name: Metadata DynRingChangeOp Slow Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Services Scope:kNode Title:Metadata Dynamic Ring Change Operation Too Slow Name:Metadata DynRingChangeOp Slow Check Message:{operation} for node {ip_address} is progressing slowly. Total elapsed time: {elapsed_time_mins} min(s). Node performing the operation: {ip_address_doing_ring_change}. Description:Dynamic Ring Change operation too slow. Description:Dynamic Ring Change operation too slow. Causes:A node in the cluster is unhealthy, or the cluster contains an extraordinarily large amount of data. Resolution:Ensure that all nodes in the cluster are healthy. If they are and the alert persists, contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["[\S]* for node [\S]* is not progressing. Node performing the o"].iregexp("[\S]* for node [\S]* is not progressing. Node performing the o")}=1
trigger.name: Metadata DynRingChangeOp Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Services Scope:kNode Title:Metadata Dynamic Ring Change Operation Stuck Name:Metadata DynRingChangeOp Status Message:{operation} for node {ip_address} is not progressing. Node performing the operation: {ip_address_doing_ring_change}. Description:Dynamic Ring Change operation is not making progress. Description:Dynamic Ring Change operation is not making progress. Causes:Node addition or removal is not making progress. A node in the cluster is unhealthy. Resolution:If the alert persists, contact Nutanix Support. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8195

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Metadata ring imbalance for [\S]* partitions. The partitions are"].iregexp("Metadata ring imbalance for [\S]* partitions. The partitions are")}=1
trigger.name: Metadata Imbalance Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:CVM-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Metadata Ring Imbalance Name:Metadata Imbalance Check Message:Metadata ring imbalance for {num_partitions} partitions. The partitions are {partition_list}. Description:Cassandra metadata imbalance. Description:Cassandra metadata imbalance. Causes:One or more nodes have a disproportionately larger token range size. This imbalance may cause performance bottlenecks on the node(s) affected. Resolution:Execute cassandra ring skew fix operation using the NCLI command 'cluster cassandra-token-range-skew-fixer-start'. UVMs' performance might be affected for a small amount of time. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Node [\S]* contains a large amount of metadata."].iregexp("Node [\S]* contains a large amount of metadata.")}=1
trigger.name: Metadata Size
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Services Scope:kNode Title:Large Metadata Size Detected Name:Metadata Size Message:Node {ip_address} contains a large amount of metadata. Description:Large metadata size detected. Description:Large metadata size detected. Causes:A node in the cluster contains a large amount of metadata and has exceeded thresholds. Resolution:Ensure that all nodes in the cluster are healthy. If they are and the alert persists, contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Metadata usage on Controller VM [\S]* has exceeded {crit"].iregexp("Metadata usage on Controller VM [\S]* has exceeded {crit")}=1
trigger.name: Metadata Usage
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Storage Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Storage Capacity Scope:kNode Title:Metadata Usage High Name:Metadata Usage Message:Metadata usage on Controller VM {service_vm_external_ip} has exceeded {critical_pct}%. Description:Metadata Usage High. Description:Metadata Usage High. Causes:The cluster either has too many snapshots or too much data is being fingerprinted. Resolution:Reduce metadata size by removing unneeded snapshots, creating snapshots less frequently, creating snapshots of fewer VMs, or expanding the cluster size. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["The last [\S]* metadata volume snapshots have failed. [\S]*"].iregexp("The last [\S]* metadata volume snapshots have failed. [\S]*")}=1
trigger.name: Metadata Volume Snapshot Persistent
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator ControllerVM DR Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Metadata Volume Snapshot Persistent Failure Name:Metadata Volume Snapshot Persistent Message:The last {failure_count} metadata volume snapshots have failed. {reason} Description:Metadata Volume Snapshot persistent failure. Description:Metadata Volume Snapshot persistent failure. Causes:The EBS snapshot service is unavailable, possibly because AWS could not be reached. Resolution:Please check connectivity to cloud instance and reach out to Nutanix Support for assistance. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8413

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Metadata volume snapshot could not be created in [\S]* minutes."].iregexp("Metadata volume snapshot could not be created in [\S]* minutes.")}=1
trigger.name: Metadata Volume Snapshot Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR ControllerVM Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Metadata Volume Snapshot Timeout Name:Metadata Volume Snapshot Status Message:Metadata volume snapshot could not be created in {duration_mins} minutes. Description:Metadata Volume Snapshot timeout failure. Description:Metadata Volume Snapshot timeout failure. Causes:Metadata volume snapshot frequency is too high. Resolution:Contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Cannot publish metering stats to server endpoint on a metering enabled clus"].iregexp("Cannot publish metering stats to server endpoint on a metering enabled clus")}=1
trigger.name: Metering endpoint connection status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Metering server endpoint connection unavailable. Name:Metering endpoint connection status Message:Cannot publish metering stats to server endpoint on a metering enabled cluster. Description:Checks if the connection to the metering server endpoint is available and if the metering stats can be successfully sent to server endpoint. Description:Checks if the connection to the metering server endpoint is available and if the metering stats can be successfully sent to server endpoint. Causes:Unable to verify metering enablement state and/or unable to establish a connection to the metering server endpoint. Resolution:Ensure that the metering server endpoint is resolvable and reachable from cluster and that the network connection is stable. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/10651

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["The protection domain [\S]* protects [\S]* files, which exceeds t"].iregexp("The protection domain [\S]* protects [\S]* files, which exceeds t")}=1
trigger.name: Metro/Vstore Protection Domain File Count Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Too many files in the Protection Domain. Name:Metro/Vstore Protection Domain File Count Check Message:The protection domain {pd_name} protects {num_files} files, which exceeds the currently set threshold of {threshold_num_files}. Description:Checks if too many files are being protected by any Metro/Vstore protection domain. Description:Checks if too many files are being protected by any Metro/Vstore protection domain. Causes:Too many files are being protected by a Metro/Vstore protection domain. Resolution:(A) Delete some VMs/files from the protection domain, or move to another Storage Container and protect the new Storage Container. (B) Change alert threshold from the alert policies section. (C) If needed, contact Nutanix Support for assistance. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/3821

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Break replication timeout of metro protection domain is below the recommend"].iregexp("Break replication timeout of metro protection domain is below the recommend")}=1
trigger.name: Metro aggressive break replication timeout check
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability Cluster Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Aggressive break replication timeout. Name:Metro aggressive break replication timeout check Message:Break replication timeout of metro protection domain is below the recommended minimum of 15 seconds. Description:Check if break replication timeout of metro protection domain is more than the recommended limit. Description:Check if break replication timeout of metro protection domain is more than the recommended limit. Causes:Break replication timeout of a metro protection domain is below recommended limit. Metro availability is disabled. Resolution:Set break replication timeout of the affected protection domain to recommended value. Enable metro availability. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/4951

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["For the protection domain '[\S]*', [\S]* failed to"].iregexp("For the protection domain '[\S]*', [\S]* failed to")}=1
trigger.name: Metro Availability Operation Failed
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Data Protection-Remote Site Scope:kCluster Title:Metro Availability Operation Failed Name:Metro Availability Operation Failed Message:For the protection domain '{protection_domain_name}', {operation} failed to the remote site '{remote_name}'. Reason: '{reason}'. Description:Metro availability operation failed Description:Metro availability operation failed Causes:Check the alert message for the reason of failure Resolution:Resolve the issue as stated in the alert message and retry the Metro operation. If the issue persists contact Nutanix Support Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/10111

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Standby Metro Protection domain is no longer in sync with Active Protection"].iregexp("Standby Metro Protection domain is no longer in sync with Active Protection")}=1
trigger.name: Metro Availability Secondary PD sync check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Standby Protection Domains not in sync with primary Name:Metro Availability Secondary PD sync check Message:Standby Metro Protection domain is no longer in sync with Active Protection domain on primary. Description:Check if standby Metro Protection Domain is in sync with Active site Description:Check if standby Metro Protection Domain is in sync with Active site Causes:Link between primary and secondary is not healthy. Resolution:Ensure Metro is configured as per guidelines in the Prism Web Console guide on Nutanix Portal Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/3032

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Metro connectivity from local site '[\S]*' to remote sit"].iregexp("Metro connectivity from local site '[\S]*' to remote sit")}=1
trigger.name: Metro Connectivity Lost
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Metro connectivity lost Name:Metro Connectivity Lost Message:Metro connectivity from local site '{local_stargate_handler}' to remote site '{remote_name}' is lost due to '{reason}' Description:Metro connectivity is lost Description:Metro connectivity is lost Causes:Remote site(s) not reachable Resolution:Check remote site(s) connectivity and re-enable Metro if necessary Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Break replication timeout of metro protection domain is invalid, please ref"].iregexp("Break replication timeout of metro protection domain is invalid, please ref")}=1
trigger.name: Metro invalid break replication timeout check
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability Cluster Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Invalid break replication timeout. Name:Metro invalid break replication timeout check Message:Break replication timeout of metro protection domain is invalid, please refer the KB to resolve this issue. Description:Check if the break replication timeout of metro protection domain is zero or invalid. Description:Check if the break replication timeout of metro protection domain is zero or invalid. Causes:Break replication timeout of the metro protection domain is invalid state. Resolution:Set break replication timeout of the affected protection domain to the recommended value. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/7424

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Warning: [\S]* VMs are running on the standby site '[\S]*' o"].iregexp("Warning: [\S]* VMs are running on the standby site '[\S]*' o")}=1
trigger.name: Metro Protection domain VMs running at Sub-optimal performance
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Data Protection-Remote Site Scope:kCluster Title:VMs in the standby site of a Metro Availability protection domain are running at suboptimal performance. Name:Metro Protection domain VMs running at Sub-optimal performance Message:Warning: {num_of_vms} VMs are running on the standby site '{remote_name}' of protection domain '{protection_domain_name}'. However, all the I/O operations are being forwarded to this site. This can significantly affect the performance of VMs. It is recommended to move VMs to this site or update the DRS rules. The affected VMs list is: {vm_names} Description:VMs in the standby site of a Metro Availability protection domain are running at suboptimal performance. Description:VMs in the standby site of a Metro Availability protection domain are running at suboptimal performance. Causes:VMs are hosted at the standby site of the Metro Availability protection domain. Resolution:Host the VMs at the active site of the Metro Availability protection domain. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Unable to process NFS requests for vstore id [\S]* due to [\S]*."].iregexp("Unable to process NFS requests for vstore id [\S]* due to [\S]*.")}=1
trigger.name: Metro Vstore Mount Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:CVM-Disk Scope:kCluster Title:Stale NFS Mount Name:Metro Vstore Mount Status Message:Unable to process NFS requests for vstore id {vstore_id} due to {reason}. Description:Stale NFS mount. Description:Stale NFS mount. Causes:Stale NFS file handle. Resolution:Unmount the datastore from all hosts and remount again. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Symlinks found on metro/vstore protected container [\S]*, which might "].iregexp("Symlinks found on metro/vstore protected container [\S]*, which might ")}=1
trigger.name: Metro Vstore Symlinks Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Symlinks found on metro/vstore protected container. Name:Metro Vstore Symlinks Check Message:Symlinks found on metro/vstore protected container {ctr_name}, which might lead to cluster instability. Description:Check for symlinks in metro/vstore protection domain. Description:Check for symlinks in metro/vstore protection domain. Causes:Symlinks present in metro/vstore protection domain. Resolution:Remove symlinks from metro/vstore protected container. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/4276

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Nearsync replication for [\S]* to remote [\S]* i"].iregexp("Nearsync replication for [\S]* to remote [\S]* i")}=1
trigger.name: Nearsync Replication is Lagging
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Nearsync Replication is lagging for Protection Domain snapshot Name:Nearsync Replication is Lagging Message:Nearsync replication for {protection_domain_name} to remote {remote_name} is lagging by {replication_lagging_seconds} seconds. Description:Replication of the nearsync protection domain snapshot is lagging. Description:Replication of the nearsync protection domain snapshot is lagging. Causes:Replication of the protection domain nearsync snapshot is slow. Resolution:Ensure that the number of entities are within the supported limit. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["NearSync replication of the protection domain [\S]* to t"].iregexp("NearSync replication of the protection domain [\S]* to t")}=1
trigger.name: Nearsync Replication Stuck
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Availability DR Cluster Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Data Protection-Remote Site Scope:kCluster Title:NearSync Replication of Protection Domain has not progressed. Name:Nearsync Replication Stuck Message:NearSync replication of the protection domain {protection_domain_name} to the remote site {remote_name} for the snapshot {snapshot_id} has not made any progress in the last {time_string}. Description:Nearsync replication of the protection domain has not progressed. Description:Nearsync replication of the protection domain has not progressed. Causes:Network outage, saturated network or unavailability of services like Stargate, Cerebro on the remote site. Snapshots of the protection domain will not be available on the remote site. SSD snapshot reserve on the remote site does not have enough free disk space. Resolution:Check the network connection and status of the remote site. Ensure that the remote site has enough disk space available in the SSD snapshot reserve. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["NFS metadata usage is too high. Calculated metadata usage of {metadata_usag"].iregexp("NFS metadata usage is too high. Calculated metadata usage of {metadata_usag")}=1
trigger.name: NFS Metadata Size Overshoot
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Storage Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Storage Capacity Scope:kNode Title:NFS metadata usage high Name:NFS Metadata Size Overshoot Message:NFS metadata usage is too high. Calculated metadata usage of {metadata_usage} bytes exceeds safety limit of {metadata_limit} bytes on Controller VM {service_vm_id}. Description:NFS Metadata Usage High Description:NFS Metadata Usage High Causes:Either a NFS datastore is used as a file store which is not supported, or too many files are present in the datastore. Resolution:If a NFS datastore is used as a file store, remove the corresponding files and wait for up to 24 hours to allow for compaction. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/6012

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["VSS is enabled but Nutanix Guest Tools are not installed on the VM(s) {vm_n"].iregexp("VSS is enabled but Nutanix Guest Tools are not installed on the VM(s) {vm_n")}=1
trigger.name: NGT Configuration
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Nutanix Guest Tools Not Installed Name:NGT Configuration Message:VSS is enabled but Nutanix Guest Tools are not installed on the VM(s) {vm_names} protected by {protection_domain_name}.
