Description:Nutanix Guest Tools is not Installed. Description:Nutanix Guest Tools is not Installed. Causes:VSS is enabled but Nutanix Guest Tools are not installed on the VM(s). Resolution:Install Nutanix Guest Tools on the VM(s). Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Communication link to Nutanix Guest Tools on the VM [\S]* is not workin"].iregexp("Communication link to Nutanix Guest Tools on the VM [\S]* is not workin")}=1
trigger.name: NGT is unreachable
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:vm Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Virtual Machine Scope:kCluster Title:NGT on VM is not reachable Name:NGT is unreachable Message:Communication link to Nutanix Guest Tools on the VM {vm_name} is not working. Description:NGT on the VM is not reachable. Description:NGT on the VM is not reachable. Causes:Communication link to Nutanix Guest Tools on the VM is not working. Resolution:Restart the Nutanix Guest Tools service in the VM. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Nutanix Guest Tools are not upgraded to version [\S]* or higher on the "].iregexp("Nutanix Guest Tools are not upgraded to version [\S]* or higher on the ")}=1
trigger.name: NGT needs upgrade
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Nutanix Guest Tools not Upgraded Name:NGT needs upgrade Message:Nutanix Guest Tools are not upgraded to version {version} or higher on the guest VM(s) {vm_names} protected by {protection_domain_name}. Description:Nutanix Guest Tools not upgraded. Description:Nutanix Guest Tools not upgraded. Causes:VSS is enabled, but Nutanix Guest Tools are not upgraded on the VM(s). Resolution:Install the latest version of Nutanix Guest Tools available on the cluster on the guest VM(s). Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["NIC [\S]* in host [\S]* has encountered many [\S]*."].iregexp("NIC [\S]* in host [\S]* has encountered many [\S]*.")}=1
trigger.name: NIC CRC Error Rate Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Hardware Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Host-Network Scope:kNode Title:NIC RX_CRC Error Rate High Name:NIC CRC Error Rate Check Message:NIC {nic_name} in host {host_ip} has encountered many {error_type}. Description:Checks whether the NICs on hypervisor are experiencing rx_crc errors. Description:Checks whether the NICs on hypervisor are experiencing rx_crc errors. Causes:NIC or its peripherals may be failing. Resolution:Replace the NIC, cable, SFP+ adapter, or switch port. Refer to the Nutanix documentation for instructions. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1381

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["NIC [\S]* on host [\S]* has flapped [\S]* times in one "].iregexp("NIC [\S]* on host [\S]* has flapped [\S]* times in one ")}=1
trigger.name: NIC Flapping Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Hardware Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Host-Network Scope:kNode Title:NIC Flaps detected on the host. Name:NIC Flapping Check Message:NIC {nic_name} on host {host_ip} has flapped {nic_flap_count} times in one hour. Description:Check that all NICs have no flapping. Description:Check that all NICs have no flapping. Causes:A physical networking component is failing. Resolution:Check all physical networking components (including switch, cables and NIC) and replace the failed component. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/2479

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Link on NIC [\S]* of host [\S]* is down. NIC description: {nic_des"].iregexp("Link on NIC [\S]* of host [\S]* is down. NIC description: {nic_des")}=1
trigger.name: NIC Link Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Network Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Host-Network Scope:kNode Title:NIC Link Down Name:NIC Link Status Message:Link on NIC {nic_name} of host {host_ip} is down. NIC description: {nic_description}. Description:Checks whether any NIC is down. Description:Checks whether any NIC is down. Causes:NIC Link is physically disconnected from the upstream Switch. Upstream TOR switch port connected to the CVM has been disabled Resolution:Ensure that the cable between the node and the switch is plugged in properly on both ends. Ensure that the TOR switch port connected to the CVM is enabled and in forwarding state. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/2480

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to ping other CVMs with MTU set to [\S]* on Controller VM {service_v"].iregexp("Failed to ping other CVMs with MTU set to [\S]* on Controller VM {service_v")}=1
trigger.name: NIC MTU Ping Check
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration ControllerVM Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Network Scope:kNode Title:MTU configuration across Controller VMs is not consistent. Name:NIC MTU Ping Check Message:Failed to ping other CVMs with MTU set to {mtu} on Controller VM {service_vm_external_ip}. Description:Check connectivity between Controller VMs by pinging with configured MTUs. Description:Check connectivity between Controller VMs by pinging with configured MTUs. Causes:MTU is not consistent across Controller VMs and host external interfaces, or upstream network. Resolution:Set MTU consistently across Controller VM and host external interfaces. Ensure upstream physical network MTU supports the configuration. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/2486

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Automatic addition of node to metadata ring has been disabled on CVM {servi"].iregexp("Automatic addition of node to metadata ring has been disabled on CVM {servi")}=1
trigger.name: Node Auto Add Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Services Scope:kNode Title:Automatic Addition Of Node To Metadata Ring Disabled Name:Node Auto Add Check Message:Automatic addition of node to metadata ring has been disabled on CVM {service_vm_id} with IP address {ip_address}. Description:Automatic addition of the node to the metadata ring is disabled. Description:Automatic addition of the node to the metadata ring is disabled. Causes:This node has been removed from the metadata store after being automatically added recently. Automatic addition of this node to the metadata store has now been disabled. Resolution:Automatic addition will be re-enabled when the node is manually added to the metadata store. If the node was down for an extended period of time and is now running, add it back to the metadata store by going to host details. Otherwise, contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Average CPU load on Controller VM [\S]* is critically high (above cr"].iregexp("Average CPU load on Controller VM [\S]* is critically high (above cr")}=1
trigger.name: Node Avg Load - Critical
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator ControllerVM Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-CPU Scope:kNode Title:CPU Average Load Critically High on Controller VM. Name:Node Avg Load - Critical Message:Average CPU load on Controller VM {ip_address} is critically high (above critical average load threshold value {critical_high_value}) Description:Checks whether the system load average is critically high. Description:Checks whether the system load average is critically high. Causes:Critically high load on the system. Resolution:Contact Nutanix Support for assistance. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/3469

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["CPU Average Load critically high on CVM."].iregexp("CPU Average Load critically high on CVM.")}=1
trigger.name: Node Avg Load - Very High
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator ControllerVM Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-CPU Scope:kNode Title:CPU Average Load critically high on CVM. Name:Node Avg Load - Very High Message:{alert_msg} Description:Checks whether the system load average is critically high. Description:Checks whether the system load average is critically high. Causes:Critically high load on the system for quite a long time Resolution:Reboot the CVM experiencing high load average. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/3469

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Possible degraded node [\S]* with Controller VM ID [\S]* r"].iregexp("Possible degraded node [\S]* with Controller VM ID [\S]* r")}=1
trigger.name: Node Degradation Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:CVM-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Possible degraded Node Name:Node Degradation Status Message:Possible degraded node {ip_address} with Controller VM ID {service_vm_id} reported by component {component_name}. Description:Services on one of the nodes in the cluster are in a degraded state and possibly not making progress. Description:Services on one of the nodes in the cluster are in a degraded state and possibly not making progress. Causes:Various Resolution:Contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/3827

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Node [\S]* is now detached from metadata ring due to [\S]*."].iregexp("Node [\S]* is now detached from metadata ring due to [\S]*.")}=1
trigger.name: Node Detached From Ring Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:CVM-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Node Detached From Metadata Ring Name:Node Detached From Ring Check Message:Node {ip_address} is now detached from metadata ring due to {reason}. Description:The metadata drive is detached from the ring. Description:The metadata drive is detached from the ring. Causes:Either a metadata drive has failed, the node was down for an extended period of time, or an unexpected subsystem fault was encountered, so the node was removed from the metadata store. Resolution:(A) If the metadata drive has failed, replace the metadata drive as soon as possible. Refer to the Nutanix documentation for instructions. (B) If the node was down for an extended period of time and is now running, add it back to the metadata store by going to host details. For assistance, contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Metadata service on node [\S]* is running in forwarding mode due to "].iregexp("Metadata service on node [\S]* is running in forwarding mode due to ")}=1
trigger.name: Node In Forwarding Mode Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Services Scope:kNode Title:Node Forwarding Metadata Requests Name:Node In Forwarding Mode Check Message:Metadata service on node {ip_address} is running in forwarding mode due to {reason}. Description:Node Forwarding Metadata Requests Description:Node Forwarding Metadata Requests Causes:Either a metadata drive has failed, node removal has been initiated, or an unexpected subsystem fault has been encountered. Resolution:Cluster performance may be significantly degraded. In the case of multiple nodes with the same condition, the cluster may become unable to service I/O requests. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8266

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Node [\S]* is marked to be detached from metadata ring due to {reaso"].iregexp("Node [\S]* is marked to be detached from metadata ring due to {reaso")}=1
trigger.name: Node Marked To Be Detached Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Services Scope:kNode Title:Node Marked To Be Detached From Metadata Ring Name:Node Marked To Be Detached Check Message:Node {ip_address} is marked to be detached from metadata ring due to {reason}. Description:The node is marked to be detached from the metadata ring. Description:The node is marked to be detached from the metadata ring. Causes:Either a metadata drive has failed, the node was down for an extended period of time, or an unexpected subsystem fault was encountered, so the node is marked to be removed from the metadata store. Resolution:(A) If the metadata drive has failed, replace the metadata drive as soon as possible. Refer to the Nutanix documentation for instructions. (B) If the node was down for an extended period of time and is now running, add it back to the metadata store by going to host details. For assistance, contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8408

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to evacuate VMs off of node [\S]*: [\S]*"].iregexp("Failed to evacuate VMs off of node [\S]*: [\S]*")}=1
trigger.name: Node Removal Failure
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability Hardware GuestVM Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Host-Hardware Scope:kCluster Title:Node Maintenance Mode Failure Name:Node Removal Failure Message:Failed to evacuate VMs off of node {node_uuid}: {error} Description:VMs failed to evacuate off of the node. Description:VMs failed to evacuate off of the node. Causes:Other nodes in this cluster may not have enough resources available for VMs to migrate. Resolution:Free the resources by switching off some VMs. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8471

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Cannot proceed with the node removal due to: [\S]*"].iregexp("Cannot proceed with the node removal due to: [\S]*")}=1
trigger.name: Node Removal Stuck
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability GuestVM Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Host-Hardware Scope:kNode Title:Node Removal is Stuck Name:Node Removal Stuck Message:Cannot proceed with the node removal due to: {error} Description:Cannot proceed with the node removal as the node is not in maintenance mode. Description:Cannot proceed with the node removal as the node is not in maintenance mode. Causes:Insufficient cluster resources are available for the VMs to migrate off the host that is marked for removal. Exit Maintenance Mode action triggered manually on the node that is marked for removal, and hence the node removal task cannot proceed. The node that is being removed is either the source or the destination for VMs that are being live migrated to/from another cluster, and hence the node removal task cannot proceed. Resolution:Ensure enough resources are available on other hosts for the VMs to evacuate from the host being removed. Consider manually shutting down unnecessary VMs and reviewing the HA settings. Put the affected node back in Maintenance Mode now. Put the affected node back in Maintenance Mode. Wait for cross cluster live migration of VM(s) to finish. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8471

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Host [\S]* appears to have failed. High Availability is rest"].iregexp("Host [\S]* appears to have failed. High Availability is rest")}=1
trigger.name: Node Status
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability Hardware GuestVM Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:CVM-Hardware Scope:kCluster Title:Node Failure Name:Node Status Message:Host {hypervisor_address} appears to have failed. High Availability is restarting VMs on {failover_host_info}. Description:Node failure. Description:Node failure. Causes:Host is not accessible. Resolution:Check for network connectivity or a hardware failure. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Non encrypted disk with serial [\S]* was added in drive bay {disk_l"].iregexp("Non encrypted disk with serial [\S]* was added in drive bay {disk_l")}=1
trigger.name: Non SED Disk Inserted Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Hardware Storage Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Disk Scope:kNode Title:Non Self Encryption Drive Disk Inserted Name:Non SED Disk Inserted Check Message:Non encrypted disk with serial {disk_serial} was added in drive bay {disk_location} on Controller VM {service_vm_external_ip}. It is not usable because the rest of the cluster is protected using encrypted drives. Description:Non-self-encrypting drive is inserted. Description:Non-self-encrypting drive is inserted. Causes:A cluster with self-encrypting drives has a non-self encrypting drive installed. Resolution:Ensure all installed drives are of self-encrypting type. If more help is needed call Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8417

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Cluster with compute-only nodes should have total CVM vCPUs greater than to"].iregexp("Cluster with compute-only nodes should have total CVM vCPUs greater than to")}=1
trigger.name: Not large enough CVM (vcpus) for the CO node(s)
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Compute-only cluster sizing: CVM size check Name:Not large enough CVM (vcpus) for the CO node(s) Message:Cluster with compute-only nodes should have total CVM vCPUs greater than total cores on all compute-only nodes Description:Check that cluster with compute-only: Total CVM vCPUs must be greater than total cores on all compute-only nodes. Description:Check that cluster with compute-only: Total CVM vCPUs must be greater than total cores on all compute-only nodes. Causes:Compute-only node was added to a cluster with small CVMs. Resolution:Remove all compute-only nodes from cluster or add additional hyperconverged nodes or resize CVMs Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/7012

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Bridge/vSwitch [\S]* on host [\S]* has different configuration "].iregexp("Bridge/vSwitch [\S]* on host [\S]* has different configuration ")}=1
trigger.name: NS Config Consistency Check
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Network Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Node-Network Scope:kNode Title:Inconsistent Bridge/vSwitch configuration Name:NS Config Consistency Check Message:Bridge/vSwitch {switch_name} on host {host_ip} has different configuration compared to other hosts or zeus configuration, which can result in service degradation. Description:Checks if the host bridge/vSwitch configuration matches NS config in zookeeper. Description:Checks if the host bridge/vSwitch configuration matches NS config in zookeeper. Causes:In case the customer modifies configuration during cluster lifetime, but does not restart genesis, this will result in inconsistent configuration. Resolution:Please refer to KB 8018. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8018

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Discovered that the nucalm internal service is not working: '{service_names"].iregexp("Discovered that the nucalm internal service is not working: '{service_names")}=1
trigger.name: Nucalm Service Down
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Nucalm Internal Service has Stopped Working Name:Nucalm Service Down Message:Discovered that the nucalm internal service is not working: '{service_names}' Description:Nucalm internal service is down Description:Nucalm internal service is down Causes:Nucalm internal service may have stopped working Resolution:Please refer to KB-7080 Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/7080 http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8621

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["This [\S]* has expiring or expired Nutanix Objects license(s). Det"].iregexp("This [\S]* has expiring or expired Nutanix Objects license(s). Det")}=1
trigger.name: ObjectLicenseExpiry
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator License Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Cluster Scope:kCluster Title:Nutanix Objects License Expiry Name:ObjectLicenseExpiry Message:This {cluster_type} has expiring or expired Nutanix Objects license(s). Detailed license expiry info: {license_expiry_msg} {license_warning_msg} Description:Check if Nutanix Objects license is about to expire. Description:Check if Nutanix Objects license is about to expire. Causes:The Nutanix Objects license is set to expire or has expired. Resolution:Contact Nutanix to extend the expiration of the Object license, or apply a new Object license. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/2469

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Disabling further on-disk deduplication (fingerprinting). Controller VM wit"].iregexp("Disabling further on-disk deduplication (fingerprinting). Controller VM wit")}=1
trigger.name: On-Disk Dedup Status
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Storage Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:CVM-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:On-Disk Dedup Disabled Name:On-Disk Dedup Status Message:Disabling further on-disk deduplication (fingerprinting). Controller VM with {ram_size}GB RAM and {ssd_size}GB SSD does not meet the minimum requirements of {required_ram_size}GB RAM and {required_ssd_size}GB SSD to support the on-disk deduplication feature. Description:On-disk deduplication is disabled. Description:On-disk deduplication is disabled. Causes:To support on-disk deduplication (fingerprinting) feature, the Controller VM must meet minimum requirements for RAM and SSD. If this threshold is not satisfied, on-disk deduplication is disabled. Resolution:Once the Controller VMs are upgraded to meet the minimum requirements on RAM and SSD, on-disk deduplication can be enabled. Contact Nutanix support for assistance. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Number of OVS rules is [\S]* for bridge [\S]* on A"].iregexp("Number of OVS rules is [\S]* for bridge [\S]* on A")}=1
trigger.name: Openflow Table Full Check
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability Node Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Host-Network Scope:kNode Title:Openflow Table Getting Full Name:Openflow Table Full Check Message:Number of OVS rules is {num_flow_table_rules} for bridge {bridge_name} on AHV host {host_ip}. This is more than {usage_msg}% of maximum allowed number of rules. Description:Checks that number of OVS rules is not reaching maximum number of rules Description:Checks that number of OVS rules is not reaching maximum number of rules Causes:Openflow table is getting full Resolution:Consider turning off unnecessary user VMs or remove unused vNICs from running user VMs on AHV host. For higher number of allowed OVS rules, ensure AOS version at least 5.10.5 and above on cluster. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/7563

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Oplog episode count is high for some virtual disks for a sustained period o"].iregexp("Oplog episode count is high for some virtual disks for a sustained period o")}=1
trigger.name: Oplog episodes check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Oplog Episode Count Check Name:Oplog episodes check Message:Oplog episode count is high for some virtual disks for a sustained period of time. Description:Check that oplog episode count is within threshold Description:Check that oplog episode count is within threshold Causes:Oplog episode count is high for one or more vDisks. Resolution:One or more VMs have an unusual burst of write IO, or there might be data inconsistency in oplog episode files. Review KB 1541. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1541

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Node [\S]*: detected unexpected restart of ovs-vswitchd process on ho"].iregexp("Node [\S]*: detected unexpected restart of ovs-vswitchd process on ho")}=1
trigger.name: OVS Service Restarted
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Network Scope:kCluster Title:OVS Service Restart Name:OVS Service Restarted Message:Node {uuid_node}: detected unexpected restart of ovs-vswitchd process on host {host_ip} from old_pid {old_pid} to new_pid {new_pid}. OVS service configuration was restored after restart. Guest VMs might have experienced temporary network disconnect. Description:OVS service has unexpectedly restarted on one or more AHV hosts. Description:OVS service has unexpectedly restarted on one or more AHV hosts. Causes:OVS service was restarted. Resolution:Bridges and flow rules on hosts have been rebuilt. No user action is required. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/6151

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Cannot remove password protected disks [\S]* from the configuratio"].iregexp("Cannot remove password protected disks [\S]* from the configuratio")}=1
trigger.name: Password Protected Disk Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:CVM-Disk Scope:kCluster Title:Cannot Remove Password Protected Disk(s) Name:Password Protected Disk Status Message:Cannot remove password protected disks {disk_id_list} from the configuration as they cannot be cleaned. Description:Cannot remove password protected disk(s). Description:Cannot remove password protected disk(s). Causes:The drives are offline, the drives are removed, or the node is down. Resolution:Ensure the disks are accessible. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Unable to make protection domain '[\S]*' active on remot"].iregexp("Unable to make protection domain '[\S]*' active on remot")}=1
trigger.name: PD Active
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Protection Domain Activation Failed Name:PD Active Message:Unable to make protection domain '{protection_domain_name}' active on remote site '{remote_name}' due to '{reason}'. Description:Protection domain activation failed. Description:Protection domain activation failed. Causes:Various Resolution:Resolve the stated reason for the failure. If issue persists, contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8468

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Protection domain [\S]* activate/deactivate failed with "].iregexp("Protection domain [\S]* activate/deactivate failed with ")}=1
trigger.name: PD Change Mode Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Protection Domain Activation or Migration Failure Name:PD Change Mode Status Message:Protection domain {protection_domain_name} activate/deactivate failed with the error : {reason} Description:Protection domain activation or migration failed. Description:Protection domain activation or migration failed. Causes:(A) Protection domain cannot be activated or migrated. (B) Protection domain with same name might be active on remote site. (C) Remote sites might not be configured correctly, please check the remote sites on source and target clusters. (D) Protection Domain has one or more missing VMs/VGs. Resolution:Resolve the stated reason for the failure. If issue persists, please contact Nutanix Support. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8021

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Protection domain [\S]* replication to the remote site {"].iregexp("Protection domain [\S]* replication to the remote site {")}=1
trigger.name: PD Replication Expiry Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Data Protection-Remote Site Scope:kCluster Title:Protection Domain Replication Expired Name:PD Replication Expiry Status Message:Protection domain {protection_domain_name} replication to the remote site {remote_name} has expired before it is started. Description:Protection domain replication expired. Description:Protection domain replication expired. Causes:Replication is taking too long to complete before the snapshots expire. Resolution:Review replication schedules taking into account bandwidth and overall load on systems. Confirm retention time on replicated snapshots. If issue persists, please contact Nutanix Support. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Replication was skipped for protection domain [\S]* of t"].iregexp("Replication was skipped for protection domain [\S]* of t")}=1
trigger.name: PD Replication Skipped Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Data Protection-Remote Site Scope:kCluster Title:Skipped Replication Of Snapshot For Protection Domain Name:PD Replication Skipped Status Message:Replication was skipped for protection domain {protection_domain_name} of the latest snapshot {snapshot_name} to remote site {remote_name}. {reason} There could be other snapshots that may have been skipped. Description:Skipped replication of the snapshot. Description:Skipped replication of the snapshot. Causes:Snapshot replication was skipped because a newer snapshot is available. Resolution:Make sure that enough bandwidth is available for replication. If the issue persists, consider reducing the frequency of replication. Perform a manual resync of the skipped snapshot, if required. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/4282

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Protection domain [\S]* replication to remote site {remo"].iregexp("Protection domain [\S]* replication to remote site {remo")}=1
trigger.name: PD Replication Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Data Protection-Remote Site Scope:kCluster Title:Protection Domain Replication Failure Name:PD Replication Status Message:Protection domain {protection_domain_name} replication to remote site {remote_name} failed. {reason}. Description:Protection Domain Replication Failure Description:Protection Domain Replication Failure Causes:Various Resolution:Resolve the stated reason for the failure. If you cannot resolve the error, contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Protection domain [\S]* snapshot '[\S]*' failed."].iregexp("Protection domain [\S]* snapshot '[\S]*' failed.")}=1
trigger.name: PD Snapshot Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Protection Domain Snapshot Failure Name:PD Snapshot Status Message:Protection domain {protection_domain_name} snapshot '{snapshot_id}' failed. {reason}. Description:Protection Domain Snapshot Failure. Description:Protection Domain Snapshot Failure. Causes:Protection domain has VMs being protected by other vstore(s) or in case of a cluster where Metro Availability is configured, Metro protection domain has more entities than supported. Resolution:Unprotect VMs from other vstore(s) before snapshotting the concerned protection domain. In case of a cluster where Metro Availability is configured, make sure number of entities are within the supported limit. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8038

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to register one or more VMs of the protection domain {protection_dom"].iregexp("Failed to register one or more VMs of the protection domain {protection_dom")}=1
trigger.name: PD VM Registration Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Registration Of One Or More VMs Failed Name:PD VM Registration Status Message:Failed to register one or more VMs of the protection domain {protection_domain_name}. Description:Registration of one or more VMs failed. Description:Registration of one or more VMs failed. Causes:VMs in the snapshot have invalid VM configuration or the local hypervisor reported an error. Resolution:Check the existence of the VM in the snapshot and check any errors reported in the hypervisor management software. If you cannot resolve the error, contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8005

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["The remote [\S]* [\S]* is unreachable."].iregexp("The remote [\S]* [\S]* is unreachable.")}=1
trigger.name: PE-PC Connection Failure
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:PE-PC Connection Failure Name:PE-PC Connection Failure Message:The remote {remote_vm_type} {cluster_ip} is unreachable. Description:The remote {remote_vm_type} {cluster_ip} is unreachable. Description:The remote {remote_vm_type} {cluster_ip} is unreachable. Causes:The name servers might be missing. Services on PC/PE might be down. Access tokens might have expired. Resolution:Ensure that the appropriate name servers are configured. Check that no services are crashing on the PC or PE. Contact Nutanix Support to troubleshoot this issue further. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Drive with serial [\S]* and model [\S]* was removed from dri"].iregexp("Drive with serial [\S]* and model [\S]* was removed from dri")}=1
trigger.name: Physical Disk Remove Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator ControllerVM Storage Hardware Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Disk Scope:kNode Title:Physical Disk Removed From Slot Name:Physical Disk Remove Check Message:Drive with serial {disk_serial} and model {disk_model} was removed from drive bay {disk_location} on Controller VM {service_vm_external_ip}. Node serial is {node_serial_number} and Node position {node_position}. Description:Physical drive is removed from the slot. Description:Physical drive is removed from the slot. Causes:A drive was physically disconnected from a slot. Resolution:Remove the drive from the slot and reseat it. Contact the Hardware Vendor if issue persists. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8031

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Drive [\S]* with serial [\S]* and model [\S]* in drive b"].iregexp("Drive [\S]* with serial [\S]* and model [\S]* in drive b")}=1
trigger.name: Physical Disk Status
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability ControllerVM Storage Hardware Affected Entity Type:disk Subcategory Type:CVM-Disk Scope:kNode Title:Physical Disk Drive Has Failed Name:Physical Disk Status Message:Drive {disk_id} with serial {disk_serial} and model {disk_model} in drive bay {disk_location} on Controller VM {service_vm_external_ip} has failed. Node serial is {node_serial_number} and Node position {node_position}. Description:Physical drive has failed. Description:Physical drive has failed. Causes:The drive has failed. Resolution:Replace the failed drive. Please refer to KB 4158. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/4158

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Validation failed for open ports for required services for Synchronous Replication"].iregexp("Validation failed for open ports for required services for Synchronous Replication")}=1
trigger.name: Ports Open Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Data Protection-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Validation failed for open ports for required services for Synchronous Replication Name:Ports Open Check Message:{error_msg} Description:Checks if the ports for the services Acropolis(2030), Anduril(2036), Cerebro(2020), Ergon(2090), NGT(2073), Stargate(2009) which are required for Synchronous Replication are open Description:Checks if the ports for the services Acropolis(2030), Anduril(2036), Cerebro(2020), Ergon(2090), NGT(2073), Stargate(2009) which are required for Synchronous Replication are open Causes:One or more services required for Synchronous Replication cannot be reached Resolution:Check firewall rules on the CVM and in your environment and reach out to Nutanix Support for any service related issues Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/7365

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Power cycle the VMs before you perform the upgrade or migration operation"].iregexp("Power cycle the VMs before you perform the upgrade or migration operation")}=1
trigger.name: Power cycle VMs before performing upgrade or migrate operation
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Power cycle VMs before performing upgrade or migrate operation Name:Power cycle VMs before performing upgrade or migrate operation Message:Power cycle the VMs before you perform the upgrade or migration operation Description:Power cycle all the VMs before you perform the upgrade or migrate operation. Description:Power cycle all the VMs before you perform the upgrade or migrate operation. Causes:A node with a lower CPU feature set has been added to the cluster. Resolution:Ensure that all the VMs in the cluster are power cycled. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Power Supply Status Down/Unretrievable"].iregexp("Power Supply Status Down/Unretrievable")}=1
trigger.name: Power Supply Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Hardware Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Hardware Scope:kCluster Title:Power Supply Status Down/Unretrievable Name:Power Supply Status Message:{per_psu_msg} Description:Check that Power supply has no errors. Description:Check that Power supply has no errors. Causes:1. The power supply has failed or status not retrievable because BMC can not communicate with PSU properly2. BMC version may not be up to date and/or able to communicate with PSU for accurate status Resolution:1. Restore the power supply as soon as possible.Refer to the Nutanix documentation for instructions.2. If PSU info unavailable, upgrade to the latest BMC firmware, and apply factory default after BMC upgrade. If it does not solve the issue, Refer to Nutanix KB 7386 Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/7386

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Compliance Failure of the Protected VMs."].iregexp("Compliance Failure of the Protected VMs.")}=1
trigger.name: Protected VM CBR Capability
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:vm Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Virtual Machine Scope:kCluster Title:Compliance Failure of the Protected VMs. Name:Protected VM CBR Capability Message:{message} Description:Protected VM is not Nutanix backup and recovery compliant. Description:Protected VM is not Nutanix backup and recovery compliant. Causes:Protected VM may have been modified to include files that are not on a Nutanix Storage Container. Resolution:Remove or detach files from the VM that are not on the Nutanix Storage Containers and make the VM Nutanix backup and recovery compliant. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Protected VM [\S]* is not capable of backup and recovery. Reason: {cbr_"].iregexp("Protected VM [\S]* is not capable of backup and recovery. Reason: {cbr_")}=1
trigger.name: Protected VM CBR Incapable
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:vm Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kNode Title:Protected VM is not capable of backup and recovery. Name:Protected VM CBR Incapable Message:Protected VM {vm_name} is not capable of backup and recovery. Reason: {cbr_incapable_reason} Description:Some of the protected VMs are not capable of backup and recovery. Description:Some of the protected VMs are not capable of backup and recovery. Causes:Not all protected VMs have a valid configuration for backup and recovery Resolution:Review and update the VM configuration. If the configuration of the VM cannot be changed then unprotect the VMs. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/7635

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["VM(s) [\S]* protected by protection domain '[\S]*' "].iregexp("VM(s) [\S]* protected by protection domain '[\S]*' ")}=1
trigger.name: Protected VMs May Not Be Recoverable
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Storage Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Protected VM(s) May Not Be Recoverable Name:Protected VMs May Not Be Recoverable Message:VM(s) {vm_names} protected by protection domain '{protection_domain_name}' are running from VMWare snapshots. Recovery of the VMs from the PD snapshot '{snapshot_id}' may not succeed. Manual intervention is required to bootup the VMs. Description:Protected VM(s) May Not Be Recoverable Description:Protected VM(s) May Not Be Recoverable Causes:Protected VM(s) are running from VMWare snapshots and may not be recoverable. Resolution:Ensure that the VMs are not running from VMWare snapshot at the time of scheduled Protection Domain snapshot. Refer Nutanix KB: 7023 for further details. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Unable to locate VM(s) [\S]* protected by protection domain '{protecti"].iregexp("Unable to locate VM(s) [\S]* protected by protection domain '{protecti")}=1
trigger.name: Protected VMs Not Found
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Storage Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Protected VM(s) Not Found Name:Protected VMs Not Found Message:Unable to locate VM(s) {vm_names} protected by protection domain '{protection_domain_name}'. Description:Protected VM(s) Not Found. Description:Protected VM(s) Not Found. Causes:Protected VM(s) cannot be found and may have been deleted. Resolution:Verify that the VM(s) are registered on the host. If the VM(s) were unregistered or deleted, remove VM(s) from the protection domain. If the CVM on the host the VM(s) are registered on was shutdown or rebooting, retry the snapshot operation. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Unable to locate volume group(s) [\S]* protected by protection domain "].iregexp("Unable to locate volume group(s) [\S]* protected by protection domain ")}=1
trigger.name: Protected Volume Groups Not Found
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Storage Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Protected Volume Groups Not Found Name:Protected Volume Groups Not Found Message:Unable to locate volume group(s) {vg_names} protected by protection domain '{protection_domain_name}'. Description:Protected volume groups not found. Description:Protected volume groups not found. Causes:Protected volume group(s) cannot be found and may have been deleted. Resolution:Remove volume group(s) from the protection domain. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Volume group(s) [\S]* in protection domain [\S]* use client IP add"].iregexp("Volume group(s) [\S]* in protection domain [\S]* use client IP add")}=1
trigger.name: Protected Volume Group with IP address in Whitelist Check
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Protection domain contains volume group(s) using client IP address to whitelist a client. Name:Protected Volume Group with IP address in Whitelist Check Message:Volume group(s) {vg_names} in protection domain {pd_name} use client IP address to whitelist a client. Description:Check if any volume group with IP address in whitelist is protected in protection domain Description:Check if any volume group with IP address in whitelist is protected in protection domain Causes:Protection domain contains volume group(s) using client IP address to whitelist a client. Resolution:Update the client properties to include the client IQN instead of the IP address to configure the client list for the volume group(s). Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/6036

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Protection domain '[\S]*' protecting the Storage Contain"].iregexp("Protection domain '[\S]*' protecting the Storage Contain")}=1
trigger.name: Protection Domain Decoupled Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Node Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Data Protection-Remote Site Scope:kCluster Title:Protection Domain is in a Decoupled State Name:Protection Domain Decoupled Status Message:Protection domain '{protection_domain_name}' protecting the Storage Container '{container_name}' is in a decoupled state. {impact} Description:Protection domain is in a decoupled state. Description:Protection domain is in a decoupled state. Causes:Standby site has been promoted to the primary site. Resolution:Re-enable metro availability from the remote site. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Protection Domain '[\S]*' has degraded to '[\S]*'"].iregexp("Protection Domain '[\S]*' has degraded to '[\S]*'")}=1
trigger.name: Protection Domain fallback to lower frequency replications to remote
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Data Protection-Remote Site Scope:kCluster Title:Protection Domain falling back to lower frequency replications to remote. Name:Protection Domain fallback to lower frequency replications to remote Message:Protection Domain '{protection_domain_name}' has degraded to '{rpo_string}' RPO to remote '{remote_name}'. {reason}. Description:Protection Domain fallback to lower frequency replications to remote. Description:Protection Domain fallback to lower frequency replications to remote. Causes:High frequency replications to remote site cannot be sustained due to system constraints. Resolution:Protection Domain will automatically attempt to transition to higher frequency replications when resources are available. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Files [\S]* conflict with activation of Protection Domain. Al"].iregexp("Files [\S]* conflict with activation of Protection Domain. Al")}=1
trigger.name: Protection Domain File Conflict Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Data Protection-Remote Site Scope:kCluster Title:Protection Domain activation may fail as conflicting files exist. Name:Protection Domain File Conflict Check Message:Files {conflicting_files} conflict with activation of Protection Domain. All entities may not be recovered. Description:Check if any existing file turns into a conflicting state after activating an inactive Protection Domain. Description:Check if any existing file turns into a conflicting state after activating an inactive Protection Domain. Causes:This might occur if some entities were unprotected from the Protection Domain before making it inactive or some files were created outside the scope of the protection domain. Resolution:Before activating this Protection Domain, please identify the entities (VMs or VGs) referring the conflicting files and delete the VMs/VGs after making sure that they are not in use. Do not delete disks directly. Additionally, in case of ESX, please remove any other VM files associated with stale entities. If the issue persists, contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/4592

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to receive snapshot for the protection domain '{protection_domain_na"].iregexp("Failed to receive snapshot for the protection domain '{protection_domain_na")}=1
trigger.name: Protection Domain Receive Snapshot Failure
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Data Protection-Remote Site Scope:kCluster Title:Failed to Receive Snapshot for the Protection Domain Name:Protection Domain Receive Snapshot Failure Message:Failed to receive snapshot for the protection domain '{protection_domain_name}' from the remote site {remote_name}. {reason} Description:Protection Domain Receive Snapshot Failure. Description:Protection Domain Receive Snapshot Failure. Causes:Incorrect configuration on DR site or Network Error. Resolution:Resolve the stated reason for the failure. If you cannot resolve the error, contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Replication of protection domain [\S]* to remote site {r"].iregexp("Replication of protection domain [\S]* to remote site {r")}=1
trigger.name: Protection Domain Replication Stuck
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Data Protection-Remote Site Scope:kCluster Title:Replication of protection domain {protection_domain_name} has not progressed. Name:Protection Domain Replication Stuck Message:Replication of protection domain {protection_domain_name} to remote site {remote_name} for the snapshot {snapshot_id} has not made any progress in last one hour. Description:Replication of protection domain has not progressed. Description:Replication of protection domain has not progressed. Causes:Network outage with remote. Remote cluster does not have enough free disk space available. Single-node cluster might be in read-only mode, due to one of the metadata SSDs failure. Resolution:Check network connection with remote. Make sure that the remote cluster has enough disk space available. Replace the failed SSD. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["The Protection Domain [\S]* will maintain [\S]* R"].iregexp("The Protection Domain [\S]* will maintain [\S]* R")}=1
trigger.name: Protection Domain Seeding Process Pending to Remote Site
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Data Protection-Remote Site Scope:kCluster Title:Protection Domain {protection_domain_name} Seeding Process Pending to the Remote Site {remote_name} Name:Protection Domain Seeding Process Pending to Remote Site Message:The Protection Domain {protection_domain_name} will maintain {rpo_string} RPO until seeding process completes to the remote_site {remote_name}. The seeding process gets completed when snapshot reserve has been allocated on the local and remote site Description:Protection Domain {protection_domain_name} will maintain {rpo_string} RPO until seeding process completes to the remote_site {remote_name} Description:Protection Domain {protection_domain_name} will maintain {rpo_string} RPO until seeding process completes to the remote_site {remote_name} Causes:Various Resolution:Maintain enough network bandwidth to help the seeding transfer to succeed. Protection domain will wait for the seeding transfer and then automatically enable the configured RPO. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Snapshot creation for the protection domain [\S]* has be"].iregexp("Snapshot creation for the protection domain [\S]* has be")}=1
trigger.name: Protection Domain Snapshots Delayed
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Snapshot Creation Delayed Name:Protection Domain Snapshots Delayed Message:Snapshot creation for the protection domain {protection_domain_name} has been delayed. Description:Snapshot creation for the protection domain {protection_domain_name} has been delayed Description:Snapshot creation for the protection domain {protection_domain_name} has been delayed Causes:Many entities might be scheduled for the snapshot creation at the same time. Resolution:Stagger the schedules for different protected entities. Additionally, you can throttle other administrative operations in the cluster. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Protection domain [\S]* has one or more snapshots queued"].iregexp("Protection domain [\S]* has one or more snapshots queued")}=1
trigger.name: Protection Domain Snapshots Queued for Replication to Remote Site
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Data Protection-Remote Site Scope:kCluster Title:Snapshot queued for replications to remote site Name:Protection Domain Snapshots Queued for Replication to Remote Site Message:Protection domain {protection_domain_name} has one or more snapshots queued for replication to remote site {remote_name} Description:Protection domain {protection_domain_name} has one or more snapshots queued for replication to remote site {remote_name} Description:Protection domain {protection_domain_name} has one or more snapshots queued for replication to remote site {remote_name} Causes:Various Resolution:Maintain enough cross-cluster network bandwidth and throttle primary IO Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["VM [\S]* is protected in multiple protection domains [\S]*."].iregexp("VM [\S]* is protected in multiple protection domains [\S]*.")}=1
trigger.name: Protection Domains sharing VMs
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:vm Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:VM is protected in multiple PDs. Name:Protection Domains sharing VMs Message:VM {vm_name} is protected in multiple protection domains {pd_names}. Description:VM is protected in multiple Protection Domains. Description:VM is protected in multiple Protection Domains. Causes:VM is protected in multiple Protection Domains. Resolution:Verify that the VM is not protected in multiple Protection Domains. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/3337

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to apply the protection rule on the VM '[\S]*', because of '{rea"].iregexp("Failed to apply the protection rule on the VM '[\S]*', because of '{rea")}=1
trigger.name: Protection Rule Conflicts
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:vm Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Virtual Machine Scope:kCluster Title:Protection Rule Conflict Occurred. Name:Protection Rule Conflicts Message:Failed to apply the protection rule on the VM '{vm_name}', because of '{reason}'. Description:Unable to protect VM due to conflicting protection rules. Description:Unable to protect VM due to conflicting protection rules. Causes:One or more protection rules protecting the same entity. Resolution:Resolve all the conflicts between the protection rules or modify the VM to ensure that it is protected under one protection rule. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8275

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["One or more cluster services have restarted within 15 minutes in the PCVM/C"].iregexp("One or more cluster services have restarted within 15 minutes in the PCVM/C")}=1
trigger.name: Python Services Fatal Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator ControllerVM Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Services Scope:kNode Title:CVM Python Service(s) Restarting Frequently Name:Python Services Fatal Check Message:One or more cluster services have restarted within 15 minutes in the PCVM/CVM {ip_address}, the total restarts being >= 10. The following are the service(s) that have restarted : {failed_components}. Description:Check if python services have crashed/restarted recently in PCVM/CVM Description:Check if python services have crashed/restarted recently in PCVM/CVM Causes:Faulty behavior in one or more service(s) leading to frequent crashes in a short period of time. Resolution:If this alert occurs more than once, please contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/2472

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Cluster with compute-only nodes should not have the ratio of compute-only t"].iregexp("Cluster with compute-only nodes should not have the ratio of compute-only t")}=1
trigger.name: Ratio of CO to HC nodes to not exceed 1:2
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Compute-only cluster sizing: compute-only to hyperconverged node ratio check Name:Ratio of CO to HC nodes to not exceed 1:2 Message:Cluster with compute-only nodes should not have the ratio of compute-only to hyperconverged nodes exceed 1:2 Description:Ratio of compute-only to hyperconverged nodes to not exceed 1:2 Description:Ratio of compute-only to hyperconverged nodes to not exceed 1:2 Causes:High ratio of compute-only to hyperconverged nodes. Resolution:Remove all compute-only nodes from cluster or add additional hyperconverged nodes. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/7012

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Network switch DCBX or NIC PFC is not configured correctly or enabled for R"].iregexp("Network switch DCBX or NIC PFC is not configured correctly or enabled for R")}=1
trigger.name: RDMA network switch and NIC PFC config check
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability Cluster Network Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Network Scope:kNode Title:Network switch DCBX or NIC PFC is not configured correctly or enabled for RDMA NICs on CVM Name:RDMA network switch and NIC PFC config check Message:Network switch DCBX or NIC PFC is not configured correctly or enabled for RDMA NICs on CVM {cvm_ip}: {alert_msg} Description:Checks if network switch DCBX and NIC PFC are correctly configured and enabled. Description:Checks if network switch DCBX and NIC PFC are correctly configured and enabled. Causes:Network switch DCBX is disabled or corresponding NIC PFC bit is not enabled. Resolution:Enable DCBX on network switch and configure PFC bit on RDMA NICs. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/5925

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Recovery location: [\S]* is not in good state. "].iregexp("Recovery location: [\S]* is not in good state. ")}=1
trigger.name: Recovery Location Not In Good State
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Availability Zone Scope:kCluster Title:Recovery Location is not in Good State Name:Recovery Location Not In Good State Message:Recovery location: {availability_zone_physical_name} is not in good state. Replications to this site will fail. Description:Recovery location is not in good state. Description:Recovery location is not in good state. Causes:If Recovery Availability Zone is different from the Primary Availability Zone, check Network connectivity issues between the two Availability Zones. Data Protection and Replication service is not working as expected. The service could be down. The Cluster(s) attached to the affected Availability Zone may have been destroyed and recreated. Resolution:Check network connection between the Primary and the Recovery Availability Zone. Contact Nutanix support. Disconnect and reconnect the Recovery Availability Zone. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["[\S]* failed for the Recovery Plan [\S]*. One or "].iregexp("[\S]* failed for the Recovery Plan [\S]*. One or ")}=1
trigger.name: Recovery Plan Execution Failure
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability DR Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Recovery Plan Scope:kCluster Title:Recovery Plan Execution Failure Name:Recovery Plan Execution Failure Message:{operation_type} failed for the Recovery Plan {recovery_plan_name}. One or more VMs in this Recovery Plan might have failed to start. Description:Execution of the Recovery Plan failed. Description:Execution of the Recovery Plan failed. Causes:One or more VMs were not recovered as part of the Recovery Plan execution. Resolution:Review the Recovery Plan execution report for detailed step by step information on the recovery plan execution and failures. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8278

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["The [\S]* for the recovery plan [\S]* could not b"].iregexp("The [\S]* for the recovery plan [\S]* could not b")}=1
trigger.name: Recovery Plan Execution Failure due to Validation Errors
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability DR Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Recovery Plan Scope:kCluster Title:Recovery Plan Execution Failure due to Validation Errors Name:Recovery Plan Execution Failure due to Validation Errors Message:The {operation_type} for the recovery plan {recovery_plan_name} could not be started due to errors in validation. Description:Execution of the Recovery Plan failed. Description:Execution of the Recovery Plan failed. Causes:The Recovery Plan validation failed. Resolution:Review the Recovery Plan validation report for detailed information. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8277

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["[\S]* for Recovery plan [\S]* resulted in validat"].iregexp("[\S]* for Recovery plan [\S]* resulted in validat")}=1
trigger.name: Recovery Plan Execution Failure due to Validation Warnings
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration DR Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Recovery Plan Scope:kCluster Title:Validation Warnings found during Recovery Plan Execution Name:Recovery Plan Execution Failure due to Validation Warnings Message:{operation_type} for Recovery plan {recovery_plan_name} resulted in validation warnings. You can choose to execute the Recovery Plan anyway or you can fix the issues. Description:Execution of the Recovery Plan failed. Description:Execution of the Recovery Plan failed. Causes:The Recovery Plan validation resulted in warnings. Resolution:Review the Recovery Plan validation report for detailed information. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to replicate recovery point created at: '{recovery_point_create_time"].iregexp("Failed to replicate recovery point created at: '{recovery_point_create_time")}=1
trigger.name: Recovery Point Replication Failed
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:vm Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Virtual Machine Scope:kCluster Title:Recovery Point Replication Failed Name:Recovery Point Replication Failed Message:Failed to replicate recovery point created at: '{recovery_point_create_time}' UTC of the VM: '{vm_name}' to the recovery location: {availability_zone_physical_name}. Description:Recovery Point replication failed. Description:Recovery Point replication failed. Causes:Network Connectivity issues between the Primary and the Recovery Availability Zone. Data Protection and Replication service is not working as expected. The service could be down. VM migration process is in progress. If NearSync is enabled, the container name on remote cluster should match the one on source cluster hosting the VM. Virtual IP address has not been configured on the remote cluster. Remote clusters are unhealthy. Recovery point was created for an entity having datasource backed virtual disks. Resolution:Check network connection between the Primary and the Recovery Availability Zone. Contact Nutanix support. Retry the Recovery Point replication operation after the migration is complete. Create container(s) on which VM is running with the same name on the remote cluster. Configure the Virtual IP address and then retry the Recovery Point replication operation. For a manually taken Recovery Point, retry replication again. For a scheduled Recovery Point replication, ensure all the emote clusters are healthy. Then wait for the scheduled Recovery Point replication. Retry the Recovery Point replication operation after storage migration for the datasource backed virtual disks is complete. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8460

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Skipped replication of Recovery point created at '{recovery_point_create_ti"].iregexp("Skipped replication of Recovery point created at '{recovery_point_create_ti")}=1
trigger.name: Recovery Point Replication Skipped
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:vm Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Virtual Machine Scope:kCluster Title:Recovery Point Replication Skipped. Name:Recovery Point Replication Skipped Message:Skipped replication of Recovery point created at '{recovery_point_create_time}' UTC of the VM: '{vm_name}' because of '{reason}'. Description:Recovery Point Replication Skipped. Description:Recovery Point Replication Skipped. Causes:Latest recovery point is in the queue for the replication. Resolution:Trigger the replication of the snapshot manually. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["File server [\S]* protection domain [\S]* e"].iregexp("File server [\S]* protection domain [\S]* e")}=1
trigger.name: Remote Site AOS not compatible with File Server version
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Network Scope:kCluster Title:Remote Site AOS not compatible with File Server version Name:Remote Site AOS not compatible with File Server version Message:File server {file_server_name} protection domain {protection_domain_name} enabled on non-compatible Remote site {remote_site_name}: {reason} Description:Checks File server remote sites AOS are file server version compatible Description:Checks File server remote sites AOS are file server version compatible Causes:Remote site AOS is not compatible with File server version Resolution:Refer to KB article 4380. Contact Nutanix support if issue still persists or assistance needed. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/4380

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Connectivity to remote site [\S]* is not normal."].iregexp("Connectivity to remote site [\S]* is not normal.")}=1
trigger.name: Remote Site Connectivity
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:remote_site Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Remote Site Scope:kCluster Title:Remote site connectivity not normal. Name:Remote Site Connectivity Message:Connectivity to remote site {remote_name} is not normal. Description:Check if connectivity to remote sites is normal. Description:Check if connectivity to remote sites is normal. Causes:Remote site may not have the local site configured as a remote. Remote site might be stale (destroyed and re-created). Cluster services at remote site might not be running. Network connectivity to remote site might have been lost. Firewall/VPN on source cluster, remote cluster, or both may prevent connection establishment. Resolution:Configure the local site as a remote on the remote site. Remove and re-add the remote site on the local cluster. Ensure that cluster services at remote site are running. Check network connectivity to remote site. Check firewall/VPN on source cluster and remote cluster to allow them to connect to each other. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1596

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Network connectivity to remote site '[\S]*' is unstable"].iregexp("Network connectivity to remote site '[\S]*' is unstable")}=1
trigger.name: Remote Site Connectivity Unstable
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability DR Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Network Scope:kCluster Title:Remote Site network connectivity unstable Name:Remote Site Connectivity Unstable Message:Network connectivity to remote site '{remote_name}' is unstable Description:Remote Site network connectivity is unstable Description:Remote Site network connectivity is unstable Causes:Connection to remote site is unstable Resolution:Check network connectivity between local and remote sites and manually break metro if VM I/O is stalled Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/9713

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Remote '[\S]*' is unhealthy due to reason '[\S]*'."].iregexp("Remote '[\S]*' is unhealthy due to reason '[\S]*'.")}=1
trigger.name: Remote Site Health
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:remote_site Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Remote Site Scope:kCluster Title:Remote Site Is Unhealthy Name:Remote Site Health Message:Remote '{remote_name}' is unhealthy due to reason '{reason}'. Description:Remote site is unhealthy. Description:Remote site is unhealthy. Causes:Various Resolution:Check if the IP address specified in the remote site is reachable. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Latency to remote site '[\S]*' is more than '{remote_site_high_late"].iregexp("Latency to remote site '[\S]*' is more than '{remote_site_high_late")}=1
trigger.name: RemoteSiteHighLatency
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:CVM-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Remote Site Latency Is High. Name:RemoteSiteHighLatency Message:Latency to remote site '{remote_name}' is more than '{remote_site_high_latency_threshold_ms}' ms , for '{sustained_high_latency_secs}' seconds due to {reason}. Description:Latency to a Metro remote site is high. Description:Latency to a Metro remote site is high. Causes:Network issues or CVM resource constraints Resolution:Check if remote site is reachable and resolve any network issues. Monitor CVM CPU and memory usage Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["No network mapping specified for the remote site [\S]*."].iregexp("No network mapping specified for the remote site [\S]*.")}=1
trigger.name: Remote Site Network Configuration
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration DR Affected Entity Type:remote_site Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Remote Site Scope:kCluster Title:Missing Network Mapping for the Remote Site. Name:Remote Site Network Configuration Message:No network mapping specified for the remote site {remote_name}. Description:Network mapping not specified for the remote site. Description:Network mapping not specified for the remote site. Causes:Network mapping not specified for the remote site. Resolution:Specify network mapping for the remote site. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Invalid network mapping specified for remote site [\S]*: [\S]*."].iregexp("Invalid network mapping specified for remote site [\S]*: [\S]*.")}=1
trigger.name: Remote Site Network Mapping Configuration
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:remote_site Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Remote Site Scope:kCluster Title:Remote Site {remote_name} Network Mapping Invalid Name:Remote Site Network Mapping Configuration Message:Invalid network mapping specified for remote site {remote_name}: {reason}. Description:Invalid Network Mapping Specified. Description:Invalid Network Mapping Specified. Causes:Either the source or destination network configuration is not present in the network mapping specified on the remote site, or the networks specified in the network mapping do not exist. The network associated with one or more VM(s) does not have the corresponding recovery network mapping in the remote site. Resolution:Delete existing network mappings and create the network mapping with the associated networks present on the source and the destination cluster for the remote site. Update the network mapping of the remote site with all the network(s) associated with the VM(s). Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/10243

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Remote site [\S]* moved to read-only state, outgoing replications t"].iregexp("Remote site [\S]* moved to read-only state, outgoing replications t")}=1
trigger.name: Remote Site Operation Mode ReadOnly
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:remote_site Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Remote Site Scope:kCluster Title:Remote Site Operation Mode ReadOnly Name:Remote Site Operation Mode ReadOnly Message:Remote site {remote_name} moved to read-only state, outgoing replications to this remote will fail. Description:Operation Mode of Remote Site changed to kReadOnly. Description:Operation Mode of Remote Site changed to kReadOnly. Causes:SSD failure on remote site in case of single node or two-node cluster. Cloud virtual appliance ran out of memory in case of cloud connect. Data stored on cloud appliance exceeded 20TB. Resolution:Replace the failed SSD on the remote site. Delete some remote snapshots to reduce memory or data usage in case of cloud connect and wait for some time. Increase the cloud CVM size. Refer to the Nutanix documentation for instructions. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8082

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Remote [\S]* is configured with the subnet [\S]*,"].iregexp("Remote [\S]* is configured with the subnet [\S]*,")}=1
trigger.name: Remote Subnet Mismatch With Provided Value
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:remote_site Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Remote Site Scope:kCluster Title:Subnet configured for Remote Site mis-matches with remote cluster subnet Name:Remote Subnet Mismatch With Provided Value Message:Remote {remote_name} is configured with the subnet {user_specified_subnet}, which is not matching with the subnet {remote_returned_subnet} of the remote cluster. Description:Subnet configured for Remote Site mis-matches with remote cluster subnet. Description:Subnet configured for Remote Site mis-matches with remote cluster subnet. Causes:Subnet specified in the remote site is not matching with the subnet of the remote cluster. Resolution:Reconfigure the remote subnet parameter. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Remote syslog server forwarding failures detected on CVM: [\S]*"].iregexp("Remote syslog server forwarding failures detected on CVM: [\S]*")}=1
trigger.name: Remote syslog forwarding failure check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Node-Services Scope:kNode Title:Remote syslog server forwarding failed. Name:Remote syslog forwarding failure check Message:Remote syslog server forwarding failures detected on CVM: {svm_ip} Description:Check remote syslog server log forwarding. Description:Check remote syslog server log forwarding. Causes:Remote syslog server forwarding failed. Resolution:Check for forwarding failure causes with rsyslog server. Refer KB 10735 Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/10735

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Remote syslog server is not reachable."].iregexp("Remote syslog server is not reachable.")}=1
trigger.name: Remote syslog server check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Node-Services Scope:kNode Title:Remote syslog server not reachable Name:Remote syslog server check Message:Remote syslog server is not reachable. Description:Check remote syslog server connectivity Description:Check remote syslog server connectivity Causes:Remote syslog server is not reachable. Resolution:Check for network problem with rsyslog server or upstream network. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/2043

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Protection domain [\S]* with entities from the storage container(s) {de"].iregexp("Protection domain [\S]* with entities from the storage container(s) {de")}=1
trigger.name: Replication of deduped entities to non-compliant remote sites
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Replications are scheduled on entities from the storage container(s) that have deduplication enabled. Name:Replication of deduped entities to non-compliant remote sites Message:Protection domain {pd_name} with entities from the storage container(s) {dedup_ctrs} that have deduplication enabled are being replicated to single-node backup or cloud remote site(s) {remote_names}. Description:Replications are scheduled on entities from the storage container(s) that have deduplication enabled Description:Replications are scheduled on entities from the storage container(s) that have deduplication enabled Causes:Protection domain with entities from the storage container(s) that have deduplication enabled are being replicated to a single-node backup or cloud remote site. Resolution:Either disable deduplication on the storage container(s), or use a multi-node AOS cluster as a replication target. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/4343

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Do not replicate protection domain [\S]* comprising enti"].iregexp("Do not replicate protection domain [\S]* comprising enti")}=1
trigger.name: Replication Of Deduped Entity
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Data Protection-Remote Site Scope:kCluster Title:Snapshot contains entities from the storage container that have deduplication enabled. Name:Replication Of Deduped Entity Message:Do not replicate protection domain {protection_domain_name} comprising entities from the storage container that have deduplication enabled to a {remote_site_type} remote site {remote_name}. Description:Snapshot contains entities from the storage container that have deduplication enabled. Description:Snapshot contains entities from the storage container that have deduplication enabled. Causes:Replicating a snapshot with entities from the storage container that have deduplication enabled to a single node backup or cloud remote site. Resolution:Either disable dedup on the Storage Containers, or use a multi-node AOS cluster as a replication target. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Do not replicate the recovery point comprising entities from the storage co"].iregexp("Do not replicate the recovery point comprising entities from the storage co")}=1
trigger.name: Replication Of Deduped Entity
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Availability Zone Scope:kCluster Title:Snapshot has Entities from the Storage Container that have Deduplication Enabled Name:Replication Of Deduped Entity Message:Do not replicate the recovery point comprising entities from the storage container that have deduplication enabled to the recovery location : {availability_zone_physical_name}. Description:Snapshot contains entities from the storage container that have deduplication enabled. Description:Snapshot contains entities from the storage container that have deduplication enabled. Causes:A snapshot with entities from the storage container that have deduplication enabled was replicated to a single node backup or cloud recovery location. Resolution:Either disable the deduplication on the storage containers or use a multi-node AOS cluster as a replication target. Nutanix KB:
