trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Report generation failed for report [\S]* scheduled for [\S]*"].iregexp("Report generation failed for report [\S]* scheduled for [\S]*")}=1
trigger.name: Report Generation Failure
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Report Generation Failure Name:Report Generation Failure Message:Report generation failed for report {report_name} scheduled for {timestamp}. {reason} Description:Report Generation failed. Database may be down or cluster may have insufficient storage. Description:Report Generation failed. Database may be down or cluster may have insufficient storage. Causes:Cluster may have insufficient storage. Resolution:(A) Free the space by deleting older reports that have been generated. (B) Manually run the report instance scanner utility. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Report quota scan failed for the report [\S]* at [\S]*. {reas"].iregexp("Report quota scan failed for the report [\S]* at [\S]*. {reas")}=1
trigger.name: Report Quota Scan Failure
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Report Quota Scan Failure Name:Report Quota Scan Failure Message:Report quota scan failed for the report {report_name} at {timestamp}. {reason} Description:Report Quota scan failed. Cassandra might be unreachable. Description:Report Quota scan failed. Cassandra might be unreachable. Causes:Cassandra may not be reachable for some time. Resolution:Manually run the report instance scanner utility. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Pulse cannot connect to REST server endpoint https://insights.nutanix.com:4"].iregexp("Pulse cannot connect to REST server endpoint https://insights.nutanix.com:4")}=1
trigger.name: REST endpoint connection status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Pulse cannot connect to REST server endpoint Name:REST endpoint connection status Message:Pulse cannot connect to REST server endpoint https://insights.nutanix.com:443. Connection Status: {connection_status}, Pulse Enabled: {enable}, Error Message: {message} Description:Check if Pulse can connect to REST server endpoint https://insights.nutanix.com:443. Description:Check if Pulse can connect to REST server endpoint https://insights.nutanix.com:443. Causes:Pulse cannot connect to REST server endpoint https://insights.nutanix.com:443. Resolution:Ensure that the REST server endpoint https://insights.nutanix.com:443 is reachable from Pulse. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/5490

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Some entities became unprotected after restoring [\S]*. "].iregexp("Some entities became unprotected after restoring [\S]*. ")}=1
trigger.name: Restored Entities Protected
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:CVM-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Entities Restored But Unprotected Name:Restored Entities Protected Message:Some entities became unprotected after restoring {protection_domain_name}. Count: {num_entities}. Entity names: {entity_names}. Reason: {reason}. Description:Entities are restored but unprotected. Description:Entities are restored but unprotected. Causes:Some other protected entities conflict with the entities being recovered. Resolution:Resolve the stated reason for the failure. If you cannot resolve the error, contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Core dumps are enabled on the [\S]* with IP [\S]*."].iregexp("Core dumps are enabled on the [\S]* with IP [\S]*.")}=1
trigger.name: Saltstate coreoff check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator ControllerVM Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Node-Node Scope:kNode Title:Core dumps are enabled on this CVM or Prism Central VM. Name:Saltstate coreoff check Message:Core dumps are enabled on the {vm_type} with IP {service_vm_external_ip}. Description:Checks if saltstate is correctly set to default coreoff state to ensure services do not produce core dumps unnecessarily. Description:Checks if saltstate is correctly set to default coreoff state to ensure services do not produce core dumps unnecessarily. Causes:Core dumps are enabled for services running on this CVM or Prism Central VM. Resolution:Follow KB7586 to validate and fix coreoff saltstate. Resolution may involve graceful node reboot, so ensure the cluster is otherwise healthy and resiliency status is OK prior to this action. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/7586

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Samsung 863 or 863a on host [\S]* has configuration problems: {alert"].iregexp("Samsung 863 or 863a on host [\S]* has configuration problems: {alert")}=1
trigger.name: Samsung 863(a) Configuration
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Node-Disk Scope:kNode Title:Samsung 863 or 863a on {ip_address} has configuration problems. Name:Samsung 863(a) Configuration Message:Samsung 863 or 863a on host {ip_address} has configuration problems: {alert_msg}. Description:Check if node has supported configuration for Samsung 863 or 863a. Description:Check if node has supported configuration for Samsung 863 or 863a. Causes:Samsung 863 or 863a is not properly down-formatted. Resolution:Contact Nutanix support to replace with a new drive. Refer to the Nutanix documentation for instructions. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/2309

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["SAS cables missing or not properly connected on host."].iregexp("SAS cables missing or not properly connected on host.")}=1
trigger.name: SAS Connectivity
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Hardware Storage Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Host-Hardware Scope:kNode Title:SAS Connectivity Not Normal Name:SAS Connectivity Message:SAS cables missing or not properly connected on host. Description:Check SAS connectivity Description:Check SAS connectivity Causes:SAS cables are not properly connected. Resolution:Ensure that SAS cables are properly connected. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/2311

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["[\S]* [\S]* on host [\S]* has the follow"].iregexp("[\S]* [\S]* on host [\S]* has the follow")}=1
trigger.name: SATA controller
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Node-Disk Scope:kNode Title:SATA Controller status is bad. Name:SATA controller Message:{controller_type} {controller_instance} on host {ip_address} has the following problems: {alert_msg} Description:Check SATA controller ports Description:Check SATA controller ports Causes:The SATA controller is experiencing errors. Resolution:Review KB 2312. If required Contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/2312

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["SATA DOM on host [\S]* cannot be reached. The SATA DOM disconnection"].iregexp("SATA DOM on host [\S]* cannot be reached. The SATA DOM disconnection")}=1
trigger.name: SATADOM Connection Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Hardware Node Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Host-Disk Scope:kNode Title:SATA DOM not reachable. Name:SATADOM Connection Status Message:SATA DOM on host {ip_address} cannot be reached. The SATA DOM disconnection is determined by using sata dom information data: {data} Description:Checks that host SATA DOM is reachable. Description:Checks that host SATA DOM is reachable. Causes:SATA DOM has lost power connection. SATA DOM is not installed. Resolution:Check if SATA DOM is installed. Check the SATA DOM physical connection. Replace the SATA DOM as soon as possible. Refer to the Nutanix documentation for instructions. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1850

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["SATA DOM on host [\S]* has failed."].iregexp("SATA DOM on host [\S]* has failed.")}=1
trigger.name: SATADOM Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Hardware Node Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Host-Disk Scope:kNode Title:SATA DOM has failed. Name:SATADOM Status Message:SATA DOM on host {ip_address} has failed. Description:Checks that host SATA DOM is functioning. Description:Checks that host SATA DOM is functioning. Causes:SATA DOM has lost power connection. SATA DOM has failed. Resolution:Check the SATA DOM physical connection. Replace the SATA DOM as soon as possible. Refer to the Nutanix documentation for instructions. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1850

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Security Planning is disabled. Reason: [\S]*"].iregexp("Security Planning is disabled. Reason: [\S]*")}=1
trigger.name: Security Planning is disabled
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Security Planning is disabled Name:Security Planning is disabled Message:Security Planning is disabled. Reason: {details} Description:Security Planning is disabled due to de-registration of Prism Element from Prism Central. Description:Security Planning is disabled due to de-registration of Prism Element from Prism Central. Causes:The cluster that is hosting the Epoch data collector was de-registered from Prism Central. Resolution:Enable Security Planning from the Prism Central UI to deploy a new instance of the Epoch data collector. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["SED keys for one or more disks are not available from external key manager "].iregexp("SED keys for one or more disks are not available from external key manager ")}=1
trigger.name: SED Keys Unavailable
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability ControllerVM Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Services Scope:kNode Title:SED Keys Unavailable Name:SED Keys Unavailable Message:SED keys for one or more disks are not available from external key manager {kms_name}. Description:Check to see if the KMS actually has the expected passwords for the SED disks. Description:Check to see if the KMS actually has the expected passwords for the SED disks. Causes:If a 3rd party KMS gets restored from a backup or other incorrect management operation, it may have missing keys. Resolution:Contact Nutanix and 3rd party key manager support. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8223

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Self-encrypted Drive operation [\S]* has failed for disk [\S]* wi"].iregexp("Self-encrypted Drive operation [\S]* has failed for disk [\S]* wi")}=1
trigger.name: SED Operation Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator ControllerVM Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Disk Scope:kNode Title:Self-encrypting Drive Operation Failure Name:SED Operation Status Message:Self-encrypted Drive operation {operation} has failed for disk {disk_id} with serial {disk_serial} on node {service_vm_external_ip}. Description:Self-encrypting drive operation failure. Description:Self-encrypting drive operation failure. Causes:A self-encrypting drive operation could not be performed. Resolution:Retest key management server configuration to ensure connectivity and certificates are valid then retry the command. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Unable to '[\S]*' disk from VM '[\S]* (ID [\S]*)' due to '{reas"].iregexp("Unable to '[\S]*' disk from VM '[\S]* (ID [\S]*)' due to '{reas")}=1
trigger.name: Self service restore operation Failed
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Self service restore operation failed Name:Self service restore operation Failed Message:Unable to '{operation}' disk from VM '{vm_name} (ID {vm_id})' due to '{reason}'. Description:Self service restore operation failed Description:Self service restore operation failed Causes:(A) Snapshot disk could not be recovered. (B) Recovered disk could not be attached to the VM. (C) Self-service restore disk could not be detached from VM. Resolution:Resolve the stated reason for the failure. If you cannot resolve the error, contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Sending of report through E-mail failed for report [\S]*. [\S]*"].iregexp("Sending of report through E-mail failed for report [\S]*. [\S]*")}=1
trigger.name: Send Report Through E-mail Failure
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Send Report Through E-mail Failure Name:Send Report Through E-mail Failure Message:Sending of report through E-mail failed for report {report_name}. {reason} Description:Sending of report through E-mail failed. SMTP might be down or report might have been deleted. Description:Sending of report through E-mail failed. SMTP might be down or report might have been deleted. Causes:(A) SMTP server might be unreachable or might not have been configured. (B) Generated report may have been deleted. Resolution:Check the SMTP configuration and ensure that its reachable. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["ID Firewall service account [\S]* is invalid. Details: {detail"].iregexp("ID Firewall service account [\S]* is invalid. Details: {detail")}=1
trigger.name: Service account used for ID Firewall is invalid
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability Cluster Network Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:CVM-Network Scope:kCluster Title:ID Firewall service account is invalid Name:Service account used for ID Firewall is invalid Message:ID Firewall service account {account}@{domain} is invalid. Details: {details}. Description:ID Firewall has detected that the service account configured is not valid. Description:ID Firewall has detected that the service account configured is not valid. Causes:The service account password may have been changed. The service account may have been deleted. Resolution:Check that the configured service account password is up-to-date and update it in Prism if needed. Check that the configured service account exists, and update it in Prism if needed. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Possible degradation of [\S]* instances on the Controller VM IDs {"].iregexp("Possible degradation of [\S]* instances on the Controller VM IDs {")}=1
trigger.name: Service instances receiving bad degraded node scores
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:CVM-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Possible Service Degradation. Name:Service instances receiving bad degraded node scores Message:Possible degradation of {service_name} instances on the Controller VM IDs {service_vm_id_list}. Description:Service instances on a few nodes of the cluster are possibly in a bad state. Description:Service instances on a few nodes of the cluster are possibly in a bad state. Causes:Various Resolution:Follow KB9390 to troubleshoot reasons for the service receiving bad scores. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/9390

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Utilization on [\S]* on file server [\S]* has reached t"].iregexp("Utilization on [\S]* on file server [\S]* has reached t")}=1
trigger.name: Share Utilization Reached Configured Limit
trigger.description: Category Type: Capacity NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:Share utilization reached configured limit Name:Share Utilization Reached Configured Limit Message:Utilization on {share_name} on file server {file_server_name} has reached the configured limit Description:Share is no longer writeable. Description:Share is no longer writeable. Causes:Share utilization reached its configured limit Resolution:Expand File Server storage size. Refer to KB article 8475 for more details. Contact Nutanix support if issue still persists or assistance needed. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8475

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["File server compatibility check skipped"].iregexp("File server compatibility check skipped")}=1
trigger.name: Skipped File Server Compatibility Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator NutanixFiles Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:File server-Services Scope:kCluster Title:File server compatibility check skipped Name:Skipped File Server Compatibility Check Message:File server compatibility check skipped Description:File server compatibility check skipped Description:File server compatibility check skipped Causes:File server compatibility check was skipped during AOS upgrade Resolution:Upgrade file server to the latest. Please refer Software Product Interoperability page on portal for reference. Contact Nutanix support if issue still persists or assistance needed. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to send email from Controller VM [\S]* due to error: [\S]*."].iregexp("Failed to send email from Controller VM [\S]* due to error: [\S]*.")}=1
trigger.name: SMTP Configuration
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:CVM-Network Scope:kCluster Title:SMTP Error Name:SMTP Configuration Message:Failed to send email from Controller VM {ip_address} due to error: {error}. Description:Failed to send Pulse and/or alert emails to Nutanix support with the current configuration. Description:Failed to send Pulse and/or alert emails to Nutanix support with the current configuration. Causes:SMTP server may not be configured. The SMTP server is not reachable from the Controller VM. Firewall is preventing emails from being forwarded through the SMTP server. Resolution:Configure the SMTP server. SMTP server should be reachable. Ensure that the firewalls allow the cluster to send email messages through the Nutanix SMTP servers (nsc01.nutanix.net and nsc02.nutanix.net) on port 80. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1638

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Snapshot chain height has exceeded the threshold limit."].iregexp("Snapshot chain height has exceeded the threshold limit.")}=1
trigger.name: Snapshot chain height check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Snapshot chain height exceeds threshold Name:Snapshot chain height check Message:Snapshot chain height has exceeded the threshold limit. Description:Check that snapshot chain height is less than 25 Description:Check that snapshot chain height is less than 25 Causes:Snapshot chain height exceeds threshold of 25. Resolution:Review KB 1732. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1732

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to create an application-consistent snapshot for one or more VMs in "].iregexp("Failed to create an application-consistent snapshot for one or more VMs in ")}=1
trigger.name: Snapshot Crash Consistent
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Snapshot Partially Crash Consistent Name:Snapshot Crash Consistent Message:Failed to create an application-consistent snapshot for one or more VMs in snapshot {snapshot_name} of protection domain {protection_domain_name}. A crash-consistent snapshot has been created for these VMs instead. Description:Snapshot partially crash consistent. Description:Snapshot partially crash consistent. Causes:VSS or hypervisor error Resolution:No action is necessary if this issue is intermittent. If this error persists, contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Protection Domain [\S]* might have symlinks that have be"].iregexp("Protection Domain [\S]* might have symlinks that have be")}=1
trigger.name: Snapshot Symlink Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Protection Domain might have symlinks. Name:Snapshot Symlink Check Message:Protection Domain {protection_domain_name} might have symlinks that have been skipped in the snapshot. Description:Protection domain snapshot has symlinks. Description:Protection domain snapshot has symlinks. Causes:The protection domain might have symlinks that have been skipped in the snapshot. Resolution:Delete the symlinks or protect the entities individually. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Space reservation configured on vdisk [\S]* belonging to Storage Con"].iregexp("Space reservation configured on vdisk [\S]* belonging to Storage Con")}=1
trigger.name: Space Reservation Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Storage Affected Entity Type:container Subcategory Type:CVM-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:Space Reservation Violated Name:Space Reservation Status Message:Space reservation configured on vdisk {vdisk_name} belonging to Storage Container id {container_id} could not be honored due to insufficient disk space resulting from a possible disk or node failure. Description:Space reservation violated. Description:Space reservation violated. Causes:A drive or a node has failed. Resolution:Change space reservations to total less than 90% of the available storage, and replace the drive or node as soon as possible. Refer to the Nutanix documentation for instructions. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["SSD [\S]* for [\S]* are having await time greater than [\S]*"].iregexp("SSD [\S]* for [\S]* are having await time greater than [\S]*")}=1
trigger.name: SSD IO Latency
trigger.description: Category Type: Performance Hardware Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Node Scope:kNode Title:Checks SSD latency threshold Name:SSD IO Latency Message:SSD {ssd_list} for {svm_ip} are having await time greater than {threshold} Description:Checks whether the system load average is high. Description:Checks whether the system load average is high. Causes:There may be too many VMs on one host. Resolution:Redistribute VMs to reduce load on the affected Controller VM. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1582

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["A stale VM [\S]* with ID([\S]*, [\S]*) against VM"].iregexp("A stale VM [\S]* with ID([\S]*, [\S]*) against VM")}=1
trigger.name: Stale VM present in the DR system
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:vm Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Virtual Machine Scope:kCluster Title:Stale VM present in DR system Name:Stale VM present in the DR system Message:A stale VM {stale_vm_name} with ID({stale_vm_hs_id}, {vm_ha_id}) against VM {vm_name} with ID({vm_hs_id}, {vm_ha_id}). Please unprotect the stale VM entry {protection_information}. Description:A stale VM in the DR protection conflicts with the live VM Description:A stale VM in the DR protection conflicts with the live VM Causes:An in-place restore workflow might have been performed on the VM by backup software resulting in newly created VM with the same Nutanix ID Resolution:Please unprotect the stale VM and if needed, protect the restored VM. If the issue still persists contact Nutanix Support Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/10545

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Stargate on Controller VM [\S]* is down for [\S]* seconds."].iregexp("Stargate on Controller VM [\S]* is down for [\S]* seconds.")}=1
trigger.name: Stargate Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator ControllerVM Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Services Scope:kNode Title:Stargate Temporarily Down Name:Stargate Status Message:Stargate on Controller VM {ip_address} is down for {downtime} seconds. Description:Stargate Temporarily Down. Description:Stargate Temporarily Down. Causes:Zookeeper service not running. Cassandra service not running. Stargate keeps timing out during restart. Resolution:If CVM node running the zeus service was powered off, power it on. Otherwise contact Nutanix support. Contact Nutanix support. Contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/3784

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Storage container(s) [\S]* for protection domain [\S]*"].iregexp("Storage container(s) [\S]* for protection domain [\S]*")}=1
trigger.name: Storage Container Mount Configuration
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability Cluster Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Storage Container(s) is/are not mounted on all nodes. Name:Storage Container Mount Configuration Message:Storage container(s) {unmounted_containers} for protection domain {pd_name} is/are not mounted on all nodes. Description:Verify that the Storage Container(s) is/are mounted on all nodes. Description:Verify that the Storage Container(s) is/are mounted on all nodes. Causes:Storage Container(s) is/are not mounted on all nodes. Resolution:Mount the Storage Container(s) on all nodes. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1888

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Replication factor of [\S]* on Storage Container {container_na"].iregexp("Replication factor of [\S]* on Storage Container {container_na")}=1
trigger.name: Storage Container RF Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Storage Affected Entity Type:container Subcategory Type:Cluster-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:Storage Container Replication Factor Low Name:Storage Container RF Status Message:Replication factor of {container_region} on Storage Container {container_name} is set to 1. Description:Check that the Storage Container region replication factor is not low Description:Check that the Storage Container region replication factor is not low Causes:Replication factor on the Storage Container was changed to 1. Resolution:Change the replication factor on the Storage Container with the nCLI command "container edit name='ctr_name' rf='2'" (or higher if appropriate for your environment). Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/2487

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Flash Mode configuration with Multiple Storage Pools detected."].iregexp("Flash Mode configuration with Multiple Storage Pools detected.")}=1
trigger.name: Storage Pool Flash Mode Configuration
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Storage Affected Entity Type:storage_pool Subcategory Type:Cluster-Disk Scope:kCluster Title:Storage Pool Flash Mode Configuration Name:Storage Pool Flash Mode Configuration Message:Flash Mode configuration with Multiple Storage Pools detected. Description:Flash Mode is not supported when multiple storage pools are in use. Description:Flash Mode is not supported when multiple storage pools are in use. Causes:Multiple Storage Pools and Flash Mode are in use together. Resolution:Disable Flash Mode for all VMs and Volume Groups, or consolidate all Storage Pools into one. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/3671

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Storage Pool space usage for [\S]* is at [\S]*%. {alert"].iregexp("Storage Pool space usage for [\S]* is at [\S]*%. {alert")}=1
trigger.name: StoragePool Space Usage
trigger.description: Category Type: Capacity Storage Affected Entity Type:storage_pool Subcategory Type:Cluster-Storage Capacity Scope:kCluster Title:Storage Pool Space Usage Exceeded the Configured Threshold Name:StoragePool Space Usage Message:Storage Pool space usage for {storage_pool_name} is at {usage_pct}%. {alert_msg} Description:Checks the storage pool space usage to determine if it's above the threshold Description:Checks the storage pool space usage to determine if it's above the threshold Causes:Space usage in the storage pool has exceeded the configured threshold. Resolution:Add more storage to the cluster or delete data to free up storage space. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/2475

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Cluster with compute-only nodes should have min of 4 hyperconverged nodes"].iregexp("Cluster with compute-only nodes should have min of 4 hyperconverged nodes")}=1
trigger.name: Suggest min 4 HC nodes when using CO node(s)
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Compute-only cluster sizing: hyperconverged node count check Name:Suggest min 4 HC nodes when using CO node(s) Message:Cluster with compute-only nodes should have min of 4 hyperconverged nodes Description:Check that cluster with compute-only nodes has at least 4 hyperconverged nodes. Description:Check that cluster with compute-only nodes has at least 4 hyperconverged nodes. Causes:Compute-only node was added to a cluster with fewer than 4 hyperconverged nodes. Resolution:Remove all compute-only nodes from cluster or add additional hyperconverged nodes. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/7012

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["SW encryption keys for one or more containers are not available from extern"].iregexp("SW encryption keys for one or more containers are not available from extern")}=1
trigger.name: SW Encryption Keys Unavailable
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:SW Encryption Keys from {kms_name} are unavailable Name:SW Encryption Keys Unavailable Message:SW encryption keys for one or more containers are not available from external key manager {kms_name}. Description:Check to see if the KMS actually has the expected passwords for the container encryption keys. Description:Check to see if the KMS actually has the expected passwords for the container encryption keys. Causes:If a 3rd party KMS gets restored from a backup or other incorrect management operation, it may have missing keys. Resolution:Contact Nutanix and 3rd party key manager support. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8223

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Synchronous replication is not supported on the VM [\S]*. Reason: {mess"].iregexp("Synchronous replication is not supported on the VM [\S]*. Reason: {mess")}=1
trigger.name: Synchronous Replication is not supported on the VM
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:vm Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Virtual Machine Scope:kCluster Title:Synchronous Replication is not supported on the VM Name:Synchronous Replication is not supported on the VM Message:Synchronous replication is not supported on the VM {vm_name}. Reason: {message} Description:Synchronous Replication is not supported on the VM Description:Synchronous Replication is not supported on the VM Causes:VM has disks that are backed by a datasource external to the AOS cluster. Resolution:Enable background storage migration on the disk backed by external datasource to complete the seeding. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/11344

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Disk space usage for [\S]* on [\S]* [\S]* has exceeded {th"].iregexp("Disk space usage for [\S]* on [\S]* [\S]* has exceeded {th")}=1
trigger.name: System audit volume usage
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Storage Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Disk Scope:kNode Title:System Audit Volume Space Usage High Name:System audit volume usage Message:Disk space usage for {mount_path} on {entity} {ip_address} has exceeded {threshold}%. Description:Checks if CVM system audit volume usage is within threshold to ensure uninterrupted operations. Description:Checks if CVM system audit volume usage is within threshold to ensure uninterrupted operations. Causes:Increased CVM system audit volume usage due to excessive logging, or miscellaneous files being placed inside. Resolution:Remove files other than audit.log* from /home/log/audit. If unsure, please engage Nutanix Support for assistance. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1523

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["System has down-migrated the data of flash-mode-enabled vDisks."].iregexp("System has down-migrated the data of flash-mode-enabled vDisks.")}=1
trigger.name: System Defined Flash Mode Usage Limit
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Storage Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Disk Scope:kCluster Title:System-Defined Flash Mode Usage Limit Exceeded Name:System Defined Flash Mode Usage Limit Message:System has down-migrated the data of flash-mode-enabled vDisks. Description:Check that usage for flash-mode-enabled vDisks is within system limits. Description:Check that usage for flash-mode-enabled vDisks is within system limits. Causes:Too many vDisks are assigned to the flash tier, or the vDisks assigned to the flash tier are too large. Resolution:Reduce the number of flash-mode-enabled vDisks or increase the capacity of the flash tier. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["System temperature exceeded threshold on Controller VM [\S]*. Curret"].iregexp("System temperature exceeded threshold on Controller VM [\S]*. Curret")}=1
trigger.name: System Temperature
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Hardware Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Host-Hardware Scope:kNode Title:System Temperature High Name:System Temperature Message:System temperature exceeded threshold on Controller VM {ip_address}. Curret sensor value {temperature}C Description:Checks if the system temperature is not high. Description:Checks if the system temperature is not high. Causes:The device is overheating to the point of imminent failure. Resolution:Ensure that the fans in the block are functioning properly and that the environment is cool enough. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1524

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to fetch system temperature on Controller VM [\S]*"].iregexp("Failed to fetch system temperature on Controller VM [\S]*")}=1
trigger.name: System Temperature Fetch
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Hardware Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Host-Hardware Scope:kNode Title:System Temperature Reading Error Name:System Temperature Fetch Message:Failed to fetch system temperature on Controller VM {ip_address} Description:Check that System temperature can be fetched. Description:Check that System temperature can be fetched. Causes:System temperature sensor may be unstable or BMC firmware may be reporting temperature inaccurately. Resolution:Check BMC SEL log. If System temperature in SEL log is 0, check System temperature sensor. If System temperature in SEL is not 0, ensure that the BMC firmware version is correct. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1524

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["System temperature is below threshold on Controller VM [\S]*. Curren"].iregexp("System temperature is below threshold on Controller VM [\S]*. Curren")}=1
trigger.name: System Temperature Low
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability Hardware Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Host-Hardware Scope:kNode Title:System Temperature Low Name:System Temperature Low Message:System temperature is below threshold on Controller VM {ip_address}. Current sensor value is {temperature}C Description:Check that system temperature is not low Description:Check that system temperature is not low Causes:BMC or the sensor on chassis may have problem Resolution:Do BMC factory default. If the problem still persists, replace the chassis. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1524

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["CVM NIC Speed Low"].iregexp("CVM NIC Speed Low")}=1
trigger.name: TenGig Adaptor Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator ControllerVM Network Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Host-Network Scope:kNode Title:CVM NIC Speed Low Name:TenGig Adaptor Status Message:{alert_msg} Description:Checks whether CVM is uplinked to 10GbE NIC. Description:Checks whether CVM is uplinked to 10GbE NIC. Causes:CVM not uplinked to 10GbE NIC. 1GbE NIC is part of the bond. If hypervisor is ESXi, it may be in lockdown. Resolution:Check network configuration. Please refer to KB 1584. Check network configuration. If hypervisor is ESXi, check for Lockdown Mode enabled and disable the configuration. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1584

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Synchronous Replication is enabled for the entity [\S]* but cluster {cl"].iregexp("Synchronous Replication is enabled for the entity [\S]* but cluster {cl")}=1
trigger.name: The cluster does not support the live migration of synchronously replicated entities
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Virtual Machine Scope:kCluster Title:Cluster does not support the live migration of synchronously replicated entities. Name:The cluster does not support the live migration of synchronously replicated entities Message:Synchronous Replication is enabled for the entity {vm_name} but cluster {cluster_name} does not support live migration. Description:Cluster does not support the live migration of synchronously replicated entities. Description:Cluster does not support the live migration of synchronously replicated entities. Causes:The cluster does not support the live migration of synchronously replicated entities. Resolution:Please upgrade the source and target clusters to version 5.19 or later. It is recommended to have source and target clusters on the same version. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Time differs between Controller VMs."].iregexp("Time differs between Controller VMs.")}=1
trigger.name: Time Drift Check
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Network Scope:kCluster Title:CVM Time Difference High Name:Time Drift Check Message:Time differs between Controller VMs. Description:Checks whether CVM times match. Description:Checks whether CVM times match. Causes:Timedrift between CVMs is high. NTP connectivity may be lost. Resolution:Check NTP/network configuration or connectivity. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1512

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Tomcat is restarting frequently on [\S]*. Reason: [\S]*."].iregexp("Tomcat is restarting frequently on [\S]*. Reason: [\S]*.")}=1
trigger.name: Tomcat Frequent Restart
trigger.description: Category Type: ControllerVM SystemIndicator Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:CVM-Services Scope:kNode Title:Tomcat is restarting frequently. Name:Tomcat Frequent Restart Message:Tomcat is restarting frequently on {cvm_ip}. Reason: {message}. Description:Tomcat is restarting frequently. Description:Tomcat is restarting frequently. Causes:Tomcat is restarting frequently, please check prism, prism_monitor and catalina logs for exact cause of failure. Resolution:Check the logs for error information or contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8524

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Two node cluster state change: [\S]*"].iregexp("Two node cluster state change: [\S]*")}=1
trigger.name: Two node cluster changed now in stand-alone mode
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:CVM-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Two node cluster state change to stand-alone mode Name:Two node cluster changed now in stand-alone mode Message:Two node cluster state change: {message} Description:Change in state of two node cluster Description:Change in state of two node cluster Causes:There is a change in availability of a node (or network between the nodes). This event was planned. Resolution:Two node cluster will auto-heal when the planned event is completed successfully. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Unable to retrieve translated addresses in NGT because the Prism Element ID"].iregexp("Unable to retrieve translated addresses in NGT because the Prism Element ID")}=1
trigger.name: Unable to get translated addresses in NGT
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Insights DB Scope:kCluster Title:Translated Addresses Retrieval Failure in NGT Name:Unable to get translated addresses in NGT Message:Unable to retrieve translated addresses in NGT because the Prism Element IDF service may be unreachable. Description:NGT is unable to retrieve the XAT address translations. Description:NGT is unable to retrieve the XAT address translations. Causes:(A) Prism Element IDF may be unreachable. (B) Translation information is not available in IDF. Resolution:Check if the Prism Element IDF service is reachable. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to deallocate unassociated floating IPs [\S]* after "].iregexp("Failed to deallocate unassociated floating IPs [\S]* after ")}=1
trigger.name: Unassociated Floating IPs Deallocation Failure after Failback from Xi.
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Recovery Plan Scope:kCluster Title:Floating IPs Deallocation Failed after Failback from Xi. Name:Unassociated Floating IPs Deallocation Failure after Failback from Xi. Message:Failed to deallocate unassociated floating IPs {failed_floating_ips} after failback from Xi that were earlier dynamically created, for {operation_type} on the Recovery Plan {recovery_plan_name}. Description:Failed to deallocate unassociated floating IPs after failback from Xi that were earlier dynamically created. Description:Failed to deallocate unassociated floating IPs after failback from Xi that were earlier dynamically created. Causes:The floating IPs might be in use. Resolution:If you are not using the floating IPs, deallocate them manually. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Unsupported SFP is installed on host machine [\S]*: [\S]*"].iregexp("Unsupported SFP is installed on host machine [\S]*: [\S]*")}=1
trigger.name: Unsupported SFP message Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Node Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Node-Network Scope:kNode Title:Unsupported SFP is installed on host machine Name:Unsupported SFP message Check Message:Unsupported SFP is installed on host machine {host_ip}: {alert_msg} Description:Check if an unsupported SFP is plugged in Description:Check if an unsupported SFP is plugged in Causes:An unsupported SFP is plugged in. Resolution:Remove the unsupported SFP Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/6212

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Error in updating Metro Availability failure handling for the protection do"].iregexp("Error in updating Metro Availability failure handling for the protection do")}=1
trigger.name: Updating Metro Failure Handling Failed
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Data Protection-Remote Site Scope:kCluster Title:Failed to update Metro Availability failure handling Name:Updating Metro Failure Handling Failed Message:Error in updating Metro Availability failure handling for the protection domain '{protection_domain_name}' to the remote site '{remote_name}'. Reason: '{reason}'. Description:Error in updating failure-handling on Metro Availability protection domain. Description:Error in updating failure-handling on Metro Availability protection domain. Causes:Failed to update Metro Availibility Failure Handling due to possible network error Resolution:Resolve network issues. If the issue persists contact Nutanix Support Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8480

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Error in updating Metro Availability failure handling on the remote site '{"].iregexp("Error in updating Metro Availability failure handling on the remote site '{")}=1
trigger.name: Updating Metro Failure Handling Remote Failed
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Data Protection-Remote Site Scope:kCluster Title:Failed to update Metro Availability failure handling on the remote site Name:Updating Metro Failure Handling Remote Failed Message:Error in updating Metro Availability failure handling on the remote site '{remote_name}' for the protection domain '{protection_domain_name}'. Reason: '{reason}'. Description:Error in updating failure handling on the remote Metro Availability protection domain Description:Error in updating failure handling on the remote Metro Availability protection domain Causes:Failed to update Metro Availibility Failure Handling due to possible network error Resolution:Resolve any network related issues. If issue persists contact Nutanix Support Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8481

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Validation failed with errors for the Recovery Plan [\S]*."].iregexp("Validation failed with errors for the Recovery Plan [\S]*.")}=1
trigger.name: Validation Failed For Recovery Plan with Errors
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability DR Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Recovery Plan Scope:kCluster Title:Recovery Plan Validation Failed With Errors Name:Validation Failed For Recovery Plan with Errors Message:Validation failed with errors for the Recovery Plan {recovery_plan_name}. Description:Recovery Plan validation failed with errors. Description:Recovery Plan validation failed with errors. Causes:There might be various reasons for this issue. Resolution:Review the Recovery Plan execution report for detailed step by step information on the recovery plan execution and failures. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8276

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Validation failed with warnings for the Recovery Plan [\S]*."].iregexp("Validation failed with warnings for the Recovery Plan [\S]*.")}=1
trigger.name: Validation Failed For Recovery Plan with Warnings
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration DR Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Recovery Plan Scope:kCluster Title:Recovery Plan Validation Failed with Warnings Name:Validation Failed For Recovery Plan with Warnings Message:Validation failed with warnings for the Recovery Plan {recovery_plan_name}. Description:Recovery Plan validation failed with warnings. Description:Recovery Plan validation failed with warnings. Causes:There might be various reasons for this issue. Resolution:Review the Recovery Plan execution report for detailed step by step information on the recovery plan execution and failures. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Number of [\S]* in the cluster is above the threshold ([\S]*"].iregexp("Number of [\S]* in the cluster is above the threshold ([\S]*")}=1
trigger.name: vDisk Count Check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:High vDisk count in the cluster Name:vDisk Count Check Message:Number of {vdisk_type} in the cluster is above the threshold ({vdisk_count}/{vdisk_threshold}) Description:Checks for high vDisk count in the cluster. Description:Checks for high vDisk count in the cluster. Causes:Aggressive replication/snapshot schedules may generate large number of vDisks on the remote site Resolution:Immediately contact Nutanix support for assistance Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/1624

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["[\S]* Virtual IP is configured but unreachable."].iregexp("[\S]* Virtual IP is configured but unreachable.")}=1
trigger.name: Virtual IP check
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Cluster Affected Entity Type:host Subcategory Type:Node-Services Scope:kNode Title:Virtual IP Check Name:Virtual IP check Message:{vm_type} Virtual IP is configured but unreachable. Description:Check if virtual IP is configured and reachable. Description:Check if virtual IP is configured and reachable. Causes:Cluster virtual IP is not configured. Cluster services are down or cluster is not started yet. Resolution:Configure a valid virtual IP for the cluster. Verify that all cluster services are up. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/3708

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Unable to host virtual IP address [\S]*."].iregexp("Unable to host virtual IP address [\S]*.")}=1
trigger.name: Virtual IP Configuration
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:CVM-Network Scope:kCluster Title:IP Address Not Hosted Name:Virtual IP Configuration Message:Unable to host virtual IP address {ip_address}. Description:IP address is not hosted. Description:IP address is not hosted. Causes:The network configuration is incorrect. Resolution:Contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Virtual IP address is not configured on the cluster [\S]*. Protect"].iregexp("Virtual IP address is not configured on the cluster [\S]*. Protect")}=1
trigger.name: Virtual IP not set on Cluster
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Cluster Scope:kCluster Title:Virtual IP Address not Configured on the Cluster. Name:Virtual IP not set on Cluster Message:Virtual IP address is not configured on the cluster {cluster_name}. Protection and replication of VMs will be affected. Description:Virtual IP address is not configured on the cluster. Description:Virtual IP address is not configured on the cluster. Causes:Virtual IP address has not been configured on the cluster. Resolution:Configure the virtual IP address on the cluster. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Virtual Switch [\S]* configuration deployment on Host(s):'[\S]*' "].iregexp("Virtual Switch [\S]* configuration deployment on Host(s):'[\S]*' ")}=1
trigger.name: Virtual Switch configuration deployment failed
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration Node Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Host-Network Scope:kCluster Title:Virtual Switch configuration deployment failed. Name:Virtual Switch configuration deployment failed Message:Virtual Switch {vs_name} configuration deployment on Host(s):'{node_uuid}' failed due to the reason: {cause} Description:Notifies when a validated Virtual Switch configuration is unable to be applied to host network infrastructure Description:Notifies when a validated Virtual Switch configuration is unable to be applied to host network infrastructure Causes:Unable to communicate with one or more host(s) to apply the configuration change. Lost connectivity while applying the Virtual Switch configuration. OVS did not accept or apply the requested configuration change. Unexpected error with service(s) required for Virtual Switch configuration change (Acropolis, Genesis, IDF, Prism Gateway). Resolution:Ensure all hosts are up and reachable by all CVMs. Ensure the external network is properly configured to retain connectivity using the applied Virtual Switch configuration. Review the alert message and affected host OVS log files for further details. Review the alert message and related service Acropolis and Genesis log files for further details. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/9406

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["VM group [\S]* snapshot and current state mismatch: [\S]*"].iregexp("VM group [\S]* snapshot and current state mismatch: [\S]*")}=1
trigger.name: VM group snapshot and current mismatch
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator Node Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:VM Group Snapshot and Current State Mismatch Name:VM group snapshot and current mismatch Message:VM group {vm_group_uuid} snapshot and current state mismatch: {message} Description:Check that snapshot to restore matches current VM group Description:Check that snapshot to restore matches current VM group Causes:VM group changed after snapshot was created. Resolution:Recreate VM snapshot to ensure up-to-date VM group information. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Could not restore VM High Availability."].iregexp("Could not restore VM High Availability.")}=1
trigger.name: VM HA Healing Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator GuestVM Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:CVM-Hardware Scope:kCluster Title:HA Healing Failure Name:VM HA Healing Status Message:Could not restore VM High Availability. Description:HA healing failure. Description:HA healing failure. Causes:Not enough memory/CPU resources within the cluster. Resolution:Shut down unneeded VMs to free cluster resources, expand the cluster to add resources, or disable protection against host failures. VMs cannot be powered on or migrated until the system has sufficient resources to protect against the configured number of host failures. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to migrate VM: '[\S]*' as the user may have manually powered ON "].iregexp("Failed to migrate VM: '[\S]*' as the user may have manually powered ON ")}=1
trigger.name: VM Migration Failed
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:vm Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Virtual Machine Scope:kCluster Title:VM Migration Failed Name:VM Migration Failed Message:Failed to migrate VM: '{vm_name}' as the user may have manually powered ON the VM on the source after migration process powered it off or due to an internal error. Description:VM Migration Failed. Description:VM Migration Failed. Causes:User may have manually powered ON the VM on the source after migration process powered it off. Resolution:Retry the VM Migration operation. If this situation persists, contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8520

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Restore of the protected VM [\S]* will fail due to VM name containing r"].iregexp("Restore of the protected VM [\S]* will fail due to VM name containing r")}=1
trigger.name: VM name does not meet requirements.
trigger.description: Category Type: Affected Entity Type:vm Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Protected VM Name Too Long or Contains Restricted Characters. Name:VM name does not meet requirements. Message:Restore of the protected VM {vm_name} will fail due to VM name containing restricted characters or VM name exceeding the character limit. Description:Check if the protected VM name is either too long, or contains restricted characters. Description:Check if the protected VM name is either too long, or contains restricted characters. Causes:VM name is either too long (longer than 80 characters) or contains restricted characters. Restricted characters include [, ], ?, *, ", ', ,. Resolution:Rename the VM. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/6097

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Nutanix VSS is enabled but Nutanix Guest Tools is not installed on the VM {"].iregexp("Nutanix VSS is enabled but Nutanix Guest Tools is not installed on the VM {")}=1
trigger.name: VM NGT Configuration
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:vm Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Virtual Machine Scope:kCluster Title:Nutanix Guest Tools Not Installed on the VM Name:VM NGT Configuration Message:Nutanix VSS is enabled but Nutanix Guest Tools is not installed on the VM {vm_name}. Description:Nutanix Guest Tools not installed. Description:Nutanix Guest Tools not installed. Causes:Nutanix VSS is enabled but Nutanix Guest Tools is not installed on the VM. Resolution:Install Nutanix Guest Tools on the guest VM. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["VM [\S]* is running from the VMware snapshots. Recovery of the VM from "].iregexp("VM [\S]* is running from the VMware snapshots. Recovery of the VM from ")}=1
trigger.name: VM Not Recoverable
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:vm Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Virtual Machine Scope:kCluster Title:Protected VM Not Recoverable Name:VM Not Recoverable Message:VM {vm_name} is running from the VMware snapshots. Recovery of the VM from the Recovery Point created at {recovery_point_create_time} UTC may not succeed. Manual intervention is required to bootup the VM. Description:Protected VM may not be recoverable. Description:Protected VM may not be recoverable. Causes:Protected VM is running from the VMware snapshot and may not be recoverable. Resolution:Ensure that the VM is not running from the VMware snapshot at the time of scheduled Recovery Point. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to apply protection policy '[\S]*' on the VM '{vm_n"].iregexp("Failed to apply protection policy '[\S]*' on the VM '{vm_n")}=1
trigger.name: VM Protection Failed
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Internal Scope:kCluster Title:VM Protection Failed Name:VM Protection Failed Message:Failed to apply protection policy '{protection_rule_name}' on the VM '{vm_name}' because '{reason}' Description:Failed to protect the VM by using the defined Protection Policy. Description:Failed to protect the VM by using the defined Protection Policy. Causes:VM is already protected in a legacy protection domain. Cluster hosting the VM does not support VM in multiple schedules or replication to more than one target site. (A) VM has volume group attachments. (B) VM is CBR incapable. (C) Source or the target cluster does not support replication within the same Availability Zone. Resolution:Unprotect the VM from the Protection Domain to protect it using Entity Centric Workflow (Leap). Upgrade cluster to version 5.19 or above. Resolve the stated reason for the failure. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8472

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to protect VM: '[\S]*', because of '[\S]*'."].iregexp("Failed to protect VM: '[\S]*', because of '[\S]*'.")}=1
trigger.name: VM Protection Failed
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:vm Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Virtual Machine Scope:kCluster Title:VM Protection Failed. Name:VM Protection Failed Message:Failed to protect VM: '{vm_name}', because of '{reason}'. Description:VM protection failed. Description:VM protection failed. Causes:Nutanix Data Protection service error. Resolution:VM protection will get retriggered. In case if this situation persists, please contact nutanix support. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8281

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["After recovery to remote availability zone [\S]*,"].iregexp("After recovery to remote availability zone [\S]*,")}=1
trigger.name: VM Protection Might Fail Post Recovery
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:vm Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Virtual Machine Scope:kCluster Title:VM Protection Might Fail Post Recovery Name:VM Protection Might Fail Post Recovery Message:After recovery to remote availability zone {remote_availability_zone_name}, VM protection might fail because remote cluster {remote_cluster_name} does not support multisite protection. Description:VM Protection Might Fail Post Recovery Description:VM Protection Might Fail Post Recovery Causes:The remote cluster to which replication is happening does not support multisite protection. Resolution:Upgrade the remote Prism Element to AOS 5.19 or above, which supports multisite protection. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["The following files of the VM [\S]* conflict with the files present"].iregexp("The following files of the VM [\S]* conflict with the files present")}=1
trigger.name: VM Recovered at Alternate Path
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:vm Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Virtual Machine Scope:kCluster Title:VM has been Recovered at an Alternate Path Name:VM Recovered at Alternate Path Message:The following files of the VM {old_vm_name} conflict with the files present on the target: {conflicting_file_paths}. The VM {new_vm_name} has been restored at an alternate path by adding the prefix '{path_prefix}' after the container name to its file paths. Description:VM has been Recovered at an Alternate Path Description:VM has been Recovered at an Alternate Path Causes:Existing VM files conflict with the VM files that you are recovering. Resolution:The VM containing the conflicting files has been recovered at an alternate path. Clean up the conflicting stale files. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["VM [\S]* may not start on the recovery location '{availability_zone_nam"].iregexp("VM [\S]* may not start on the recovery location '{availability_zone_nam")}=1
trigger.name: VM Recovery May Fail
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Cluster-Services Scope:kCluster Title:VM Recovery May Fail Name:VM Recovery May Fail Message:VM {vm_name} may not start on the recovery location '{availability_zone_name}' Description:VM may not start on the recovery location. Description:VM may not start on the recovery location. Causes:Primary and Remote locations are on different hypervisors and VM does not have NGT information. VM uses vNUMA. Cannot recover vNUMA VMs on Xi. Resolution:Install NGT on the VM (if not already installed). Don't replicate VMs which use vNUMA to Xi. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to capture the Recovery Point for VM '[\S]*'."].iregexp("Failed to capture the Recovery Point for VM '[\S]*'.")}=1
trigger.name: VM Recovery Point Failed
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:vm Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Virtual Machine Scope:kCluster Title:VM Recovery Point Creation Failed. Name:VM Recovery Point Failed Message:Failed to capture the Recovery Point for VM '{vm_name}'. Description:VM Recovery Point creation failed. Description:VM Recovery Point creation failed. Causes:Nutanix Data Protection service error. Resolution:Retry the VM Recovery Point operation. If issue persists please contact Nutanix Support. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Replication of the Recovery Point created at [\S]* U"].iregexp("Replication of the Recovery Point created at [\S]* U")}=1
trigger.name: VM Recovery Point Replication Stuck
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:vm Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Virtual Machine Scope:kCluster Title:VM Replication has not progressed. Name:VM Recovery Point Replication Stuck Message:Replication of the Recovery Point created at {recovery_point_create_time} UTC for VM {vm_name} to Recovery Location {az_name} has not made any progress in last one hour. Description:Replication of the VM has not progressed. Description:Replication of the VM has not progressed. Causes:Network Connectivity issues between the Source and the recovery location. Recovery Location might not have enough free disk space available. Single-node cluster might be in read-only mode, due to an SSD failure. Resolution:Check network connection between the Source and the Recovery Location. Make sure that the Recovery Location has enough disk space available. Replace the failed SSD. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Replication time of the snapshot created at '[\S]*' "].iregexp("Replication time of the snapshot created at '[\S]*' ")}=1
trigger.name: VM Recovery Point Replication Time Exceeds RPO
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:vm Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Virtual Machine Scope:kCluster Title:VM Recovery Point Replication Time Exceeded the RPO Name:VM Recovery Point Replication Time Exceeds RPO Message:Replication time of the snapshot created at '{recovery_point_create_time}' UTC for VM {vm_name} exceeded the RPO limits. Description:VM Recovery Point Replication Time Exceeded the RPO Limit. Description:VM Recovery Point Replication Time Exceeded the RPO Limit. Causes:Latest replication took more time than the RPO limit. Resolution:Please check your network. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Container(s) [\S]* part of recovery point of entities, is/are not mou"].iregexp("Container(s) [\S]* part of recovery point of entities, is/are not mou")}=1
trigger.name: VM Recovery Storage Container Mount Check
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability Cluster Affected Entity Type:container Subcategory Type:Container-Internal Scope:kCluster Title:VM Recovery Storage Container(s) is/are not mounted on all hosts. Name:VM Recovery Storage Container Mount Check Message:Container(s) {container} part of recovery point of entities, is/are not mounted on all the hosts. Description:Verify that the Storage Container(s) is/are mounted on all the hosts. Description:Verify that the Storage Container(s) is/are mounted on all the hosts. Causes:Storage Container(s) is/are not mounted on all the hosts. Resolution:Mount the Storage Container(s) on all the hosts. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/7911

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Registration of virtual machine, [\S]*, failed because [\S]*"].iregexp("Registration of virtual machine, [\S]*, failed because [\S]*")}=1
trigger.name: VM Registration Failure
trigger.description: Category Type: Availability DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Data Protection-Virtual Machine Scope:kCluster Title:VM registration failed Name:VM Registration Failure Message:Registration of virtual machine, {vm_name}, failed because {reason} Description:VM Registration Failure Description:VM Registration Failure Causes:This might happen for several reasons. Check the alert message for more details. Resolution:Verify the existence of the VM in the snapshot and check whether any errors are reported in the hypervisor management software. Check the VM version and the maximum VM version supported by the host. If you cannot resolve the error, contact Nutanix support Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["VM with name [\S]* has been recovered successfully, however the followi"].iregexp("VM with name [\S]* has been recovered successfully, however the followi")}=1
trigger.name: VM Registration Warning
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator GuestVM Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Data Protection-Virtual Machine Scope:kCluster Title:VM Registration Warning Name:VM Registration Warning Message:VM with name {vm_name} has been recovered successfully, however the following issue was observed - {reason} Description:VM Registration caused warning Description:VM Registration caused warning Causes:Processor features may not be compatible. Resolution:Ensure that the recovered VM is working as expected. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Replication of Recovery Point created at [\S]* UTC f"].iregexp("Replication of Recovery Point created at [\S]* UTC f")}=1
trigger.name: VM Replication Expiry Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:vm Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Virtual Machine Scope:kCluster Title:Recovery Point expired prior to start of replication. Name:VM Replication Expiry Status Message:Replication of Recovery Point created at {recovery_point_create_time} UTC for VM {vm_name} to the recovery location {az_name} expired prior to start of replication. Description:Recovery Point expired prior to start of replication. Description:Recovery Point expired prior to start of replication. Causes:Previous Recovery Point replication took longer than RPO. Resolution:Review the RPO and retention time of the Recovery Point based on available bandwidth. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Replication of VM Recovery Point created at [\S]* UT"].iregexp("Replication of VM Recovery Point created at [\S]* UT")}=1
trigger.name: VM Replication Failure
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:vm Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Virtual Machine Scope:kCluster Title:VM Replication Failure Name:VM Replication Failure Message:Replication of VM Recovery Point created at {recovery_point_create_time} UTC for VM {vm_name} to the Recovery Location {availability_zone_physical_name} failed. Description:VM Replication Failure Description:VM Replication Failure Causes:(A) Remote cluster is in read only state. (B) Remote Availability Zone does not support PowerPC architecture. (C) Replication of Recovery Point with dedup entity to a Recovery Availability Zone without dedup support is not allowed. (D) Remote Availability Zone does not support Volume Groups. (E) Replication of Recovery Point with VMs having attached File Level Restore (FLR) disks to a Recovery Availability Zone without FLR support is not allowed. Resolution:Resolve the stated reason for the failure. If you cannot resolve the error, contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to restore VM: '[\S]*' due to [\S]*."].iregexp("Failed to restore VM: '[\S]*' due to [\S]*.")}=1
trigger.name: VM Restoration Failed
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:vm Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Virtual Machine Scope:kCluster Title:VM Restoration Failed. Name:VM Restoration Failed Message:Failed to restore VM: '{vm_name}' due to {reason}. Description:VM Restoration Failed. Description:VM Restoration Failed. Causes:Snapshot is not present. VM Restoration failed due to Internal error. Resolution:Retry the VM Restoration operation with different snapshot. Retry the VM Restoration operation. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/8487

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to replicate the VM: '[\S]*' synchronously since '[\S]*'."].iregexp("Failed to replicate the VM: '[\S]*' synchronously since '[\S]*'.")}=1
trigger.name: VM SyncRep Container not found
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:vm Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Virtual Machine Scope:kCluster Title:VM SyncRep Container not found Name:VM SyncRep Container not found Message:Failed to replicate the VM: '{vm_name}' synchronously since '{details}'. Description:VM SyncRep container is not found at the target cluster Description:VM SyncRep container is not found at the target cluster Causes:Container does not exist or it is marked to be removed at the target cluster. Resolution:Retry the VM SyncRep operation after creating the missing container at target cluster. If this situation persists, contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to [\S]* volume group with name '[\S]*' and internal ID '{vg_"].iregexp("Failed to [\S]* volume group with name '[\S]*' and internal ID '{vg_")}=1
trigger.name: Volume Group Action Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Storage Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Volume Group Action Error Name:Volume Group Action Status Message:Failed to {action} volume group with name '{vg_name}' and internal ID '{vg_uuid}' because {reason} in protection domain '{protection_domain_name}' Description:Volume group action error. Description:Volume group action error. Causes:A volume group could not be restored or could not be deleted because it is still in use. Resolution:Detach the volume group from VMs and external initiators before recovery. Resolve the stated reason for the failure. If you cannot resolve the error, contact Nutanix support. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/10120

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["[\S]* for the protection domain '[\S]*'."].iregexp("[\S]* for the protection domain '[\S]*'.")}=1
trigger.name: Volume Group Attachments Not Restored
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:protection_domain Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Protection Domain Scope:kCluster Title:Volume Group Attachments Not Restored Name:Volume Group Attachments Not Restored Message:{error_message} for the protection domain '{protection_domain_name}'. Description:Volume Group Attachments Not Restored. Description:Volume Group Attachments Not Restored. Causes:Acropolis failed to attach volume groups to the VMs. Resolution:Manually attach volume groups to the VMs. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to protect Volume Group: '[\S]*', because of '[\S]*"].iregexp("Failed to protect Volume Group: '[\S]*', because of '[\S]*")}=1
trigger.name: Volume Group Protection Failed
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:vg Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Disk Scope:kCluster Title:Volume Group Protection Failed. Name:Volume Group Protection Failed Message:Failed to protect Volume Group: '{volume_group_name}', because of '{reason}'. Description:Volume Group protection failed. Description:Volume Group protection failed. Causes:Nutanix Data Protection service error occurred. Resolution:Volume Group protection will get retriggered. If issue persists, please contact nutanix support. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/10560

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to protect Volume Group: '[\S]*', because of '{"].iregexp("Failed to protect Volume Group: '[\S]*', because of '{")}=1
trigger.name: Volume Group Protection Failed On PC
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Disk Scope:kCluster Title:Volume Group Protection Failed Name:Volume Group Protection Failed On PC Message:Failed to protect Volume Group: '{volume_group_config_name}', because of '{reason}'. Description:Volume Group protection failed. Description:Volume Group protection failed. Causes:Data Protection service error occurred. Resolution:Volume Group protection will get retriggered. If issue persists, please contact Nutanix Support. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/11308

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to capture the Recovery Point for Volume Group '[\S]*'"].iregexp("Failed to capture the Recovery Point for Volume Group '[\S]*'")}=1
trigger.name: Volume Group Recovery Point Failed
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:vg Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Services Scope:kCluster Title:Volume Group Recovery Point Creation Failed. Name:Volume Group Recovery Point Failed Message:Failed to capture the Recovery Point for Volume Group '{volume_group_name}'. Description:Volume Group Recovery Point creation failed. Description:Volume Group Recovery Point creation failed. Causes:Nutanix Data Protection service error occurred. Resolution:Retry the Volume Group Recovery Point operation. If issue persists please contact Nutanix Support. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Failed to replicate recovery point created at: [\S]*"].iregexp("Failed to replicate recovery point created at: [\S]*")}=1
trigger.name: Volume Group Recovery Point Replication Failed
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:vg Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Disk Scope:kCluster Title:Volume Group Recovery Point Replication Failed. Name:Volume Group Recovery Point Replication Failed Message:Failed to replicate recovery point created at: {recovery_point_create_time} UTC of the volume group: {volume_group_name} to the recovery location: {availability_zone_physical_name}. Description:Volume Group Recovery Point replication failed. Description:Volume Group Recovery Point replication failed. Causes:Network Connectivity issues between the Primary and the Recovery Availability Zone. Data Protection and Replication service is not working as expected. The service could be down. Volume Group migration process is in progress. Virtual IP address has not been configured on the remote cluster. Remote clusters are unhealthy. Resolution:Check network connection between the Primary and the Recovery Availability Zone. Contact Nutanix support. Retry the Recovery Point replication operation after the migration is complete. Configure the Virtual IP address and then retry the Recovery Point replication operation. For a manually initiated Volume Group Recovery Point replication, retry again. For a scheduled Volume Group Recovery Point replication, ensure all the emote clusters are healthy. Then wait for the next scheduled Recovery Point replication. Nutanix KB:http://portal.nutanix.com/kb/10754

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["[\S]* VPC VM(s) detected in Flow Security Policy [\S]* ({network_"].iregexp("[\S]* VPC VM(s) detected in Flow Security Policy [\S]* ({network_")}=1
trigger.name: VPC VMs detected in Flow Security Policy
trigger.description: Category Type: Configuration ControllerVM Cluster Affected Entity Type:cluster Subcategory Type:CVM-Network Scope:kCluster Title:VPC VMs detected in Flow Security Policy Name:VPC VMs detected in Flow Security Policy Message:{num_vms} VPC VM(s) detected in Flow Security Policy {rule_name} ({network_security_rule_uuid}). VMs: {vms}. Flow Security Policies will not be enforced for the affected VMs. Description:VMs that have NICs in one or more VPCs have been detected that are also part of a Flow Security Policy. This Security Policy will not be enforced for these VMs. Description:VMs that have NICs in one or more VPCs have been detected that are also part of a Flow Security Policy. This Security Policy will not be enforced for these VMs. Causes:VMs with NICs in VPC subnets have been placed into Flow Security Policies. Resolution:Remove the affected VMs from VPC subnets for Flow Security Policies to be enforced on these VMs. Nutanix KB:

trigger.expression: {Template Nutanix SNMP:snmptrap["Application-Consistent Recovery Point created at {recovery_point_create_tim"].iregexp("Application-Consistent Recovery Point created at {recovery_point_create_tim")}=1
trigger.name: VSS Recovery Point Status
trigger.description: Category Type: SystemIndicator DR Affected Entity Type:vm Subcategory Type:Data Protection-Virtual Machine Scope:kCluster Title:Application-Consistent Recovery Point Failed Name:VSS Recovery Point Status Message:Application-Consistent Recovery Point created at {recovery_point_create_time} UTC for the VM {vm_name} failed because {reason}.
